title: Major League Cricket in the US Receives List
body:
“The ICC Grants List-A Status to Major League Cricket in the US – Promoting the Game in a Major Sports Market”

The International Cricket Council (ICC) has granted official List-A status to Major League Cricket (MLC) matches in the US in its second season, marking a significant move to promote the sport in one of the biggest sports markets. This decision comes just a week before MLC kicks off its second season and less than a week before the Americas host the T20 World Cup.

MLC is now recognized as the official T20 league in America, making it the country’s first world-class domestic tournament. With this new status, every century, half-century, run-out, win, loss, and championship will be officially documented in an internationally recognized format of the game.

The CEO of MLC, Vijay Srinivasan, recently announced plans to expand the tournament from 19 games in 2023 to 34 by 2025. He expressed excitement about the growth of cricket in the US and the upcoming season of MLC, which has gained popularity among American sports fans.

Sanctioned by USA Cricket, MLC attracted players from around the world in its inaugural season, with teams like Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and the Washington Freedom participating. The granting of List-A status to MLC reflects the league’s commitment to delivering premier cricket in the United States and providing local players with international recognition.

Overall, this development is a significant step forward in the growth and development of cricket in the US, and it is expected to further enhance the popularity of the sport in the country.
summary:
* The International Cricket Council (ICC) has granted List-A status to Major League Cricket (MLC) matches in the US, making it the country's first world-class domestic tournament.
* This recognition means that every century, half-century, run-out, win, loss, and championship will be officially documented in an internationally recognized format.
* The MLC is scheduled to kick off its second season and has plans to expand from 19 games in 2023 to 34 by 2025.
* The league features six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and the Washington Freedom, and has attracted players from around the world.
* The granting of List-A status reflects the league's commitment to delivering premier cricket in the United States and providing local players with international recognition.
* This development is expected to further enhance the popularity of cricket in the US.

title: Major League Cricket scores big with List A Status from ICC; Alarm bells for ECB, CA
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC), the young American T20 league, has taken a significant step towards legitimacy by earning List A status from the ICC. This means official player statistics from the MLC will now be recognized alongside other major T20 leagues worldwide.

Recognition for Growing Tournament

“We are really excited for the news,” said tournament director Justin Geale. This recognition from the ICC validates the quality of players and the high standard of competition in the MLC.

This status boost will not only enhance the credibility of cricket in the USA but also ensures “the performances of some of the world’s best players are adequately reflected in their career statistics,” Geale added.

Expansion and scheduling ambitions of MLC

The upcoming season, kicking off on July 5th, will see the MLC expand its footprint. Plans are in place to grow from the current six teams to ten over the next few years, with a corresponding increase in matches from 19 to 34 by 2025.

MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan also revealed their ideal calendar would involve an earlier June start, potentially capitalizing on the American school holidays and avoiding clashes with other major leagues. However, this could lead to some overlap with England’s T20 Blast.

Alarm bells for ECB, CA

With several MLC teams owned by IPL franchises, there’s a chance of player overlap with England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) owned The Hundred, another T20 league starting in late July. As many as half of the Hundred’s overseas players might arrive late due to their MLC commitments.

The Cricket Australia (CA) will also be looking at this development regarding MLC with sharp eyes as USA’s T20 league will be direct competitor of CA’s Big Bash League (BBL) in future.

Bright Future for cricket in USA

Despite these potential scheduling hurdles, the MLC’s List A status and ambitious expansion plans are positive signs for the growth of cricket in the USA. The upcoming season promises more high-quality cricket and paves the way for a more established American T20 league in the years to come.
summary:
**Recognition and Legitimacy**: MLC has earned List A status from the ICC, which means its player statistics will be recognized globally alongside other major T20 leagues.

**Expansion and Scheduling**: The upcoming season, starting on July 5th, will see MLC expand from 6 to 10 teams over the next few years, with a corresponding increase in matches from 19 to 34 by 2025. The ideal schedule would involve an earlier June start, potentially conflicting with England's T20 Blast.

**Implications for other Leagues**: MLC's growth may affect other leagues, such as ECB's The Hundred, with potential player overlap, and Cricket Australia's Big Bash League, which may face competition from MLC in the future.

**Positive Outlook**: Despite potential scheduling hurdles, MLC's List A status and expansion plans are positive signs for the growth of cricket in the USA, promising more high-quality cricket and a more established American T20 league in the years to come.

title: More Teams for Major League Cricket; England Risks Losing Key Players • ProBatsman
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) in the USA is expanding rapidly, and this could be a problem for English cricket. MLC started small with a 19-game season, but they are planning to nearly double the number of games by 2025.

They are also adding more teams and getting important recognition from cricket’s governing body. Currently, a total of six teams participate in Major League Cricket, out of which four are acquired by the owners of Chennai Super Kings, Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals.

Expanding Major League Cricket is a big deal because it just got a major upgrade – their matches will now be considered important official games. This attracts better players and more attention. Plus, MLC has powerful investors, including people behind the famous Indian Premier League.

MLC wants their season to start in June, which overlaps with England’s key T20 Blast competition. This could mean English teams lose players who are tempted by the money and prestige of the US-based tournament.

England is considering allowing private investment in their new Hundred tournament, similar to MLC. But decisions are slow, and MLC’s success might push England to act faster.

Overall, MLC’s growth is good news for cricket fans in the US, but it could make things tougher for English cricket in the long run.
summary:
* MLC is expanding rapidly, with plans to nearly double the number of games from 19 to around 38 by 2025.
* The tournament is growing in recognition, with the International Cricket Council (ICC) considering MLC matches as official games, attracting better players and more attention.
* The league currently has six teams, four of which are owned by the owners of prominent Indian Premier League teams (Chennai Super Kings, Mumbai Indians, and Delhi Capitals).
* MLC's success may pose a threat to English cricket, as their proposed June start date overlaps with England's T20 Blast competition, potentially luring English players with higher pay and prestige.
* MLC's growth may accelerate England's consideration of private investment in their own Hundred tournament, similar to MLC's model.

Overall, MLC's expansion is good news for cricket fans in the US, but may create challenges for English cricket in the long run.

title: ICC's big announcement, this cricket league given List
body:
Major League Cricket: The International Cricket Council has taken a big decision. The ICC has granted List A status to an associate-run franchise league. This cricket league is none other than the Major League Cricket (MLC) played in the United States. MLC has become the second associate-run franchise competition to receive List A status from the ICC, before this UAE’s ILT-20 also received List A status.

MLC gets List-A status

Major League Cricket received a lot of love from fans in its first season last year. After the great success of the first season, the schedule for the second season of the league has been released. The second edition of Major League Cricket is going to start from July 5. Its final match will be played on July 28. Getting List A status before the start of the second season is a big achievement for Major League Cricket.

What changes will come after getting List-A status?

List-A status means that the MLC will now be recognised as an official T20 league, with records from playing the tournament now counting towards official format statistics. Previously, records made in the league were not counted in T20 cricket. Speaking to ESPNcricinfo, tournament director Justin Gayle said, “We are very excited by this news as it is a recognition of the standard and high quality of players participating in the tournament. I am grateful to the ICC for taking the time to consider this.”

3 IPL franchises are part of MLC

Major Cricket League is America’s first professional T20 championship. A total of 6 teams played in the first season of this tournament. In which 3 IPL franchises bought their teams, which include MI New York, Los Angeles Knight Riders and Texas Super Kings. Apart from this, teams of San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orkers and Washington Freedom are part of this league.

title: Unis obtient le statut de liste A par la CCI
body:
2024-05-28 09:51:49

La Major League Cricket (MLC) des États-Unis est devenue le deuxième tournoi de franchise associée, après la Ligue internationale T20 des Émirats arabes unis, à recevoir le statut de liste A de l’International Cricket Council (ICC). Cette nouvelle désignation reconnaît la MLC comme une ligue officielle T20, les records de tournoi contribuant désormais aux statistiques officielles du format.

Le directeur du tournoi MLC, Justin Geale, a exprimé son enthousiasme face à cette décision, déclarant : « Nous sommes ravis de la reconnaissance du haut niveau et de la qualité des joueurs participant au tournoi. En attribuant le statut de liste A à la MLC pour la saison à venir, cela reconnaît la force et la stature croissante du tournoi et renforce finalement la crédibilité du sport aux États-Unis à l’échelle mondiale », a déclaré Geale à ESPNcricinfo.

Geale a également remercié l’ICC d’avoir pris en compte la nature unique du cricket aux États-Unis. « L’aspect le plus important pour moi est de garantir que les performances de certains des meilleurs joueurs du monde se reflètent avec précision dans leurs statistiques de carrière. Nous sommes reconnaissants à l’ICC d’avoir pris le temps d’examiner ce sujet, car le cricket aux États-Unis ne s’inscrit pas toujours dans un modèle conventionnel. En tant que nation associée avec une opportunité unique devant nous, nous espérons que la prochaine Coupe du Monde et une saison réussie nous aideront à continuer à construire une plate-forme pour que le sport se développe et prospère aux États-Unis », a ajouté Geale.

Dans la prochaine saison 2 de la MLC, les champions en titre du MI New York, dirigés par la superstar du T20 des Antilles Kieron Pollard, affronteront les finalistes de 2023, les Orcas de Seattle, dirigés par le polyvalent sud-africain Wayne Parnell, lors du match d’ouverture le 5 juillet. La deuxième saison marque une étape importante dans l’histoire du cricket T20 aux États-Unis. S’appuyant sur la dynamique de sa saison inaugurale 2023, la MLC a élargi le tournoi en ajoutant six matches de championnat supplémentaires en raison de la forte demande. La série éliminatoire de quatre matchs, qui se déroulera à Grand Prairie, au Texas, promet de captiver les fans de cricket du monde entier.

Les Super Kings du Texas, dirigés par l’élégant sud-africain Faf du Plessis, affronteront les LA Knight Riders du antillais Sunil Narine au Grand Prairie Stadium spécialement construit à Grand Prairie, Texas, le 5 juin, selon un MLC. communiqué de presse. Le week-end d’ouverture mettra également en vedette les Australiens de Washington Freedom, dont Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head et l’entraîneur Ricky Ponting, qui affronteront le MI New York le samedi 6 juillet. Les San Francisco Unicorns, avec le percutant ouvreur néo-zélandais Finn Allen accueillera les LA Knight Riders le dimanche 7 juillet au Grand Prairie Stadium, au Texas.

title: USA's Major League Cricket Granted List A Status By ICC
body:
The United States Major League Cricket (MLC) has become the second Associate Franchise Tournament, following the United Arab Emirates’ International League T20, to receive List A status from the International Cricket Council (ICC). This new designation recognizes the MLC as an official T20 league, with tournament records now contributing to official format statistics.

MLC Tournament Director Justin Geale expressed his excitement about the decision, stating, “We are thrilled with the recognition of the high standard and quality of players participating in the tournament. By awarding MLC List A status for the upcoming season, it acknowledges the strength and growing stature of the tournament and ultimately enhances the credibility of the sport in the USA on a global scale,” Geale told ESPNcricinfo.

Geale also thanked the ICC for considering the unique nature of cricket in the USA. “The most important aspect for me is that it ensures the performances of some of the world’s best players are accurately reflected in their career statistics. We are grateful to the ICC for taking the time to review this, as cricket in the USA doesn’t always fit into a conventional template. As an Associate nation with a unique opportunity ahead of us, we hope that the upcoming World Cup and a successful season will help us continue to build a platform for the sport to grow and thrive in the USA,” Geale added.

In the upcoming MLC season 2, reigning champions MI New York, led by West Indies T20 superstar Kieron Pollard, will face the 2023 runners-up Seattle Orcas, captained by South African all-rounder Wayne Parnell, in the opening game on July 5. The second season marks a significant milestone in the history of T20 cricket in the United States. Building on the momentum of its inaugural 2023 season, MLC has expanded the tournament by adding six extra league matches due to high demand. The four-game playoff series, to be hosted in Grand Prairie, Texas, promises to captivate cricket fans worldwide.

The Texas Super Kings, led by the classy South African Faf du Plessis, will compete against West Indian off-spinner Sunil Narine’s LA Knight Riders at the purpose-built Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, on June 5, according to an MLC press release. The opening weekend also features the Australian-stacked Washington Freedom, including Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and coach Ricky Ponting, facing MI New York on Saturday, July 6. The San Francisco Unicorns, with hard-hitting New Zealand opener Finn Allen, will host the LA Knight Riders on July 7, Sunday, at Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.

title: USA's Major League Cricket acquires List A status from ICC
body:
Dubai [UAE], May 28 : The United States Major League Cricket became the second Associate Franchise Tournament after the United Arab Emirate's International League T20 to acquire List A status from the International Cricket Council (ICC).

With this new status, the MLC will be acknowledged as a legitimate T20 league, and tournament playing records will now be used to calculate official format statistics.

The tournament director, Justin Geale expressed his feelings following the decision.

"We are really excited for the news, as it's a recognition of the standard and high quality of players taking part in the tournament. By awarding MLC List A status for the upcoming season, it helps to acknowledge the strength and growing stature of the tournament and ultimately will help to enhance the credibility of the sport in the USA on a global scale," Geale told ESPNcricinfo.

The director further stated that he is thankful to the ICC for taking out time, and look at the cricket in the USA.

"The most important part for me, though, is it ensures the performances of some of the world's best players alongside their peers are adequately reflected in their career statistics. Really thankful to the ICC for taking the time to look at it as cricket in the USA doesn't always fit into a template. We are an Associate nation and proud of that, one with a unique opportunity in front of us. It's our hope that on the back of the upcoming World Cup and a successful season, we can continue to build a platform for the sport to grow and ultimately succeed in the USA," Geale added.

Coming MLC season 2, reigning champions MI New York, led by West Indies T20 superstar Kieron Pollard against the runners-up of 2023, Seattle Orcas, captained by South African all-rounder Wayne Parnell clash in the opening game on July 5.

The second season of the tournament is a significant milestone in the history of T20 cricket in the United States. Building on the momentum of its inaugural 2023 season, MLC has extended the tournament due to demand with an extra six league matches. The four-game playoff series, to be hosted in Grand Prairie, Texas, is set to captivate cricket fans across the globe.

The Texas Super Kings, spearheaded by classy South African Faf du Plessis, will take on West Indian off-spinner Sunil Narine's LA Knight Riders at the purpose-built Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas on June 5 as well, as per an MLC press release.

The opening weekend also features the Australian-stacked Washington Freedom featuring Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and coach Ricky Ponting, facing MI New York on Saturday, July 6. The San Francisco Unicorns, bolstered by hard-hitting opening New Zealand batter Finn Allen, will host the LA Knight Riders on July 7, Sunday, at Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.
summary:
* The MLC has been granted List A status by the International Cricket Council (ICC), making it a legitimate T20 league and allowing tournament playing records to be used to calculate official format statistics.
* The tournament director, Justin Geale, expressed excitement and gratitude towards the ICC for recognizing the standard and quality of players participating in the tournament.
* The upcoming season of MLC is significant, with the opening game featuring reigning champions MI New York against Seattle Orcas on July 5.
* The tournament has been extended due to demand, with an extra six league matches and a four-game playoff series to be hosted in Grand Prairie, Texas.
* Other notable matches in the opening weekend include Texas Super Kings vs. LA Knight Riders on June 5, Washington Freedom vs. MI New York on July 6, and San Francisco Unicorns vs. LA Knight Riders on July 7.

title: ICC Grants List-A Status To USA's Major League Cricket: A Boost For Players
body:
Cricket

-OneArabia

By OneArabia

San Francisco, May 28: In a significant development for Major League Cricket (MLC) Season 2, the International Cricket Council (ICC) on Tuesday granted List A status to the matches in the domestic T20 competition. This move aims to promote cricket in one of the largest sports markets.

The ICC's decision comes nearly a month before MLC commences its second season and less than a week before the Americas (USA and West Indies) host the T20 World Cup 2024, starting June 1.

The ICC's move officially recognises MLC as America's first world-class domestic T20 league. "Now, every century, half-century, 'ﬁve-for', run-out, win, loss, and championship will be documented as official career statistics in an internationally recognised format of the game," said MLC in a statement.

The official status of MLC provides local US players and emerging stars with opportunities for international recognition, furthering the development of domestic talent in the country.

"The List-A status comes after MLC's successful inaugural season and underscores its unwavering dedication to delivering premier cricket in the United States," the statement added. MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan recently announced the expansion of the tournament from 19 games in 2023 to 34 by 2025.

"We saw cricket mania sweep across the US last year off the back of our inaugural season of Major League Cricket. Now, we take exciting momentum into the highly anticipated ICC T20 World Cup and season two of the MLC," said Srinivasan.

"With an unforgettable summer of cricket on our doorstep, we're ready to capture the hearts of American sports fans with our thrilling, adrenaline-charged game that is the most exciting emerging T20 tournament across the globe," he added.

Sanctioned by USA Cricket, MLC saw several players from across the world, including New Zealand and Australia among others, take part in the tournament last year. Six teams -- Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom -- featured in the inaugural edition.

Story first published: Tuesday, May 28, 2024, 17:24 [GST]
summary:
**Key Points:**

* The International Cricket Council (ICC) has granted List A status to the matches in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament, recognizing it as America's first world-class domestic T20 league.
* The List A status will allow for official documentation of player statistics, including centuries, half-centuries, five-fors, and other achievements.
* The recognition will provide opportunities for local US players and emerging stars to gain international recognition, promoting the development of domestic talent in the country.
* MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan has announced plans to expand the tournament from 19 games in 2023 to 34 games by 2025.
* The second season of MLC is set to commence soon, with six teams participating: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.

**Background:**

* MLC's inaugural season was successful, with players from around the world, including New Zealand and Australia, participating in the tournament.
* The tournament is sanctioned by USA Cricket.

title: Major League Cricket Granted List-A Status by ICC
body:
Major League Cricket has been granted List-A status by the International Cricket Council ahead of MLC’s second season which starts July 5, recognizing the league as an official T20 league ahead of the ICC T20 World Cup that starts this weekend in Texas.

In addition to List-A status, Major League Cricket Chief Executive Officer Vijay Srinivasan announced plans to expand from what began as a 19-game season in 2023 to a 34-game season by 2025. Six teams are part of this season’s schedule with matches held in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Morrisville, North Carolina.

“We saw cricket mania sweep across the U.S. last year off the back of our inaugural season of Major League Cricket,” Srinivasan said. “Now, we take exciting momentum into the highly anticipated ICC T20 World Cup and season two of the MLC. With an unforgettable summer of cricket on our doorstep, we’re ready to capture the hearts of American sports fans.”

The A-list status means all statistics in MLC matches will be documented as official career statistics in an internationally recognized format of the game. This will also provide American players the opportunity for international recognition.
summary:
* Major League Cricket (MLC) has been granted List-A status by the International Cricket Council (ICC) ahead of its second season, recognizing it as an official T20 league.
* The MLC's second season starts on July 5, with six teams participating in 34 matches held in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Morrisville, North Carolina.
* The List-A status means that statistics from MLC matches will be documented as official career statistics, allowing American players to gain international recognition.
* The league plans to expand from 19 games in 2023 to 34 games by 2025, according to MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan.

title: Major League Cricket’s Expansion Plan Poses A Threat To English Competitions
body:
Major League Cricket has announced ambitious new expansion plans for the sport in the US. In a move that will have significant implications for the landscape of professional sport in England, MLC, which started with a 19-match season, has confirmed it will expand to 34 matches by 2025. The league currently includes six franchises, but plans to have two more in the near future, and two more soon after. The announcement comes just after MLC was fully legitimized by the news that its matches have been granted List A status by the International Cricket Council.

“It was always intended to be a 10-team league,” MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan told The Guardian. “Research shows that we are a big enough country, with a big enough demographic to support ten teams, so that is our plan. We had 19 games in our first season and will have 25 in our second. I think we want to go to 34 next year and just gradually expand further.” The second season, which starts at the end of the World T20, lasts 23 days and overlaps with the Hundred. Next year’s edition will last considerably longer and start earlier. Srinivasan said MLC would like to play in June.

“Ultimately, our ideal calendar for us is to start much earlier, in late spring or early summer,” Srinivasan said. The tournament was postponed this year due to the Men’s T20 World Cup, which uses the MLC Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas. “With the Indian Premier League ending at the end of May, I think our best bet would be to start in early June, when we have the school holidays in the US, and then start in July. This is how we would like to decorate our shop window.” That would clash with the T20 Blast season, but the Hundred would run from late July to August.

English cricket has already had to adapt to sharing the summer with a rival league. Last year, Jason Roy gave up his England contract so he could take a job with the LA Knight Riders, while Surrey’s Sunil Narine skipped Surrey’s appearance on Blast final day as he also played for LA. Surrey’s director of cricket, Alec Stewart, said at the time that it was “disappointing and frustrating” to “lose a player of Narine’s quality late on”. Narine’s decision was a sobering reminder of the status of English domestic cricket.

The MLC’s expansion plans will also increase pressure on the English game to decide whether or not to bring private investment into the Hundred. The England and Wales Cricket Board, the 18 counties and Marylebone Cricket Club agreed this was the “direction of travel” for the match on May 10, but there is frustration at the slow progress. MLC boasts a formidable array of investors, including four IPL sides – the Kolkata Knight Riders, the Mumbai Indians, the Chennai Super Kings and the Delhi Capitals – as well as key business people such as Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella.

“All these people who came to us when we started five years ago have been hugely successful in other walks of life,” Srinivasan said. switch. The expectation was never that this would be an overnight transition. They have been extremely patient and supported us all the way.” MLC has already established a series of academies and a minor league system to develop local players. Work is now underway to develop more List A sites.

“We are not here to play a league and go away every year,” Srinivasan added. “We feel like our role is to build the infrastructure for cricket in the US. MLC is the means to an end, if you will. I think in ten years you will see a very different landscape for cricket in the US. We’ll have a very robust set of locations across the country, we’ll have a sort of home and away format for MLC, and we’ll have a much larger player pool in the system as a result. Hopefully this means we’ll have a very strong kind of American team as well. Those are all our ambitions.”
summary:
**Expansion Plans:** MLC has announced plans to expand from a 19-match season to 34 matches by 2025, with the ultimate goal of becoming a 10-team league. The league currently has six franchises, but plans to add two more in the near future, and two more soon after.

**List A Status:** MLC matches have been granted List A status by the International Cricket Council (ICC), further legitimizing the league.

**Season Schedule:** The second season will start at the end of the World T20 and overlap with the Hundred. The goal is to start the season earlier, in late spring or early summer, potentially in June.

**Impact on English Cricket:** The expansion of MLC is likely to increase pressure on English cricket to decide whether to bring private investment into the Hundred, a rival league.

**Investors and Infrastructure:** MLC boasts a strong array of investors, including four IPL sides and key business people. The league has established academies and a minor league system to develop local players and is working to develop more List A sites.

**Long-term Ambitions:** MLC aims to build a robust infrastructure for cricket in the US, with a home and away format, a larger player pool, and a strong American team.

The announcement comes just after MLC was fully legitimized by the news that its matches have been granted List A status by the International Cricket Council.

It was always intended to be a 10-team league, MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan told The Guardian. Research shows that we are a big enough country, with a big enough demographic to support ten teams, so that is our plan. We had 19 games in our first season and will have 25 in our second. I think we want to go to 34 next year, and just keep expanding gradually. The second season, which starts at the end of the Men's T20 World Cup, lasts 23 days and overlaps with the Hundred. Next year's edition will last considerably longer and start earlier. Srinivasan said MLC would like to play in June.

Ultimately, the ideal calendar for us is to start much earlier, in late spring or early summer, Srinivasan said. The tournament was postponed this year due to the T20 World Cup, which uses the MLCs Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas. With the Indian Premier League ending at the end of May, I think our best bet would be to start in early June, when we have the school holidays in the US, and then start in July. This is how we would like to decorate our window. That would clash with the T20 Blast season, but the Hundred would run from late July to August.

English cricket has already had to adapt to sharing the summer with a rival league. Last year, Jason Roy gave up his England contract so he could take a job with the LA Knight Riders, while Surrey's Sunil Narine skipped Surrey's appearance on Blast final day as he also played for LA. Surrey's director of cricket, Alec Stewart, said at the time that it was disappointing and frustrating to lose a player of Narine's quality late on. Narine's decision was a sobering reminder of the status of English domestic cricket.

The MLC's expansion plans will also increase pressure on the English game to decide whether or not to bring private investment into the Hundred. The England and Wales Cricket Board, the 18 counties and Marylebone Cricket Club agreed this was the direction of play for the match on May 10, but there is frustration at the slow progress. MLC boasts a formidable array of investors, including four IPL sides: the Kolkata Knight Riders, the Mumbai Indians, the Chennai Super Kings and the Delhi Capitals, as well as key business people such as Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella.

All these people who came on board when we started five years ago have been hugely successful in other walks of life, Srinivasan said. “You know they understand this isn't one of those things where you can just flip a switch. The expectation was never that this would be an overnight transition. They have been extremely patient and supported us all the way. MLC has already established a series of academies and a minor league system to develop local players. It is now working to develop more List A sites.

We are not here to play a league and go away every year, Srinivasan added. We feel like our role is to build the infrastructure for cricket in the US. MLC is the means to an end, if you will. I think in ten years you will see a very different landscape for cricket in the US. We have a very robust set of locations across the country, we have a sort of home-and-away format for MLC, and we have a much larger player pool in the system as a result. Hopefully this means we will have a very strong kind of American team as well. Those are all our ambitions.
summary:
**Expansion Plans:** MLC plans to expand its season from 19 matches to 34 matches by 2025, with an intermediate step of 25 matches in the second season. The league currently has six franchises, but aims to add two more in the near future and another two soon after, eventually reaching its goal of 10 teams.

**Schedule:** The second season will start at the end of the Men's T20 World Cup and will last 23 days, overlapping with the Hundred. The ideal calendar for MLC is to start in late spring or early summer, with a goal to start in early June and last longer than the current season.

**Impact on English Cricket:** MLC's expansion plans may increase pressure on English cricket to consider private investment in the Hundred, which could lead to a rival league. English cricket has already had to adapt to sharing the summer with a rival league, as seen with players like Jason Roy and Sunil Narine choosing to play in the MLC instead of English domestic cricket.

**Investment and Infrastructure:** MLC boasts a strong array of investors, including four IPL teams and key businesspeople like Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella. The league has established academies and a minor league system to develop local players and is working to develop more List A sites.

title: Major League Cricket releases Seattle Orcas' 2024 schedule
body:
SEATTLE - In less than two months, Major League Cricket (MLC) returns to the United States with the start of the 2024 season.

The T20 cricket action starts on July 5 with the reigning champions, MI New York, led by Kieron Pollard from the West Indies, against the runners-up, Seattle Orcas, with South African standouts Wayne Parnell and Quinton de Kock. They play at Church Street Park in Morrisville, NC.

A later game that day features South Africa's Faf du Plessis guiding the Texas Super Kings against Sunil Narine's LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

The season goes until July 28.

"We are incredibly excited to unveil the schedule for the 2024 season," said Cognizant Major League Cricket’s CEO Vijay Srinivasan.

Keep scrolling for the full 2024 schedule.

Last year's venues, including upgraded Church Street Park and the new Grand Prairie Stadium, will host the 2024 events, further cementing these locations as cricket hubs.

Srinivasan expressed his eagerness to see fans' passion as they continue to build the sport's profile in the United States. The league has secured impressive talents such as Andre Russell, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan, alongside acclaimed coaches like Ricky Ponting, Shane Watson and Stephen Fleming.

2024 Major League Cricket schedule

Click to open this PDF in a new window.

Fueled by the excitement of the ICC T20 World Cup hosted in the U.S. in June, MLC aims to elevate cricket's stature in American sports culture.

Tickets will soon be available for purchase. Fans interested in attending should register for pre-sale to guarantee their chance to experience the highly sought-after cricket action firsthand. MLC has additional details and the complete schedule on their website.

body:
Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) has announced its schedule for the 2042 season today.

For the new season, Major League Cricket has extended the tournament with am extra six league matches, as the four-game playoff series for the tournament is set to be hosted in Grand Prairie, Texas.

The 2024 season will commence with two matches across the country on July 5th, headlined by MLC’s reigning champions, MI New York, featuring their elite West Indian batter Kieron Pollard, who will face off against 2023 runners-up Seattle Orcas headlined by star South African pair Wayne Parnell and Quinton de Kock, at Church Street Park in Morrisville.

The opening weekend will feature the Australian-stacked Washington Freedom featuring Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and coach Ricky Ponting, facing MI New York on Saturday, July 6.

“This promises to be our most thrilling season yet, with each of the MLC’s six teams actively recruiting in the off-season, adding a host of world-class player signings to their team rosters with more big names to be soon announced.”

Off the back of Major League Cricket’s first season and a momentum boost from the ICC T20 World Cup in the U.S. in June – the 2024 season promises to make leaps and bounds for the culture of cricket in the North American subcontinent. title: Batter up: Snubbed Smith’s plan to return a week after World Cup final alongside ex-teammates
body:
Steve Smith will make his return to the crease along two Australian stars in the United States less than a week after the final of the T20 World Cup he was overlooked for is decided in the Caribbean.

The former Australian captain will be joined by World Cup-bound teammates Glenn Maxwell and Travis Head when the Washington Freedom play NI New York on July 6, a day after the month-long tournament begins.

The ICC Cricketer of the Year in 2015 fell short of convincing selectors he could prove a matchwinner in the T20 World Cup being hosted by the West Indies and the United States in June as Australia seeks to create history in the tournament.

Watch every match of the 2024 IPL Season and Playoffs LIVE on Kayo. New to Kayo? Start Your Free Trial Today >

Australia is seeking to become the first nation to be crowned champions in all three formats of cricket at the same time after claiming the World Test Championship last June over India and the ODI World Cup last November. Smith featured in both teams.

The champion cricketer, who has a base in New York, adds to the star factor in the second edition of Major League Cricket and is a key signing for the competition.

The three Australians will play under the guidance of Australian great Ricky Ponting for Washington in the tournament, which will be held in North Carolina and Texas.

Ponting is currently coaching the Delhi Capitals, which features Jake Fraser-McGurk and David Warner, in the Indian Premier League.

The American competition has an expanded schedule this year, with an additional six games, in another sign of the growing interest in cricket in the US. The MLC competition also features teams representing Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle and Texas, with players including West Indians Kieron Pollard and Andre Russell, Kiwi Trent Boult and Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan.

Ponting’s former teammate Shane Watson coaches the San Francisco Unicorns in the competition.

MLC chief executive Vijay Srinivasan said the participation of players the calibre of Smith, Maxwell and Head would help the sport grow in the US, with the organisation hoping to invest in further cricket infrastructure across America.

“This promises to be our most thrilling season yet, with each of the MLC’s six teams actively recruiting in the off-season, adding a host of world-class player signings to their team rosters with more big names to be soon announced,” he said.

“Last year, we unveiled MLC at the newly upgraded Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, and the brand new Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, which will both once again co-host the 2024 tournament, building on the impact of season one in those communities.

“These venues will deliver world-class pitches and a vibrant atmosphere to support the overall MLC fan experience. Moreover, we are committed to exploring expansion opportunities with new cricket venues to support our six teams’ growing American fanbase.”

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Schedule Out; Last Year's Finalists Face-Off In The Opener
body:
Major League Cricket 2024's schedule is released (x.com)

After a successful inaugural season in 2023, Major League Cricket (MLC) is all set to start the second season in 2024 which will commence from July 5 to July 28.

Unlike the first season's 15 league games, this season will have 21 matches in the first round of the tournament followed by four playoff games.

In the opener of the season, on the 5th of July, the defending champions MI New York, led by Kieron Pollard will take on last year's runner-ups, Seattle Orcas, led by Wayne Parnell in Church Street Park, Morrisville at 01.00 hours (IST).

Later on the same day, Faf du Plesiss' Texas Super Kings will face Sunil Narine-led Los Angeles Knight Riders in Grand Prairie, Dallas at 06.00 hours (IST).

Dallas' Grand Prairie stadium will host all four playoff games from July 25 to July 29.

Check Full MLC 2024 Schedule:

MLC 2024 schedule

MLC 2024 schedule

MLC 2024 schedule

MLC 2024 schedule

In the inaugural season of MLC in 2023, MI New York's Nicholas Pooran top scored in the tournament with 388 runs in 8 innings followed by his IPL teammate Quinton de Kock at 264 in 7 innings. Pooran was also adjudged as the Player of The Tournament.

Trent Boult, MI New York's lead pacer was the highest wicket-taker of the season with 22 wickets in 8 games followed by the Aussie duo of Cameron Gannon and Andrew Tye at joint-second with 11 wickets each.
summary:
**Schedule:** The 2024 season of Major League Cricket will take place from July 5 to July 28.

**Format:** The tournament will have 21 matches in the first round, followed by four playoff games.

**Opening Matches:** The season will start with two matches on July 5: defending champions MI New York (led by Kieron Pollard) vs. Seattle Orcas (led by Wayne Parnell), and Texas Super Kings (led by Faf du Plessis) vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders (led by Sunil Narine).

**Playoff Venue:** All four playoff games will be held at the Grand Prairie stadium in Dallas from July 25 to July 28.

**Previous Season Highlights:** In the inaugural season of MLC in 2023, Nicholas Pooran of MI New York was the top scorer with 388 runs and was also named Player of the Tournament. Trent Boult of MI New York was the highest wicket-taker with 22 wickets.

title: Major League Cricket announces the complete schedule for MLC 2024
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) is gearing up for its second season, kicking off on July 5. This year’s edition will be bigger with six additional league matches, according to the organizers who announced the tournament’s schedule on Tuesday.

Following the league stage, excitement will continue with a four-match playoff series to be held in Grand Prairie, Texas.

Six teams to compete for the coveted title

The format remains the same as the first season, featuring six teams: MI New York, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns.

Defending champions MI New York will clash with the 2023 runner-up Seattle Orcas in the opening game on July 5. Later that same day, Texas Super Kings will battle it out against LA Knight Riders in Texas.

The tournament finale is scheduled for July 28.

title: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 schedule announced
body:
The Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 is all set to kick off on Friday, July 5. Six teams - MI New York, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns will be vying for the title with the final slated to be held on July 28.

The Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina and the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas will host this year's matches.

With the United States of America all set to co-host an ICC tournament for the very first time - the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup along with the West Indies, the upcoming edition of the MLC assumes greater significance. The nation will be gripped with exciting T20 action in June and July.

"It demonstrates the depth of talent being attracted to the league" - MLC CEO

MI New York went on to become the champions of the inaugural edition of the league last year, defeating the Seattle Orcas by seven wickets in the final. Chasing 184 runs for the title, the Kieron Pollard-led franchise won the game with four overs to spare.

Stand-in captain and wicketkeeper batter Nicholas Pooran top-scored for the side in the summit clash, smashing an unbeaten 137* off just 55 balls which included ten fours and thirteen sixes.

Expressing his thoughts about the upcoming edition of the league, the CEO of Major Cricket League asserted that it is going to be an exciting season with all six teams actively looking to bolster their squads by roping in top cricketing stars.

An elated Mr. Vijay Srinivasan said:

"We are incredibly excited to unveil the schedule for the 2024 season. This promises to be our most thrilling season yet, with each of the MLC's six teams actively recruiting in the off-season, adding a host of world-class player signings to their team rosters with more big names to be soon announced."

"With some of world cricket's biggest current stars and seasoned veterans involved, it demonstrates the depth of talent being attracted to the league."
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* The MLC 2024 tournament is set to begin on July 5 and will feature six teams: MI New York, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, Washington Freedom, and San Francisco Unicorns.
* The final match will take place on July 28.
* The tournament will be held at two venues: Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Significance of the Tournament**

* The MLC 2024 assumes greater significance as the United States is set to co-host the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup with the West Indies.
* The tournament will feature exciting T20 action in June and July.

**Last Year's Winner**

* MI New York won the inaugural edition of the league, defeating Seattle Orcas by seven wickets in the final.
* Nicholas Pooran top-scored in the final with an unbeaten 137* off 55 balls.

**Expectations for the Upcoming Season**

* The CEO of Major Cricket League, Vijay Srinivasan, is excited about the upcoming season, expecting it to be the most thrilling season yet.
* All six teams have actively recruited top cricketing stars, adding to their squads, and more big names are expected to be announced soon.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 schedule: All MLC fixtures
body:
Six teams will be in action in Major League Cricket 2024, scheduled to be held in the USA’s Texas and North Carolina from July 5 to 28.

Major League Cricket or MLC is a Twenty20 (T20) format cricket tournament and the American equivalent of the Indian Premier League. The inaugural MLC edition was held last year.

MI New York are the defending champions. They beat Seattle Orcas in the MLC 2023 final to become the inaugural Major League Cricket winners. The MLC 2024 season opener will witness a repeat of last year’s final as MI New York take on Seattle Orcas once again at Church Street Park in North Carolina.

Later on the same day, Texas Super Kings host the LA Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

Major League Cricket 2024 schedule

All in Indian Standard Time (IST)

The six teams will play 21 matches in a round-robin league format. The first 15 matches are split between the two venues - Church Street Park and Grand Prairie Stadium. The final six group matches and the knockout fixtures, however, will be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

The teams will play each other once in the league phase after which the top four sides will progress to the playoffs, which includes IPL-style qualifier and eliminator matches. The MLC 2024 final will be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium on July 29.

Four of the six MLC teams are owned by franchises of the Indian Premier League (IPL). This includes MI New York (Mumbai Indians), Texas Super Kings (Chennai Super Kings), LA Knight Riders (Kolkata Knight Riders) and the Seattle Orcas (Delhi Capitals). The other two teams are San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom.

All six teams will have some top international cricketers in their ranks for MLC 2024. MI New York boast West Indian batter Kieron Pollard in their roster while South African pair Wayne Parnell and Quinton de Kock will play for Seattle Orcas.

The Texas Super Kings squad is headlined by South African ace Faf du Plessis while West Indian off-spinner Sunil Narine will spearhead the LA Knight Riders campaign.

Washington Freedom, coached by Ricky Ponting, features a stacked Australian presence with Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell and Travis Head in their ranks. New Zealand batter Finn Allen has joined the San Francisco Unicorns.
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* MLC 2024 will be held from July 5 to 28 in Texas and North Carolina, USA.
* The tournament features six teams, with four teams owned by Indian Premier League (IPL) franchises.

**Teams and Schedule**

* The six teams are: MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom.
* The tournament will follow a round-robin league format, with each team playing each other once.
* The top four teams will progress to the playoffs, featuring IPL-style qualifier and eliminator matches.
* The final will be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas on July 29.

**Notable Players**

* MI New York: Kieron Pollard
* Seattle Orcas: Wayne Parnell, Quinton de Kock
* Texas Super Kings: Faf du Plessis
* LA Knight Riders: Sunil Narine
* Washington Freedom: Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head (coached by Ricky Ponting)
* San Francisco Unicorns: Finn Allen

title: Major League Cricket 2024 Schedule Revealed, MI New York Face Seattle Orcas On July 5 In Season Opener Of USA T20
body:
The schedule for Major League Cricket (MLC)'s 2024 season has been unveiled. The United States-based T20 league will feature six more league matches than last season, and the four-game playoff series will be hosted in Grand Prairie, Texas. The league commences on July 5 and ends on July 28. (Full IPL Coverage | More Cricket News)

The second MLC edition will begin with two matches on July 5th. MLC’s reigning champions MI New York will first face off against 2023 runners-up Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park in Morrisville. New York's line-up features West Indian batter Kieron Pollard, while Seattle have South African duo Wayne Parnell and Quinton de Kock in their midst.

In the second game, the Texas Super Kings, spearheaded by another South African Faf du Plessis, will take on West Indian off-spinner Sunil Narine’s LA Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

The opening weekend also features Washington Freedom (who have Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head and coach Ricky Ponting) facing MI New York on July 6. The San Francisco Unicorns, bolstered by hard-hitting opening New Zealand batter Finn Allen, will host the LA Knight Riders on July 7 at Grand Prairie Stadium.

Major League Cricket’s CEO Vijay Srinivasan said: "We are incredibly excited to unveil the schedule for the 2024 season. This promises to be our most thrilling season yet, with each of the MLC’s six teams actively recruiting in the off-season, adding a host of world-class player signings to their team rosters with more big names to be soon announced.

“With some of world cricket’s biggest current stars and seasoned veterans involved, including the likes of athletic Jamaican allrounder Andre Russell, New Zealand’s left-arm quick, Trent Boult, 2023 MLC Finals MVP Nicholas Pooran, Afghanistan's superstar spinner, Rashid Khan, together with cricketing royalty in coaches Ricky Ponting, Shane Watson and Stephen Fleming, it demonstrates the depth of talent being attracted to the league.”

Apart from the high-octane action on the field, MLC aims to support the long-term infrastructure to foster the growth of localized cricket communities while strengthening cricket’s presence in the US.

“Last year, we unveiled MLC at the newly upgraded Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, and the brand new Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, which will both once again co-host the 2024 tournament, building on the impact of season one in those communities,” Srinivasan said.

“These venues will deliver world-class pitches and a vibrant atmosphere to support the overall MLC fan experience. Moreover, we are committed to exploring expansion opportunities with new cricket venues to support our six teams’ growing American fanbase,” he added.
summary:
**Schedule**: The 2024 MLC season will take place from July 5 to July 28, featuring six more league matches than last season, with a four-game playoff series hosted in Grand Prairie, Texas.

**Teams and Players**: The six teams participating in the tournament are MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns, and LA Knight Riders. Notable players include Kieron Pollard, Wayne Parnell, Quinton de Kock, Faf du Plessis, Sunil Narine, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, Finn Allen, Andre Russell, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan.

**Opening Matches**: The tournament begins on July 5 with two matches: MI New York vs. Seattle Orcas, and Texas Super Kings vs. LA Knight Riders. The opening weekend also features Washington Freedom vs. MI New York on July 6, and San Francisco Unicorns vs. LA Knight Riders on July 7.

title: MLC 2024 schedule announced, tournament to begin on July 5
body:
The schedule for the second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) has been announced. The tournament will kick start from 5th July and the league this time will see six extra games as compared to last year following the success of the inaugural edition of the tournament.

The six-team tournament will begin with a high-octane clash between Mumbai Indians New York and Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park in Morrisville. This will also be the rematch of last year's final, which was won by the Nicholas Pooran-led side.

The Major League Cricket will be played across two venues in the United States of America. Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, and the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas will be hosting the entire second edition of the tournament.

The opening day of the Major League Cricket will see two games being played. After the game between Mumbai Indians New York and Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings will take on LA Knight Riders at the purpose-built Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie.

The second day of the Major League Cricket will see Washington Freedom in the first game whereas San Francisco Unicorns will lock horns with LA Knight Riders on Sunday night at Grand Prairie Stadium.

The playoffs of the Major League Cricket will begin from 24th July with Eliminator followed by Qualifier on 25th July. The Challenger will be played on the 26th and the final is scheduled to take place on the 28th of July.

Here's the schedule of the Playoffs:

Eliminator: Date & Time: 07/24/2024, 07:30 PM CDT

Teams: Seed 3 vs. Seed 4

Location: Grand Prairie Stadium, Grand Prairie, TX

Qualifier: Date & Time: 07/25/2024, 07:30 PM CDT

Teams: Seed 1 vs. Seed 2

Location: Grand Prairie Stadium, Grand Prairie, TX

Challenger: Date & Time: 07/26/2024, 07:30 PM CDT

Teams: Loser of Qualifier vs. Winner of Eliminator

Location: Grand Prairie Stadium, Grand

Final: Date & Time: 07/28/2024, 07:30 PM CDT

Teams: Winner of Qualifier vs. Winner of Challenger

Location: Grand Prairie Stadium, Grand Prairie, TX

Here's the full schedule of the league stage of MLC 2024:

This promises to be our most thrilling season yet - Major League Cricket's CEO, Vijay Srinivasan

Major League Cricket's CEO, Vijay Srinivasan talked about the announcement of the schedule, saying that they are excited for the the upcoming season and pointed out how big names are attracted to the league. He stated:

"We are incredibly excited to unveil the schedule for the 2024 season. This promises to be our most thrilling season yet, with each of the MLC's six teams actively recruiting in the off-season, adding a host of world-class player signings to their team rosters with more big names to be soon announced.

"With some of world cricket's biggest current stars and seasoned veterans involved, including the likes of athletic Jamaican allrounder Andre Russell, New Zealand's left-arm quick, Trent Boult, 2023 MLC Finals MVP Nicholas Pooran, Afghanistan's superstar spinner, Rashid Khan, together with cricketing royalty in coaches Ricky Ponting, Shane Watson and Stephen Fleming, it demonstrates the depth of talent being attracted to the league."

The Major League Cricket will be rereleasing tickets soon and fans can purchase them through their official website.
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* The second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) will take place from July 5th to July 28th, 2024.
* The tournament will feature six teams: Mumbai Indians New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, Washington Freedom, and San Francisco Unicorns.
* The league stage will be played across two venues in the United States: Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, and the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Schedule**

* The tournament will begin with a rematch of last year's final between Mumbai Indians New York and Seattle Orcas on July 5th.
* The league stage will consist of 30 games, with the playoffs starting on July 24th.
* The playoffs schedule is as follows:
	+ Eliminator: July 24th, Seed 3 vs. Seed 4
	+ Qualifier: July 25th, Seed 1 vs. Seed 2
	+ Challenger: July 26th, Loser of Qualifier vs. Winner of Eliminator
	+ Final: July 28th, Winner of Qualifier vs. Winner of Challenger

**Notable Players and Coaches**

* The tournament will feature big names like Andre Russell, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Ricky Ponting, Shane Watson, and Stephen Fleming.

**Ticket Information**

* Tickets for the tournament will be available for purchase on the official MLC website soon.

title: League cricket a ‘good deal’ for players, claims ex-IPL star
body:
The Indian Premier League (IPL) is one of the richest leagues in cricket where players earn a ton of money and former stars like Sri Lanka’s Tillakaratne Dilshan and New Zealand’s Ross Taylor believe that league cricket is a “good deal” for players.

Dilshan, who was part of the inaugural IPL in 2008 with Delhi Daredevils (now Delhi Capitals) and also Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in later seasons, played 38 matches in the tournament over the years and amassed 735 runs. Meanwhile, Taylor appeared in 55 matches and scored 1017 runs while representing multiple teams.

Dilshan stressed that many players only play cricket and have no source of income outside it. Since everyone needs money to survive, the Sri Lankan great emphasised that league cricket is a good deal for players as they aren’t paid that much by their countries.

"Playing T20 cricket involved a lot of money, and I know that our countries don't pay that much money, but that money helped him to keep other problems aside and focus only on cricket,” Dilshan told the 180 Not Out podcast.

“That's an advantage, we can focus fully on cricket. Everyone needs money to survive, and we're only playing cricket now, not doing any other jobs. I think it's a good deal, money is good for players and they can keep all problems aside and focus."

Taylor also opened up on how IPL provides a platform for international talent to flourish as they get to interact with renowned cricketers on the pitch.

"IPL is providing a platform for international players to interact with some of the best cricketers in the world, ultimately shaping the future of the sport in their country," said Taylor.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Complete schedule announced
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season will begin on 5 July with two matches across the USA, headlined by MLC’s reigning champions, MI New York, featuring their elite West Indian batter Kieron Pollard, who will face off against 2023 runners-up Seattle Orcas headlined by star South African pair Wayne Parnell and Quinton de Kock, at Church Street Park in Morrisville at 3:30 PM EDT.

The Texas Super Kings, spearheaded by classy South African Faf du Plessis, will take on West Indian off-spinner Sunil Narine’s LA Knight Riders at the purpose-built Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, TX at 7:30 PM CDT.

Advertisement

Building on the momentum of its inaugural 2023 season, Major League Cricket has extended the tournament due to demand with an extra six league matches.

The opening weekend also features the Australian-stacked Washington Freedom featuring Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and coach Ricky Ponting, facing MI New York on Saturday, July 6, at 3:00 pm EDT. The San Francisco Unicorns, bolstered by hard-hitting opening New Zealand batter Finn Allen, will host the LA Knight Riders on Sunday night at Grand Prairie Stadium, TX, at 7:30 PM CDT.

MLC 2024 Full Schedule:

Major League Cricket’s CEO, Vijay Srinivasan can’t wait to see the passion and enthusiasm come to life with cricket fans across the country for the second season of Major League Cricket.

“We are incredibly excited to unveil the schedule for the 2024 season,” said Srinivasan.

“This promises to be our most thrilling season yet, with each of the MLC’s six teams actively recruiting in the off-season, adding a host of world-class player signings to their team rosters with more big names to be soon announced.

“With some of world cricket’s biggest current stars and seasoned veterans involved, including the likes of athletic Jamaican allrounder Andre Russell, New Zealand’s left-arm quick, Trent Boult, 2023 MLC Finals MVP Nicholas Pooran, Afghanistan’s superstar spinner, Rashid Khan, together with cricketing royalty in coaches Ricky Ponting, Shane Watson and Stephen Fleming, it demonstrates the depth of talent being attracted to the league.”

Advertisement

In addition to the highly anticipated matches, MLC said it remains committed to supporting the long-term infrastructure to foster the growth of localized cricket communities further while strengthening cricket’s presence in the US.

“Last year, we unveiled MLC at the newly upgraded Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, and the brand new Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, which will both once again co-host the 2024 tournament, building on the impact of season one in those communities,” Srinivasan said.

“These venues will deliver world-class pitches and a vibrant atmosphere to support the overall MLC fan experience. Moreover, we are committed to exploring expansion opportunities with new cricket venues to support our six teams’ growing American fanbase.”

Advertisement

Off the back of Major League Cricket’s first successful season and a momentum boost from the ICC T20 World Cup in the US in June - the 2024 season is expected to reach new heights.

Tickets for all matches will go on sale in the coming weeks and can be purchased through the official Major League Cricket website.
summary:
**Start Date and Opening Matches**: The MLC 2024 season will begin on July 5 with two matches: MI New York (featuring Kieron Pollard) vs. Seattle Orcas (featuring Wayne Parnell and Quinton de Kock) at Church Street Park in Morrisville, and Texas Super Kings (featuring Faf du Plessis) vs. LA Knight Riders (featuring Sunil Narine) at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Extended Season**: The tournament has been extended by six league matches due to demand.

**Other Notable Matches**: The opening weekend will also feature the Australian-stacked Washington Freedom (featuring Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and coach Ricky Ponting) vs. MI New York on July 6, and the San Francisco Unicorns (featuring Finn Allen) vs. LA Knight Riders on July 7.

**Teams and Players**: The six teams have actively recruited new players, including world-class stars like Andre Russell, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, and others. Notable coaches include Ricky Ponting, Shane Watson, and Stephen Fleming.

**Venues and Infrastructure**: The tournament will be held at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas, with plans to explore expansion opportunities with new cricket venues.

**Tickets**: Tickets for all matches will go on sale in the coming weeks and can be purchased through the official Major League Cricket website.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 season schedule: Here's when matches will be played in Texas
body:
GRAND PRAIRIE, Texas — Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) announced its 2024 season schedule on Tuesday, which will have an extra six league matches compared to the inaugural 2023 season.

The season will be played throughout the month of July at two venues in the United States: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina. The first set of matches will come on Friday, July 5, when MLC’s reigning champions, MI New York, take on 2023 runners-up Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park.

The Texas Super Kings will also play against LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium to open the season.

"We are incredibly excited to unveil the schedule for the 2024 season," said Cognizant Major League Cricket’s CEO, Vijay Srinivasan. "This promises to be our most thrilling season yet, with each of the MLC’s six teams actively recruiting in the off-season."

Following three weeks of matches, the top four seeds will compete in the post-season tournament. Seeds 3 and 4 will compete in Eliminator and seeds 1 and 2 will compete in Qualifier. The winner of Qualifier will advance to Championship with the loser going into the Challenger match. The winner of Eliminator will advance to the Challenger match and the loser of Eliminator will be eliminated.

The winner of the Challenger match will then advance to the Championship to take on the winner from the Qualifier match.

Here is a look at the full schedule:

Texas Super Kings matches:

Friday, July 5: vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium

Monday, July 8: vs. Washington Freedom at Church Street Park

Wednesday, July 10: vs. San Francisco Unicorns at Church Street Park

Friday, July 12: vs. MI New York at Church Street Park

Sunday, July 14: vs. MI New York at Grand Prairie Stadium

Friday, July 19: vs. Washington Freedom at Grand Prairie Stadium

Tuesday, July 23: vs. Seattle Orcas at Grand Prairie Stadium

Major League Cricket playoff schedule

Eliminator

Seed 3 vs. Seed 4

July 24 at Grand Prairie Stadium

Qualifier

Seed 1 vs. Seed 2

July 25 at Grand Prairie Stadium

Challenger

Loser Qualifier vs. Winner Eliminator

July 26 at Grand Prairie Stadium

Championship

Winner Qualifier vs. Winner Challenger

July 28 at Grand Prairie Stadium

Major League Cricket ticket information

Tickets for all matches will go on sale in the coming weeks and can be purchased through the official Major League Cricket website. Fans are encouraged to secure their tickets early by registering for the pre-sale to ensure they don't miss out on the action after sell-out crowds in 2023.
summary:
**2024 Season Schedule:**

* The 2024 MLC season will take place throughout July at two venues in the US: Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina.
* The season will feature 18 league matches, six more than the inaugural 2023 season.
* The season will start on July 5 with two matches: MI New York vs. Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park, and Texas Super Kings vs. LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium.

**Teams and Matches:**

* The Texas Super Kings have six scheduled matches, including two against MI New York.

**Playoff Schedule:**

* The top four seeds will compete in the post-season tournament, with the schedule as follows:
	+ Eliminator: Seed 3 vs. Seed 4 on July 24 at Grand Prairie Stadium
	+ Qualifier: Seed 1 vs. Seed 2 on July 25 at Grand Prairie Stadium
	+ Challenger: Loser of Qualifier vs. Winner of Eliminator on July 26 at Grand Prairie Stadium
	+ Championship: Winner of Qualifier vs. Winner of Challenger on July 28 at Grand Prairie Stadium

**Ticket Information:**

* Tickets for all matches will go on sale soon and can be purchased through the official MLC website.
* Fans are encouraged to register for the pre-sale to secure their tickets early, as the 2023 season saw sell-out crowds.

title: Aiden Markram Joins Texas Super Kings In Major League Cricket
body:
South African cricketers Aiden Markram and Nandre Burger are set to join Major League Cricket teams after their stints in the Indian Premier League. Markram, who is currently playing for the Sunrisers Hyderabad in the IPL, expressed his excitement about joining former Proteas captain Faf du Plessis’ team, Texas.

Markram stated, “I’m very excited about this opportunity. Being part of the Super Kings brand, which has left a mark in various cricket leagues globally, is something I’ve admired for years. Playing alongside Faf du Plessis again is particularly thrilling, as he’s not only a great leader but also a remarkable individual.”

Nandre Burger also joins Texas Super Kings

Meanwhile, Burger, who is representing the Rajasthan Royals in the IPL, shared his enthusiasm about joining the Seattle Orcas in Major League Cricket’s upcoming season. Burger, who has gained international experience with two Tests, three ODIs, and one T20I since his debut in 2023, expressed his honor in joining the Orcas.

Burger commented, “I’m extremely honored and excited to join the Seattle Orcas for the upcoming season of Major League Cricket. I’m eager to contribute to the team’s success and look forward to joining them soon.”

Seattle Orcas, who finished as runners-up in MLC’s inaugural edition in 2023, will welcome Burger to bolster their squad. The team lost the final to MI New York, which featured South African players Dewald Brevis and Kagiso Rabada. This year, MI New York will include another Proteas fast bowler, Anrich Nortje, adding further competition to the league.
summary:
* Two South African cricketers, Aiden Markram and Nandre Burger, will join Major League Cricket teams after their stints in the Indian Premier League.
* Markram will join Texas Super Kings, which is led by former Proteas captain Faf du Plessis.
* Burger will join the Seattle Orcas, who finished as runners-up in the inaugural edition of the MLC in 2023.
* The Seattle Orcas will bolster their squad with Burger's addition, aiming to win the championship title.
* The MI New York team, which won the inaugural edition of the MLC, will feature Anrich Nortje, a South African fast bowler, adding more competition to the league.
