title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom wins Major League Cricket title
body:
Major League Cricket has got a new champion. The final match of this league was played between the teams of Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns. Washington Freedom, captained by Steve Smith, won the final match in a one-sided manner and won the title. In the title match, Freedom defeated San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs. The heroes of Washington Freedom's victory were captain Steve Smith and Marco Jensen.

Steve Smith's captaincy innings

Washington Freedom batted first in the match played at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. Travis Head's performance was not good in the final match, but captain Steve Smith batted brilliantly. Due to which Washington Freedom, batting first, scored 207 runs for 5 wickets in 20 overs. Steve Smith scored 88 runs in just 52 balls, which included 6 sixes and 7 fours. During this, his strike rate was 169.23. Apart from this, Glenn Maxwell scored 40 runs in 22 balls. Smith, along with Glenn Maxwell, took the innings to 169 runs. Mukhtar Ahmed scored 19 runs in 9 balls and Obas Pinar scored 13 runs in 9 balls to end the innings.

While chasing the target of 208 runs given by Washington Freedom, the team of San Francisco Unicorns collapsed cheaply. The entire team was all out for 111 runs in 16 overs. Carmi Le Roux contributed the highest 20 runs for San Francisco Unicorns and returned not out. At the same time, Marco Jensen took three wickets for 28 runs in four overs for Freedom. At the same time, Rachin Ravindra took three wickets for 23 runs in four overs. Andrew Tye took two wickets for 12 runs in two overs. While Saurabh Netravkar and Glenn Maxwell took one wicket each. Steve Smith was named Player of the Match in the final for his brilliant and explosive innings.

Strong performance by Steve Smith and Travis Head

This season was very good for Steve Smith. With the 6 sixes hit in the final of MLC 2024, Steve Smith's total number of sixes in the tournament became 21. During this, he scored 336 runs in 9 innings and became the third most successful batsman of the league. At the same time, Travis Head was chosen as the Player of the Tournament. Travis Head scored 336 runs in 9 matches at an average of 48 and during this his strike rate was 173.2.
summary:
**Champion:** Washington Freedom

**Final Match:** Washington Freedom defeated San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the final match played at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Top Performers:** Steve Smith (captain of Washington Freedom) scored 88 runs in 52 balls, including 6 sixes and 7 fours, and was named Player of the Match. Marco Jensen took three wickets for 28 runs in four overs.

**Tournament Statistics:** Steve Smith scored 336 runs in 9 innings, becoming the third most successful batsman of the league, while Travis Head was chosen as the Player of the Tournament, scoring 336 runs in 9 matches at an average of 48 and a strike rate of 173.2.

title: Washington Freedom Win Major League Cricket 2024 Title Behind Strong Performance From Steve Smith
body:
Washington Freedom defeated the San Francisco Unicorns by a commanding 96 runs to claim the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 title.

Washington Freedom won the championship final at Grand Prairie Stadium by a commanding 96 runs against the San Francisco Unicorns, showcasing their impressive power hitting and calculated bowling to claim the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 trophy. With Steve Smith and Glenn Maxwell leading the way, Freedom set a daunting goal of 208, which the Unicorns were unable to meet in the Sunday game. The Unicorns were instantly at a disadvantage, needing a good start.Jake Fraser-McGurk (3) was removed early in the third over, while Finn Allen (13), who made a century in the qualifier, was removed by Marco Jansen (3/28), who dealt a significant blow. The Unicorns were clearly in trouble as the score reached 30/3.

Sherfane Rutherford,4, and Josh Inglis,18, both fell early, putting an end to any dreams of a miraculous chase. This completed the middle-order collapse. After being brought on for the final, Andrew Tye took two crucial wickets to further tighten the noose around the Unicorns. Then, with a powerful spell, Rachin Ravindra eliminated the tail, finishing with 3/23.Early in the third over, Jake Fraser-McGurk (3) was removed, and Marco Jansen (3/28) delivered a vital blow by removingEarlier in the event final match, the Washington squad fell behind Head (9) early. Then, with a brilliant knock to start the innings, Steve Smith (88 in 52 balls, seven fours, and six sixes) seized center stage.

Andries Gous (21 in 14 balls, three fours, and a six) provided him with useful support. Gous and Rachin Ravindra (11) fell without making much of an impact. Relentlessly, Smith struck out with a flurry of blows, effortlessly hitting the boundary.After Smith was joined by Glenn Maxwell (40 in 22 balls, 4 down, 4 sixes), the two used aggressive batting to put the Unicorns out of the game. Drysdale let up 28 runs in a famous over as Smith and Maxwell washaving like crazy, laying the groundwork for a huge total.
summary:
**Champions:** Washington Freedom

**Runners-up:** San Francisco Unicorns

**Final Match Result:** Washington Freedom won by 96 runs against San Francisco Unicorns at Grand Prairie Stadium.

**Key Performers:**

* Steve Smith: Scored 88 runs in 52 balls with 7 fours and 6 sixes.
* Glenn Maxwell: Scored 40 runs in 22 balls with 4 fours and 4 sixes.
* Marco Jansen: Took 3 wickets for 28 runs.
* Andrew Tye: Took 2 crucial wickets.
* Rachin Ravindra: Took 3 wickets for 23 runs and finished with a powerful spell.

**Match Highlights:**

* Washington Freedom set a target of 208 runs, which the San Francisco Unicorns failed to chase.
* The Unicorns suffered a middle-order collapse, losing wickets at regular intervals.
* Steve Smith and Glenn Maxwell's aggressive batting partnership helped Washington Freedom build a huge total.
* The San Francisco Unicorns were unable to recover from the early losses, ultimately losing the game by 96 runs.

title: MLC 2024 Final: 3 Players To Watch Out For
body:
The MLC 2024 is set for the summit clash. Washington Freedom will take on San Francisco Unicorns in the Major league Cricket (MLC) 2024 final match on July 27.

After 25 matches, a new title champion will emerge at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas with the MLC 2024 final.

Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns qualified for the MLC 2024 final after wins in the Qualifier and Challenger matches, respectively. Both sides finished top two in the points table, with 11 points each, having lost just one match each.

Ahead of the MLC 2024 final, let us have a look at three key players who could be game changers.

Travis Head

Travis Head has had a dominant campaign at the MLC 2024. He has scored 327 runs in eight innings. He has a strike rate of 173.93 and an average of 54. Travis head scored his 5th consecutive fifty in T20 in the previous game against San Francisco Unicorns. With this, he became only the second Australian behind David Warner to achieve the feat.

Finn Allen

Kiwi opener Finn Allen smashed a 53-ball 101 to power San Francisco Unicorns to a victory against Texas Super Kings to book a spot in the MLC 2024 final. Allen is one of the top scorers of the tournament with 293 in eight innings. He has a staggering strike rate of 195.33 and an average of 36.62. His figures are a testimony to the fact that he would be one of the key players with an X-factor.

Also Read: Finn Allen’s Six-Fest Leads Unicorns To MLC Win

Saurabh Netravalkar

Saurabh Netravalkar, who had a successful campaign in the T20 World Cup 2024 in the United States, continued his impressive form at the MLC 2024. With 14 wickets from six innings, Netravalkar is the top wicket-taker of the tournament. He has an average of 12.07 and an economy of 9.57. He is sure to grab eyeballs at the MLC 2024 final.
summary:
**Final Match**: The MLC 2024 final will be played between Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns on July 27 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Road to the Final**: Both teams qualified for the final after winning the Qualifier and Challenger matches, respectively. They finished top two in the points table with 11 points each, having lost just one match each.

**Key Players to Watch**: Three key players who could be game-changers in the final are:

1. **Travis Head** (Washington Freedom): Scored 327 runs in 8 innings with a strike rate of 173.93 and an average of 54.
2. **Finn Allen** (San Francisco Unicorns): Scored 293 runs in 8 innings with a strike rate of 195.33 and an average of 36.62.
3. **Saurabh Netravalkar** (San Francisco Unicorns): Took 14 wickets in 6 innings with an average of 12.07 and an economy of 9.57.

title: WATCH: Mitchell Santner deposits Ali Sheikh deep into car park for huge six
body:
Texas Super Kings ended the Major League Cricket 2024 season on a high. The biggest highlight of the day was Mitchell Santner who played a brief knock of 15 from 16 balls with one four and one six.

The incident happened on the fifth ball of the 11th over of the Texas Super Kings innings. Ali Sheikh, bowling over the wicket, bowled the ball short outside the off-stump. Santner got into the perfect line off the ball and sent it sailing over the stands as the ball went into the car park.

The joy for the Kiwi was short-lived as he was out in the very next over. Michael Bracewell gave the ball lots of flight as Santner tried to hit yet another six. Having mistimed the shot, Santner saw the ball being caught by Shubham Ranjane.

Texas Super Kings end group phase on a high

Seattle Orcas won the toss and put Texas Super Kings into bat. Ayan Desai struck first when he dismissed Devon Conway for a duck. Cameron Gannon then got the wicket of Joshua Trump for 6 to reduce Texas to 12/2. Faf Du Plessis and Milind Kumar then added 37 runs for the 4th wicket in just 20 balls.

That stand was broken when Keemo Paul had the big wicket of Du Plessis for 39 off 17 balls. At 113/6 the Texas side seemed to be in trouble with the loss of constant wickets. This is when Colin Savage and Cameron Stevenson added 43 runs for the 7th wicket. Colin Savage was not out on 45 off 27 balls to help Texas reach 177/6 from their 20 overs.

Just like Texas in the first innings, Seattle lost the wicket of Ryan Rickelton for a first-ball duck to Ottniel Baartman. Quinton De Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya then added 52 runs for the 2nd wicket before the wheels came off. The loss of Jayasuriya for 24 dismissed by Colin Savage says Seattle lost 4 wickets for 15 runs.

From there the Texas bowlers didn’t take their foot off the pedal as they kept taking wickets at regular intervals. With figures of 3/20 from his 4 overs, Baartman was the best bowler for Texas Super Kings.
summary:
**Match Summary:**

* Texas Super Kings played against Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket 2024 season.
* Texas Super Kings won the match, ending the group phase on a high.

**Key Performances:**

* Mitchell Santner played a brief knock of 15 from 16 balls, including a four and a six, before being dismissed.
* Faf Du Plessis scored 39 off 17 balls before being dismissed by Keemo Paul.
* Colin Savage remained not out on 45 off 27 balls, helping Texas reach 177/6 in 20 overs.
* Ottniel Baartman was the best bowler for Texas Super Kings, taking 3 wickets for 20 runs in 4 overs.

**Notable Moments:**

* Mitchell Santner hit a six that landed in the car park.
* Texas Super Kings recovered from 113/6 to reach 177/6, thanks to a 43-run partnership between Colin Savage and Cameron Stevenson.
* Seattle Orcas lost 4 wickets for 15 runs, including the wicket of Shehan Jayasuriya for 24, dismissed by Colin Savage.

title: MLC Winners List(2023 to 2024) – Major League Cricket
body:
The Major League Cricket (MLC) is a professional T20 cricket league that is played in the United States. The first edition of the tournament was played in 2023.

MLC 2024 will follow round robin and playoffs format where the top 4 teams of the points table will advance to the playoffs round. A total of 6 teams will feature in the Major League Cricket and 25 matches will be played including an Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger and a Final.

MLC Winners List

MI New York won the first edition of the tournament by beating Seattle Orcas in the grand final of the MLC 2023 played in Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas. Following are they details of the Major League Cricket winners list:

Season Winner Runner-up Result Venue 2023 MI New York Seattle Orcas MI New York won by 7 wickets Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas 2024 Washington Freedom San Francisco Unicorns Washington Freedom won by 96 runs Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas

MLC Cricket Teams

4 out of six participating teams have the owners of the IPL. Notably, Mumbai and Knight Riders IPL franchises run the MLC Team without any partnership. At the same time, Super Kings and Delhi Capitals run with local partnerships.

Following are the details of the MLC Team Owners and partners along with the city and stadium details:
summary:
**Tournament Format**: The MLC 2024 will follow a round-robin and playoffs format, with the top 4 teams advancing to the playoffs.

**Number of Teams**: 6 teams will participate in the tournament.

**Number of Matches**: A total of 25 matches will be played, including an Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger, and a Final.

**Tournament History**: The first edition of the MLC was played in 2023, and MI New York won the tournament by beating Seattle Orcas in the final. In 2024, Washington Freedom won the tournament by beating San Francisco Unicorns.

**Team Ownership**: 4 out of 6 teams have owners from the Indian Premier League (IPL), with Mumbai and Knight Riders IPL franchises running their MLC teams independently, while Super Kings and Delhi Capitals run their teams with local partnerships.

title: ESPN Africa unveils electrifying schedule – Gadget
body:
At the ESPN Sports Fest this weekend, the channel unveiled an electrifying line-up of non-stop action from American leagues and new sports documentaries. From basketball, to American football and now cricket, ESPN promises sports fans across the continent a feast.

From Friday 5 July, ESPN will be the home of the American Major League Cricket, the US domestic Twenty20 cricket league. The league starts with MI New York v Seattle Orcas, live on 5 July at 21:30 (CAT), with three games per week, leading up to the finals at the end of the month.

A slate of new programming from ESPN Films’ Peabody and Academy Award-winning 30 for 30 series will premiere across Africa from this month, providing unprecedented access to some of the most compelling stories in sports. First up, 30 for 30 False Positive will premiere tomorrow (Wednesday 3 July) at 20:00, looking into the life of former track and field superstar Butch Reynolds. It traces his relentless battle to clear his name following drug accusations, revealing systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete’s legacy. 30 for 30 I’m Just here for the Riot, which premieres on Wednesday 10 July at 19:00, chronicles the aftermath of the Canucks’ Stanley Cup Finals loss to the Boston Bruins, raising deeper questions about fandom, violence, and the shocking power of an angry crowd.

30 for 30 No Scope: The Story of FaZe Clan premieres on Sunday 21 July at 19:00 and gives a wide-ranging, eye-opening, and unsparing look at the popular e-sports team, and the remarkable series of ups and downs that have defined the individual gamers. 30 for 30 Dude Perfect: A Very Long Shot traces the meteoric rise of a group of friends from College Station, Texas, whose backyard antics evolved into a global sports-comedy phenomenon, on Wednesday 7 August at 20:00.

Tennis fans can look forward to the 8-part documentary In the Arena: Serena Williams, which is set to premiere on ESPN on Friday 21 July at 20:00. Williams dominated tennis for over two decades, winning 23 Grand Slams (singles) and changing the sport forever. This series will provide the most complete, intimate, and compelling account of her legendary career, featuring firsthand perspective from Serena and key figures throughout her life, on Tuesday evenings with one premiere episode per week for eight weeks. Also, on Wednesday 31 July at 20:00, 30 for 30 American Son captures a pivotal moment in sports history, chronicling the remarkable journey of Michael Chang, the tennis prodigy whose ascent to fame coincided with an unfathomable and unforgettable upset of Ivan Lendl at the 1989 French Open.

Basketball fans can settle in for a series of showdowns as the American Olympic Basketball (USAB) team lead up to the Paris Olympics. Mark your calendar for these fixtures:

From Monday 29 July at 20:30, the series Sports Woman will premiere with one new episode each week. Showcasing inspiring stories of female athletes across all sports and cultures, this remarkable series recognises the elite, the inspiring and the diverse, through the untold motivational stories of endurance, and overcoming challenges and adversity. Additionally, from 5 August, ESPN will broadcast the 26-part series, The Rising. This timeless series recognises the importance of the many courageous acts that has brought about change, in sport and well beyond.

Soccer fans across the continent will be delighted to see the new European football season kick off this August. Viewers can expect a record number of leagues on ESPN this season, including the EFL (English Football League), Dutch Eredivise, the Scottish Premiership, Belgian Pro League, the German DFB Cup and continue to enjoy the NWSL (National Woman’s Soccer League)

As the weather warms, fans can look forward to the start of the NFL (National Football League) season on Friday 6September and the NBA (National Basketball Association) regular season on Tuesday 22 October.
summary:
* The American Major League Cricket, a US domestic Twenty20 cricket league, will be broadcasted on ESPN starting from Friday, 5 July.
* The league will kick off with a match between MI New York and Seattle Orcas, live on 5 July at 21:30 (CAT).
* Three games per week will be broadcasted, leading up to the finals at the end of the month.

Note: There is no additional information about the tournament format, teams, players, or schedule beyond the mentioned details.

title: Powerful Batting But Lack Of Experience In Middle Order - Analysis Of Seattle Orcas
body:

The second edition of the Major League Cricket 2024 is knocking at the doors. The first match of the tournament will be a rematch of the finals of the previous edition, where the Seattle Orcas will take on the MI-New York.

All-rounders: Michael Bracewell, Harmeet Singh, Imad Wasim, Shehan Jayasuriya, Shubham Ranjane

Strengths of Seattle Orcas for MLC 2024

Heinrich Klaasen and Quinton de Kock will be the strength of the Seattle Orcas batting [X]

Power in batting

Quinton de Kock will add power to the team's batting in the top order. The presence of Heinrich Klaasen will give them the fuel to finish off on a string note.

Alongside these two superstars, they have the likes of Nauman Anwar, Michael Bracewell and Imad Wasim, who could stabilise the innings in the middle overs for the team.

The Seattle Orcas look like a team that has the proper mix of big hitters and middle-order stabilisers to see their team do well in this edition of the tournament.

Quinton de Kock will add power to the team's batting in the top order. The presence of Heinrich Klaasen will give them the fuel to finish off on a string note.

Variety and depth in the spin department

The presence of Harmeet Singh, Imad Wasim, and Michael Bracewell will provide great depth and variety to the spin department. These players can also contribute with the bat, adding further dynamism and flexibility to the team.

Well-rounded pace department

These bowlers can deliver at all stages of the game, and hence, the teams look sorted as far as their pace department is concerned.

Weaknesses of Seattle Orcas for MLC 2024

Lack of experience and skill in the middle order

A lot of the Seattle Orcas middle-order depends on Heinrich Klaasen. The South African batter will play a major role in carrying the team ahead. The other batters around Klaasen are Imad Wasim, Hammad Azam and Michael Bracewell. While there is a lack of experience in some of these players in crucial stages, the others are not in the best of forms. title: Experience And Depth In Team But Volatile Top Order - Analysis Of Los Angeles Knight Riders
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders during the MLC 2023 [X]

India has scripted history and has won their second T20 World Cup title by defeating South Africa in the finale of T20 WC 2024. With the marquee international event now over, the focus of the T20 format shifts back to the franchise leagues around the world.

After the superb show of the US team in the recently concluded world event, a lot of the eyes will be focused on how they progress from here. The second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC 2024) is, therefore, the next big thing in the cricketing calendar of 2024.

We at OneCricket will take a look at all the teams that will participate in the tournament and try to analyse them. In this article, we will take a look at the Los Angeles Knight Riders team and their strengths and weaknesses.

Here is a look at the Los Angeles Kinght Riders team for the tournament.

Batters: Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Jason Roy, Saif Badar, Alex Carey, David Miller

All-rounders: Sunil Narine, Corne Dry, Andre Russell, Shakib Al Hasan, Matthew Tromp, Shadley van Shcalwyk

Bowlers: Ali Khan, Derone Davis, Spencer Johnson, Adam Zampa

Strengths of Los Angeles Knight Riders for MLC 2024

Variety and depth in the all-rounder section

The likes of Sunil Narine, Andre Russell and Shakib Al Hasan have been doing the rounds of T20 circuits for long. The presence of these three players not only allows the team management to have great dynamism and depth in the team but also gives them a lot of experience. The team will be depending a lot on these three legends of the format to have a much better campaign than last time, where they finished at the bottom of the table.

Spencer Johnson will play a major role for LAKR in the tournament [X]

Well sorted and assembeled bowling attack

Andre Russell and Sunil Narine will give LAKR the flexibility to use them at any stage of the game. Alongside these two, Spencer Johnson is a solid option for the powerplays. They also have Adam Zampa and Shakib Al Hasan for the middle overs, and in the end, they have Ali Khan, who can be very efficient in the death overs. So, the bowling looks ready for all the phases of the game, and there is also plenty of strength and variety in it to go with.

Weaknesses of Los Angeles Knight Riders for MLC 2024

Volatile top-order

If the Knight Riders are not opening with Sunil Narine, then they have Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar and Jason Roy to open with. While Jason Roy looks like a good option, his lack of consistency is a concern for the team. Besides Roy, the likes of Chand and Kumar do not look like outright match-winners, and this can haunt the team during the campaign.

The team will depend a lot on the likes of David Miller and Alex Carey to give them stability and the strength in the middle-order.

Los Angeles Knight Riders Predicted XI for the First Match
summary:
**Team Overview**

The Los Angeles Knight Riders team is participating in the MLC 2024 tournament, which is the next big event in the cricketing calendar after the T20 World Cup 2024.

**Squad**

The team consists of batsmen Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Jason Roy, Saif Badar, Alex Carey, and David Miller. The all-rounders are Sunil Narine, Corne Dry, Andre Russell, Shakib Al Hasan, Matthew Tromp, and Shadley van Schalwyk. The bowlers are Ali Khan, Derone Davis, Spencer Johnson, and Adam Zampa.

**Strengths**

* The team has variety and depth in the all-rounder section, with experienced players like Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, and Shakib Al Hasan.
* The bowling attack is well-sorted and assembled, with options for powerplays, middle overs, and death overs.

**Weaknesses**

* The top-order batting is volatile, with concerns about the consistency of Jason Roy and the lack of match-winning abilities of Unmukt Chand and Nitish Kumar.
* The team will rely heavily on David Miller and Alex Carey to provide stability in the middle order.

**Predicted XI for the First Match**

Not specified in the article.

title: Proteas to return home on Wednesday
body:
The Proteas will be returning to South Africa on Wednesday, landing at around 10h15 after they finished second at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024.

South Africa lost the final to India on Saturday by 7 runs at the Kensington Oval in Barbados.

Several of the Proteas players are expected to not be at the OR Tambo International Airport when the team arrives as they will travel straight to the USA to take part in the Major League Cricket competition.

A fan meet and greet will also take place at DP World Wanderers Stadium between 15h00 – 16h00 on the day of the team’s arrival on home soil.

Proteas’ captain, Aiden Markram, says the defeat to India is gut-wrenching.

“That’s really what it is. Each player has been on a different individual journey to get to this first final,” he said after he was asked about the emotions in the team straight after losing in Barbados.

“Ultimately you become really tight as a group and you want good things to happen to this group because you know they’re great people and when you get really close like that, especially the nature of how the game went, obviously adds to the emotions and it’s one of those things. But yeah, we can channel it moving forward.”
summary: Several South African cricket players will travel directly to the USA from Barbados to participate in the Major League Cricket competition, bypassing the team's arrival at OR Tambo International Airport in South Africa.

title: An All-Round Team In Quest Of Second Trophy - Analysis Of MI New York
body:
MI New York are the defending champions of MLC [X]

The second edition of the Major League Cricket is around the corner. With a couple of days left at the start of the tournament, we at OneCricket will take a deeper delve into the MI New York side.

The MI New York played excellent cricket in the previous edition. Even after an average start to their campaign, MINY peaked at the right moment and made it to the summit clash of the tournament. In the final, Nicholas Pooran played one of the best T20 knocks and made the team the first-ever MLC champions.

In this article, we will take a look at the MINY squad for the 2024 season and try to figure out their strengths and weaknesses ahead of the season.

Here is a look at the MI New York squad for MLC 2024.

Batters: Tim David, Monank Patel, Nicholas Pooran, Heath Richards, Shayan Jahangir, Steven Taylor

All-rounders: Dewald Brevis, Ruben Clinton, Kieron Pollard, Rashid Khan, Romario Shepherd

Bowlers: Trent Boult, Ehsan Ali, Noshthush Kenjige, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, Rushil Ugarkar

Strengths of MI New York for MLC 2024

Brilliant Pace Unit

Trent Boult will be leading the pace attack of MI New York [X]

Trent Boult, Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje will be in charge of the pace department for MI New York in this edition. These three functioning together can be lethal against any batting line-up in the tournament. Alongside the three genuine pacers, MI have Romario Shepherd, who could play a supporting role and also contribute with the bat for the team.

Balanced Spin Department

While having a very potent and fear-striking pace attack, the MI New York team can also boast of a balanced spin department. Rashid Khan will be their prime spinner, and there are no questions about his skills and what he brings to the table in this format. Nosthush Kenjige will be aiding Rashid, and we have seen in the recently concluded World Cup that Kenjige can be a very efficient bowler in the middle overs. Alongside a powerful pace attack, the spin department also looks adequate to make run-scoring for the opposition batters a problem.

Powerful middle-order

MI New York will have Nicholas Pooran, Dewald Brevis, Kieron Pollard, and Tim David in the middle order. These four batters should be enough to strike fear in the minds of the opposition bowlers. These batters have the ability to decimate the opposition with power-hitting and change the complexion of a match at any stage. Besides these four, MINY also has Monank Patel, Rashid Khan, and Romario Shepherd, players who can be used around that powerhouse in the game's situation and the playing conditions.

Weaknesses of MI New York for MLC 2024

Shayan Jahangir, Monank Patel and Steven Taylor will be the players MI New York will be looking to use as their openers in the tournament. While Shayan Jahangir and Monank Patel are stable batters, sometimes their scoring rate can be an issue for the team. On the other hand, Steven Taylor, who is a power hitter at the top, suffers from a bit of inconsistency. So, the MI team in MLC will depend a lot on their fire power in the middle in order to see them through most of the games.

MI New York Predicted XI for the first match
summary:
**Defending Champions:** MI New York is the defending champion of the MLC tournament, having won the inaugural edition of the tournament thanks to a brilliant T20 knock by Nicholas Pooran in the final.

**Squad for MLC 2024:** The MI New York squad for the 2024 season includes batters Tim David, Monank Patel, Nicholas Pooran, Heath Richards, Shayan Jahangir, and Steven Taylor. The all-rounders are Dewald Brevis, Ruben Clinton, Kieron Pollard, Rashid Khan, and Romario Shepherd. The bowlers are Trent Boult, Ehsan Ali, Noshthush Kenjige, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, and Rushil Ugarkar.

**Strengths:** The team has a brilliant pace unit led by Trent Boult, Kagiso Rabada, and Anrich Nortje, a balanced spin department with Rashid Khan and Noshthush Kenjige, and a powerful middle-order featuring Nicholas Pooran, Dewald Brevis, Kieron Pollard, and Tim David.

**Weaknesses:** The team's weakness lies in its top-order batting, with openers Shayan Jahangir, Monank Patel, and Steven Taylor struggling with inconsistency and scoring rate.

**Predicted XI for the First Match:** The article does not specify the predicted XI for the first match, but it provides an analysis of the team's strengths and weaknesses ahead of the 2024 season.

title: Seattle Orcas announce GMR Sports as principal sponsor for MLC 2024
body:
The Major League Cricket (MLC) team, Seattle Orcas have inked a sponsorship agreement with GMR Sports, the sports division of GMR Group.

As part of the collaboration, the entity has been named the team’s principal sponsor for the upcoming season of MLC and its logo will be displayed on the left sleeve of the shirt.

The announcement of the news was made by the Seattle-based team through its social media handles, with the caption, “GMR is proud to be the principal partner of the Seattle Orcas in #MajorLeagueCricket 🏏 🙌. Get ready for an epic season! 🔥”

GMR Sports, the sports arm of the GMR Group, was created in 2008 to use sports to build community relationships. GMR Sports aims to inspire young people to participate in sports, build a grassroots link to the community, and foster a supportive atmosphere. In the past, the brand has also sponsored Delhi Capitals and Dubai Capitals.

Seattle Orcas have also developed a partnership with Veeam Software, a privately held US-based information technology company.
summary: The Seattle Orcas, a team in the Major League Cricket tournament, have secured two significant sponsorship agreements. Firstly, they have partnered with GMR Sports, the sports division of GMR Group, as their principal sponsor for the upcoming MLC season. As part of this deal, GMR's logo will be displayed on the left sleeve of the team's shirt. Additionally, the Seattle Orcas have also developed a partnership with Veeam Software, a US-based information technology company. These sponsorships are expected to enhance the team's presence and performance in the upcoming season of the Major League Cricket tournament.

title: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Complete squads of all six teams
body:
Following the thrilling conclusion of the T20 World Cup 2024, cricket fans have another exciting event to look forward to: the second season of Major League Cricket (MLC), the premier T20 league in the United States, which kicks off on July 5.

MI New York to face Seattle Orcas in the tournament opener

The opening match will feature a showdown between the defending champions MI New York and the Seattle Orcas in Morrisville. Later that evening, the Texas Super Kings will face off against the LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

Last month, the International Cricket Council (ICC) granted MLC ‘List A’ status, elevating it to the same level as the Indian Premier League (IPL) and other top-tier franchise competitions.

Familiar stars to entertain fans

Many prominent cricketers are set to take part in the upcoming edition of the MLC. Fans can look forward to seeing stars such as Pat Cummins, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Lungi Ngidi, Andre Russell, David Miller, Faf du Plessis, Marcus Stoinis, Rachin Ravindra, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, Shimron Hetmyer, and Quinton de Kock.

title: Lexus Becomes Automotive Partner of Cognizant Major
body:
DALLAS, TX, June 25, 2024: Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) is thrilled to announce that luxury automotive brand Lexus has become the Automotive Partner for the league’s highly anticipated second season.

“We are excited to welcome Lexus as the Automotive Partner of Major League Cricket,” said Vijay Srinivasan, CEO of MLC. “Their reputation for unparalleled luxury and commitment to their customers aligns perfectly with our vision for the league. Together, we look forward to delivering an exceptional experience to cricket fans across the nation.”

Under the new agreement, Lexus will be integrated into on-field and broadcast content throughout the season. The brand will also be featured in fan communications and MLC digital platforms. This is the first time Lexus and MLC have partnered together.

“Partnering with Major League Cricket offers Lexus the opportunity to reach a new diverse fanbase with a brand that shares an unwavering commitment to performance, customer experience, and their fans,” said David Telfer, Head of Lexus Advertising & Media. “We’re committed to growing with MLC during its second season to elevate the presence of the U.S. team and engage with new fans.”

MLC kicks off its second season on Friday, July 5. Tickets for all matches, including the four playoffs, are available online through the Official Cognizant Major League Cricket website. In addition to the world-class matches, fans have several ticket options to choose from, with general admission tickets starting at $30 per person. The season’s excitement extends beyond the pitch, with entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings and meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the tournament.

title: Major League Cricket
body:
The Town of Morrisville will play host to Cognizant Major League Cricket from July 5-17, at Church Street Park (5817 Cricket Pitch Way). Morrisville is one of only two hosts for the Major League Cricket games in the United States in July 2024.

Matches will include Seattle Orcas, MI New York, Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings, San Francisco Unicorns and Los Angeles Knight Riders. Championship games will be played in Grand Prairie, Texas.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 Match Fixtures - A thrilling month of T20 cricket in the USA
body:
A busy schedule of fixtures in MLS 2024

After a brilliant first season in 2023 - combined with the excitement of the USA’s excellent performances in the World Cup (partly hosted in the USA) - season two of Major League Cricket kicks off on 5 July with a day/night clash between MI New York and the Seattle Orcas in Morrisville.

This season’s MLC schedule is a demanding match-a-day programme for the 6 franchise teams, with 25 matches spread from 5 July to 28 July 2024 (when the final will be contested). There will be one match a day (sometimes two) every day up until the final, which has a rest day before it.

The final will be staged as a night match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, on 28 July.

title: Amazon nets Major League Cricket broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand
body:
Amazon Prime Video has secured the exclusive broadcast rights to the US-based Twenty20 Major League Cricket (MLC) competition in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 season.

Contract:

All 25 games available on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand

MLC access to come at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership

Context:

The second MLC season features a number of Australian and New Zealand internationals, including Australia’s test and one-day-international skipper Pat Cummins, batter Steve Smith, and New Zealand all-rounder Rachin Ravindra.

This is the latest Australian cricket rights deal to be secured by Prime Video. Last year it snapped up the exclusive live rights to International Cricket Council (ICC) tournaments, including the recently concluded men’s T20 World Cup and the upcoming women’s T20 World Cup.

MLC games will also air on several US regional sports networks (RSNs) such as YES Network and Monumental Sports Network. Meanwhile, the Indian rights have been acquired by Sony Pictures Network.

Comment:

“We are thrilled to announce Prime Video as our broadcast partner for Cognizant Major League Cricket in New Zealand and Australia,” said Vijay Srinivasan, MLC chief executive. “This partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey to grow the season, which is in its second year, as well as bring the excitement of cricket to fans across the globe.

“Prime Video has solidified its position as a premier destination for cricket enthusiasts in Australia and New Zealand, showcasing major events such as the World Cup and acclaimed series such as The Test. MLC eagerly anticipates joining this platform, poised to contribute thrilling cricket action to its global audience through Prime Video’s extensive reach and expertise.”

“The feedback from cricket fans in Australia for our first major event, ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, has been really positive and we are delighted to expand our live sports offering through the Cognizant Major League Cricket,” added Hushidar Kharas, head of Prime Video for Australia and New Zealand.

“We are also excited to offer our customers in New Zealand the first live sports event included in their Prime Video membership.”

Coming next:

The competition has played five games so far, with the next matchup between the Los Angeles Knight Riders and the Seattle Orcas to be held on 9th July.
summary:
**Broadcast Rights**: Amazon Prime Video has secured the exclusive broadcast rights to the US-based Twenty20 MLC competition in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 season.

**Availability**: All 25 games will be available on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership.

**Players**: The second MLC season features several Australian and New Zealand internationals, including Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, and Rachin Ravindra.

**Other Broadcast Partners**: MLC games will also air on US regional sports networks (RSNs) such as YES Network and Monumental Sports Network, and the Indian rights have been acquired by Sony Pictures Network.

**Upcoming Match**: The next matchup will be between the Los Angeles Knight Riders and the Seattle Orcas on 9th July.

title: Seattle Orcas Aim To Become ‘America’s Team’ In Major League Cricket
body:
As the only small market in the six-team Major League Cricket, Seattle Orcas has an audacious plan to build its brand.

In a nod to the Dallas Cowboys, the world's most profitable sports team according to Forbes, the Orcas aim to become 'America's Team' in MLC - the lucrative pro T20 league that has just started a pivotal second season.

"We really are thinking about it for the long-term," Orcas co-owner Soma Somasegar told me in a phone interview. "We are not here thinking about MLC for the next five years and just saying 'let's get some value and move on'.

"There is no reason why we need to restrict this to just Seattle or the Pacific Northwest."

ForbesAmerica's Major League Cricket Set To Ride Momentum Of T20 World Cup

Much like the Seattle Sounders in Major League Soccer, whom Somasegar is part of the ownership group, the Orcas have encouraged passionate fans to get together and form the 'Pod Squad'.

"The squad is our way of saying we're going to get a group of people together who are excited about Seattle Orcas," said Somasegar, who has lived in Seattle for over three decades. "And we think the 'Pod Squad' should exist not just in Seattle, but around the country.

"One guy from the Bay Area recently reached out to us and said that he had been watching MLC since it started. He said 'the way you guys have been inclusive, I'm a fan of your team more than any other. I like what you're doing and I want to be part of you'.

"So that's what we want to do and that's what we mean by becoming 'America's Team'."

While inventiveness has made the Orcas stand out so far in the fledgling competition, cementing roots in the northwest seaport city will be vital for long-term success of the franchise.

The Orcas are an outlier compared to the other franchises based in the major locales of Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, Washington DC and Dallas (Texas).

Seattle beat out Atlanta and Chicago to complete the inaugural list of teams. As I reported recently, Atlanta and Chicago are set to be part of an expanded MLC in the coming seasons, while a move into Canada is also potentially on the cards.

ForbesChicago And Atlanta Could Be The Next Franchises In Major League Cricket

Parochialism is an advantage for the Orcas nestled in a relatively smaller market as underlined by the franchise being given more press coverage than its rivals. Exposure might be a bit easier for Orcas, but the hierarchy is keen to grow cricket from the ground up.

"We need to put a lot of effort into the community to not only get the right level of interest and excitement for the sport, but to also show kids that cricket can be a choice for them," said Somasegar, a venture capitalist at Madrona Venture Group having spent 27 years working at Microsoft.

"We have this notion called 'cricket in a box', where we go to schools and show the basics of cricket. We're seeing early signs of traction. Our goal is to have cricket programs in schools.

"We need to cultivate cricket throughout the year because that's what is required for this sport to have a chance to be mainstream over a period of time."

Like its debut season, where MLC exceeded financial expectations, the tournament is only being played in Dallas, the heartbeat of American cricket, and the more modest ground in Morrisville, North Carolina.

There are plans amid an expanded MLC - played in a home and away format - for each franchise to have its own cricket stadium.

A home ground for the Orcas has been planned at King County’s Marymoor Park, around 15 miles from Seattle, and likely to hold about 6000-8000 fans.

It is hoped to be ready by the 2026 season and possibly become a venue for the 2028 Los Angeles Games, where cricket will make its first Olympic appearance since 1900.

"My hope is Seattle has a stadium up and running by then because we have as much potential to host Olympic (cricket) games as anyone else," Somasegar said. "That will be another great opportunity to showcase the sport in this country."

The Orcas are out to go one better after losing last year's final to MI New York, but lost the rematch in the opening game of this season.

Like every other team, the Orcas have a mixture of international stars and local talent. Big names include big-hitting South Africans Heinrich Klaasen and Quinton de Kock, along with American sensation Aaron Jones who lit up the T20 World Cup.

For India-born Somasegar, building the blocks of a cricket franchise in his adopted home has become a dream come true.

"I grew up with cricket and derived so much pleasure from it in my life," he said. "The vast majority of people in the U.S. have not experienced cricket, so this is building the sport from the ground up which is exciting.

"In Seattle, we have the loudest and most passionate sports fans in the country. There are a lot of great things happening here with technology and having big global companies in our backyard.

"It's a great place for cricket to be and it's satisfying playing a small role in this journey."
summary:
**Seattle Orcas' Ambitious Plan**: The Seattle Orcas, the only small market team in the six-team MLC, aim to become "America's Team" by building a brand that resonates beyond Seattle and the Pacific Northwest.

**"Pod Squad" Initiative**: The Orcas have encouraged fans to form the "Pod Squad", a group of passionate fans who can come together to support the team, not just in Seattle but across the country.

**Community Focus**: The franchise is focused on growing cricket from the ground up by putting in effort to get kids interested in the sport and introducing "cricket in a box" programs in schools.

**Stadium Plans**: A home ground for the Orcas is planned at King County's Marymoor Park, which is expected to hold 6,000-8,000 fans and be ready by the 2026 season. It may also host Olympic cricket games in 2028.

**Current Season**: The Orcas are looking to improve on their runner-up finish last year, despite losing their opening game to MI New York. They have a mix of international stars like Heinrich Klaasen, Quinton de Kock, and local talent like Aaron Jones.

**Long-term Goals**: The Orcas' co-owner, Soma Somasegar, envisions a future where cricket becomes mainstream in the US, with the franchise playing a key role in building the sport from the ground up.

title: Centuries in MLC: Full list and breakdown of hundreds scored in Major League Cricket history
body:
The Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season is underway in the United States of America (USA), as cricket fever continues in the country following a successful T20 World Cup 2024 where the USA co-hosted the tournament.

This is the second edition of the MLC, where the first season was won by MI New York, an off shoot of the Indian Premier League (IPL) team, Mumbai Indians.

Faf du Plessis, the captain of the Texas Super Kings scored the first century of the 2024 season against Washington Freedom. In the very next match, fellow South African Ryan Rickelton also posted a century for Seattle Orcas against Los Angeles Knight Riders.

In this article, The Sporting News provides you the list of all centuries scored in the Major League Cricket tournament's history.

How many centuries have been scored in the MLC?

Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament has seen 4 centuries over the last 2 seasons so far.

Who scored the first century in Major League Cricket?

The first-ever century in MLC was scored by Seattle Orcas' South African star Heinrich Klaasen against eventual champions MI New York in the 2023 season.

He smashed an unbeaten 110 runs off just 44 balls, striking at 250, in an inning which saw 9 fours and 7 sixes.

MORE: MLC 2024: Start date, final, schedule and fixtures for Major League Cricket 2024

Which batsman has scored the most centuries in MLC?

Only four centuries have been scored in Major League Cricket history, and all of them were scored by different batsmen, namely Nicholas Pooran, Heinrich Klaasen, Faf du Plessis and Ryan Rickelton.

List: All centuries scored in the Major League Cricket
summary:
* The second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament is currently underway in the United States.
* The first season of MLC was won by MI New York, an offshoot of the Indian Premier League (IPL) team Mumbai Indians.
* In the 2024 season, Faf du Plessis scored the first century against Washington Freedom, followed by Ryan Rickelton's century for Seattle Orcas against Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* A total of 4 centuries have been scored in the MLC tournament over the last 2 seasons.
* The first century in MLC was scored by Heinrich Klaasen of Seattle Orcas against MI New York in the 2023 season, with an unbeaten 110 runs off 44 balls.
* Four different batsmen have scored centuries in MLC history: Nicholas Pooran, Heinrich Klaasen, Faf du Plessis, and Ryan Rickelton, with no one scoring multiple centuries.

title: San Francisco Unicorns vs Texas Super Kings Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

The San Francisco Unicorns began their 2024 Major League Cricket season with an impressive six-wicket defeat of the Los Angeles Knight Riders in their opening match, whilst the Texas Super Kings suffered a defeat to LAKR before perhaps being saved by the rain for a no result against the Washington Freedom.

DATE & TIME: Wednesday 10th July, 2024 - USA ET – 3:00pm / USA PT – 12:00pm / West Indies – 2:00pm / UK – 8:00pm / South Africa – 9:00pm / Thursday 11th July, 2024 - Pakistan – 12:00am / India – 12:30am / Bangladesh – 1:00am / Australia – 5:00am

VENUE: Church Street Park, Morrisville, North Carolina, United States

WEATHER: 34c or 93.2 F with clear, sunny skies

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – N/A

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports app / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – Amazon Prime Video

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS FORM: SPEEDY SAN FRANCISCO

In the inaugural season of Major League Cricket last year, the San Francisco Unicorns finished fifth with two victories and three defeats in their five matches. This time, though, the Unicorns demolished LAKR. They held them to just 165-6 in their 20 overs before chasing that down with six wickets to spare in just 15.2 overs with excellent innings’ from Finn Allen and Matt Short.

LAST THREE: WLLWL

TEXAS SUPER KINGS FORM: DAD’S ARMY

With the influence of the so-called ‘Dad’s Army’ of the Chennai Super Kings in the Indian Premier League, the Texas Super Kings were beaten by 12 runs by LAKR in their opening game with TSK making just 150-8 in their 20 overs before then scoring 203-5 against the Washington Freedom. The rain helped them out, though, with the Freedom already on 62-0 in just four overs.

LAST THREE: ALLLW

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS BETTING ANALYSIS

The San Francisco Unicorns were extremely impressive with both bat and ball in their defeat of LAKR. Their top four of Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Short and Josh Inglis will likely outscore anyone and a bet on the Unicorns to post a total in advance of 200, if they bat first, would be good value as they can go hard until quite late in the order with Liam Plunkett in at nine.

Former England international Plunkett performed his excellent ‘middle overs’ role well again in their opener as he took the wicket of former teammate Jason Roy with just the third ball outside of the powerplay. With TSK’s lineup structured to take the game deep, Plunkett will be pivotal and it would therefore be worthwhile to back Plunkett to be the Unicorns’ top bowler.

TEXAS SUPER KINGS BETTING ANALYSIS

In their opening encounter, the Texas Super Kings took seven wickets against LAKR but their most threatening bowler, Marcus Stoinis, picked up two wickets but went for 37 runs in his three overs. The most control was shown by Pakistani seamer Zia-ul-Haq and him to be their best bowler, once again, in what is a fairly weak attack, would appear a good bet for this one.

With the bat, TSK will have to think about upping the run rate with Faf du Plessis’ impressive century the other day still looking like it wouldn’t have been enough to defeat Washington. Stoinis found some touch with 29 off 18 and the Aussie all-rounder to continue to grow into the tournament with a 30+ score here would be worth having a go on.

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS VS TEXAS SUPER KINGS EXPERT PREDICTION

The volatility in Twenty20 cricket means that tactical trends can be quite sweeping and come in quite quickly before fading just as fast. What is a point to mention here is that the top four of the San Francisco Unicorns features four of the modern-day white-ball players where they go hard from the off, whilst Devon Conway and Du Plessis open up for a TSK side looking to pragmatically get games won. There is perhaps no right or wrong way if you are eventually successful but it has to be said that the Unicorns, on a pitch now producing some very high scores, should simply be favoured to outscore their opposition.
summary:
The San Francisco Unicorns have started their 2024 Major League Cricket season with a six-wicket victory over the Los Angeles Knight Riders, while the Texas Super Kings suffered a defeat to LAKR and then had a no result against the Washington Freedom due to rain.

The Unicorns restricted LAKR to 165-6 in 20 overs and then chased down the target in 15.2 overs, thanks to excellent innings from Finn Allen and Matt Short. The Texas Super Kings, on the other hand, were beaten by 12 runs by LAKR in their opening game, scoring only 150-8 in 20 overs.

The article provides betting analysis for the upcoming match between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Texas Super Kings. The Unicorns are favored to post a total above 200 if they bat first, and Liam Plunkett is tipped to be their top bowler. For the Texas Super Kings, Zia-ul-Haq is expected to be their best bowler, and Marcus Stoinis is predicted to score 30+ runs.

The expert prediction is that the San Francisco Unicorns will outscore the Texas Super Kings in the upcoming match, given the Unicorns' strong top four and the high-scoring nature of the pitch.

title: Major League Cricket: Texas Super Kings Pacer Gerald Coetzee Ruled Out of MLC 2024 With Side Strain
body:
oi-Mark Hoover

Texas Super Kings on Wednesday (July 10) announced that their South African pacer Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out for the remainder of the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 due to an injury.

The 23-year-old, who was roped in for a second stint with TSK, sustained the injury in the tournament opener last week, when he finished with figures of 1 for 28 in his four overs during the team's defeat to Los Angeles Knight Riders.

The Super Kings franchise revealed the nature of injury as a "side strain" and wished the Protea quick a speedy recovery in a statement ahead of Texas Super Kings' next outing in the MLC 2024.

"He (Coetzee) sustained a low grade left side strain during Texas Super Kings' match against Los Angeles Knight Riders on July 5," TSK said in a statement. "The Super Kings wish him well as he recovers and prepares for his international commitments with South Africa."

TSK is yet to name a replacement for Coetzee, while they named veteran all-rounder Dwayne Bravo in the playing 11 for the clash against Washington Freedom on Monday (July 9).

Coetzee, who broke into the national team last year, has not featured much on the international stage this year, including South Africa's run to the T20 World Cup 2024 final.

The pacer, however, played in the 2 T20Is against West Indies in May after his first IPL stint with Mumbai Indian, for whom he played in 10 matches in 2024.

The pace-bowling all-rounder has now been named in the South African Test squad for the upcoming series, which is part of the WTC 2023-25 cycle, against West Indies, scheduled to be held next month in the Caribbean.

With at least a month needed for recovery, the all-rounder will be hoping to be fit for the first Test against the Windies, which is scheduled to be played in Trinidad starting from August 7, followed by the second Test in Guyana on August 15.
summary:
* Gerald Coetzee, a South African pacer, has been ruled out of the remainder of the MLC 2024 tournament due to a low-grade left side strain injury.
* Coetzee sustained the injury during the tournament opener on July 5, where he took 1 for 28 in four overs against Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* Texas Super Kings (TSK) has not yet named a replacement for Coetzee.
* TSK is set to face Washington Freedom in their next match, with veteran all-rounder Dwayne Bravo included in the playing 11.

Note: The article does not provide an update on the current standings or scoreboard of the MLC 2024 tournament.

title: 2024 MAJOR LEAGUE CRICKET Coming to Prime Video in Australia
body:
Prime Video will stream all 25 matches of the 2024 US Major League Cricket season in Australia and New Zealand at no extra cost to members.

Prime Video has announced its exclusive broadcasting rights for the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) season in Australia and New Zealand. The season, running from 6 July to 29 July local time (5 July to 28 July in the USA), will feature all 25 matches available at no additional cost to Prime or Prime Video members.

This announcement follows the success of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, where the USA, co-hosts of the event, advanced to the Super Eight stage in their debut.

The second MLC season will showcase top international T20 players and leading domestic talent from six major US cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C. The tournament will include eight Australian and five New Zealand players among its ranks. Notable signings include:

Pat Cummins, the Australian Test and ODI captain, joins the San Francisco Unicorns, along with Josh Inglis, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and New Zealand’s Matt Henry.

The Seattle Orcas have signed Kiwi batsman Michael Bracewell and bowler Lance Morris.

Washington Freedom will be coached by Ricky Ponting and feature Australian batters Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell, alongside New Zealand bowlers Rachin Ravindra and Lockie Ferguson.

MI New York will see the return of batter Tim David and bowler Trent Boult for a second season.

Australian bowler Adam Zampa will join the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

“At Prime Video, we are always looking for ways to deliver more value to our customers across our movies, TV series, and live sports offerings,” said Hushidar Kharas, Head of Prime Video Australia and New Zealand. “The feedback from cricket fans in Australia for our first major event, ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, has been really positive, and we are delighted to expand our live sports offering through the Cognizant Major League Cricket. We are also excited to offer our customers in New Zealand the first live sports event included in their Prime Video membership.”

“We are thrilled to announce Prime Video as our broadcast partner for Cognizant Major League Cricket in New Zealand and Australia,” added MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan. “This partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey to grow the season, which is in its second year, as well as bring the excitement of cricket to fans across the globe. Prime Video has solidified its position as a premier destination for cricket enthusiasts in Australia and New Zealand, showcasing major events such as the World Cup and acclaimed series such as The Test. MLC eagerly anticipates joining this platform, poised to contribute thrilling cricket action to its global audience through Prime Video’s extensive reach and expertise.”

Prime Video is well-regarded for its extensive sports coverage and original content in Australia and New Zealand. Notable series include The Test S1-S3, Making Their Mark, Shane, Warriors on the Field, and Kick Like Tayla. Australian Prime members recently supported the national team during the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, where Australia reached the Super Eight stage. The upcoming T20 World Cup Women’s tournament is scheduled to begin in October.

Since 2019, Prime Video has commissioned 29 Amazon Originals in Australia, including The Test, LOL: Last One Laughing Australia with Rebel Wilson, and several others like Back to the Rafters, Luxe Listings Sydney, The Moth Effect, and Burning. Additional content includes Head Above Water, Class of ’07, Deadloch, and the forthcoming The Office and The Narrow Road to the Deep North.

Prime members in Australia and Prime Video customers in New Zealand can watch all live MLC matches on various devices, including smart TVs, mobile devices, Fire TV, Fire TV stick, Fire tablets, and Apple TV. Matches can also be downloaded on mobile devices and tablets for offline viewing at no extra cost.
summary:
**Tournament Details:**

* 2024 US Major League Cricket (MLC) season will take place from July 6 to 29
* 25 matches will be played
* Tournament will feature top international T20 players and leading domestic talent from six US cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.

**Participating Teams and Players:**

* San Francisco Unicorns: Pat Cummins, Josh Inglis, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Matt Henry
* Seattle Orcas: Michael Bracewell and Lance Morris
* Washington Freedom: Steve Smith, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Rachin Ravindra, and Lockie Ferguson (coached by Ricky Ponting)
* MI New York: Tim David and Trent Boult
* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Adam Zampa

**Broadcasting Rights:**

* Prime Video has acquired exclusive broadcasting rights for the 2024 MLC season in Australia and New Zealand
* All 25 matches will be streamed at no additional cost to Prime or Prime Video members in Australia and New Zealand
* Matches can be watched on various devices, including smart TVs, mobile devices, Fire TV, Fire TV stick, Fire tablets, and Apple TV, and can be downloaded for offline viewing

**Other Notes:**

* The tournament follows the success of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, where the USA advanced to the Super Eight stage
* Prime Video is expanding its live sports offering in Australia and New Zealand, and this partnership marks a significant milestone in MLC's journey to grow the season.

body:

On the other hand, Seattle Orcas lost badly to MI New York in the tournament opener by 6 wickets.

Los Angeles Knight Riders vs Seattle Orcas, Match 6

Live Streaming: Sony Sports Network and JioCinema

What is the Pitch Report for LAKR vs SEA, Major League Cricket 2024, Match 6?

The surface produced middling scores in the last couple of matches. It’s a fast-paced wicket where seamers picked up the bulk of the wickets while spinners got a handful of them. Considering the recent scores anything more than 170 is a match-winning score here.

Los Angeles Knight Riders: Won, Lost, Won, Lost, Lost

Currently, the players from both squads are doing well and fit. It will be added when there is an update.

What are the Fantasy Cricket Top Picks, Players for LAKR vs SEA, Major League Cricket 2024, Match 6?

Top Pick – Batter

Jason Roy got back to form against Unicorns but that only limited to 26 runs, his knock comprised of 4 fours.

Top Pick – All-Rounder

Andre Russell doesn’t any introduction as he is a world-class all-rounder and the most decorated franchise player across the globe. In 2 matches in the tournament, he scored 50 runs at a strike rate of 166.66 and is yet to pick a wicket.

title: 'It was a big shock... wasn't my best self for some time': Unmukt Chand breaks silence on USA's T20 World Cup 2024 squad snub
body:
"That wasn't an ideal situation to be in. Because personally for me, this was what I had dreamed for the last three years. Obviously, it was a big shock. And it took me time to sort of come to terms with it. It's never easy as a player, having lost all those things back home in India, to have this one goal, which had kept me going for the last three years not happening," Unmukt said, as quoted by Cricbuzz, during the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

"So it is difficult. I won't say which just happened. But it was difficult. I was not my best self for some time," he added.

ALSO READ: Yusuf Pathan's 78-run knock in vain as Australia beat India by 23 runs; Dan Christian steals the show with 7 sixes to help Aussies qualify for semis

Trained in Maharashtra during T20 World Cup 2024

In Los Angeles Knight Riders’ first match of the season, he contributed with a 45-ball 68 in the win against Texas Super Kings. The Delhi-born batter revealed that he trained under his childhood coach in Maharashtra during the World Cup as co-hosts USA created history by beating Pakistan and progressed to Super 8 stage.

"That was a very internal battle and it's a sucker basically. It keeps sucking you inside and inside," he recalled.

ALSO READ: England announce playing XI for James Anderson's farewell Test vs West Indies at Lord's, Bairstow's replacement and KKR pacer to make debut

“That feeling would linger on for a day and then go away and then come back again. The reality would hit me in different phases. Once you keep going through that automatically you keep getting better. There comes a time when you're like it didn't happen, that's it. I'm not even thinking about it."

He will be seen in action when LA Knight Riders go up against Seattle Orcas at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on June 9.

MORE ON SPORTS TAK:

Rain stops Travis Head, Steve Smith's rampage as Texas Super Kings evade Washington Freedom's wrath after Faf du Plessis' 58-ball century
summary:
* Unmukt Chand, a player for the Los Angeles Knight Riders, has spoken about overcoming a personal setback, which he described as a "big shock" that took time to come to terms with.
* Despite this, he contributed to his team's win against the Texas Super Kings with a 45-ball 68 in their first match of the season.
* Chand revealed that he trained in Maharashtra during the T20 World Cup 2024, where the USA created history by beating Pakistan and progressing to the Super 8 stage.
* Chand will be seen in action again when the LA Knight Riders take on the Seattle Orcas at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on June 9.

title: "Was A Big Shock": India's U-19 World Cup Winning Captain Opens Up On USA Rejection
body:
Former India U-19 World Cup winning captain Unmukt Chand has opened up on his absence from USA's squad for the recently-concluded T20 World Cup. Chand took retirement from Indian cricket in 2021 before shifting base to the USA for better cricketing opportunities. After playing in the inaugural edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC), as well as other franchise tournaments, Chand became eligible to play for the USA. He had also expressed his wish of playing against India in the T20 World Cup, only to be left out of the squad.

Chand revealed that he was shocked after being left out of T20 World Cup squad, added that he had a feeling of being "sucked inside".

"That wasn't an ideal situation to be in. Because personally for me, this was what I had dreamed for the last three years. Obviously, it was a big shock. And it took me time to sort of come to terms with it. It's never easy as a player, having lost all those things back home in India, to having this one goal, which had kept me going for the last three years not happening. So it is difficult. I won't say which just happened. But it was difficult. I was not my best self for some time," Chand told Cricbuzz.

Chand also spoke about his inner demons and said that it took a lot of ups and downs to overcome that feeling.

"That was a very internal battle and it's a sucker basically. It keeps sucking you inside and inside. That feeling would linger on for a day and then go away and then come back again. The reality would hit me in different phases. Once you keep going through that automatically you keep getting better. There comes a time when you're like it didn't happen, that's it. I'm not even thinking about it," he added.

Chand, 31, has a point to prove, and started off the second season of Major League Cricket (MLC) - USA's franchise T20 league - with a swashbuckling half-century.

Interestingly, Chand's present MLC franchise is Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR), who are owned by the Knight Riders group. Many might remember that Chand's downfall started when he was famously clean bowled by Kolkata Knight Riders pacer Brett Lee in the opening ball of IPL 2013. He made 68 off 45 balls, hitting six 4s and three 6s.
summary:
* Unmukt Chand, a former India U-19 World Cup winning captain, played in the inaugural edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) and became eligible to play for the USA.
* Chand started off the second season of MLC with a swashbuckling half-century, scoring 68 off 45 balls, hitting six 4s and three 6s.
* He currently plays for the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) franchise, which is owned by the Knight Riders group.

title: West Indies will be 'Test match ready' while Proteas continue T20 schlep
body:
The West Indies begin a three-match Test series against England on Wednesday which, regardless of the outcome, will give them an advantage before the two Tests against the Proteas next month.

While the West Indies will be well up to speed with the Test format, by contrast, a large chunk of the 16 South African players named in the Test squad on Monday are either playing in the Major League Cricket T20 tournament in the US or not at all. Only David Bedingham, Wiaan Mulder and Matthew Breetzke are contracted on the county circuit.

At least that trio will have some first class matches under the belt and in Bedingham’s case, excellent form. Proteas coach Shukri Conrad said in a chat he had with Bedingham last week he told him to “save some runs for us”, after the 30-year-old surged to the top of the County Championship Division One run scorer’s list with an aggregate of 926 runs in 14 innings for Durham.

He has made five centuries and two half-centuries in that sequence, proving the decision to call him up for the Test squad last summer was overdue.

Bedingham’s form will be crucial, given he has rhythm in the longer format, something the MLC contracted players and those in South Africa will need to achieve through training camps and the sole warm-up match the squad will have in Trinidad before the first Test, which starts on August 7.

“We have the luxury of a warm-up game and we have 10 days in Trinidad before the first Test,” said Conrad.

Preparation for previous series against the West Indies and India last year were less than a week, so Conrad’s excitement about having 10 days is understandable.

“You have to roll with the punches, this is the modern world. I’m comfortable that guys in America can take the flight across and we have a week’s preparation before the first Test. It is what it is and we will make it work.”

The build-up to the first Test between the West Indies and England that starts at Lord’s on Wednesday has been dominated by Jimmy Anderson, who is playing his 188th and final Test. That has helped overshadow the threat the West Indies pose, particularly with the ball.

Though robbed of Kemar Roach, who was ruled out of the series with a knee injury, the West Indies still field a potent pace bowling trio in Jayden Seales, Alzarri Joseph and young sensation Shamar Joseph. The latter inspired the West Indies to their memorable victory over Australia in Brisbane earlier this year taking 7/68 in the second innings of that match.

“They have a nice [set] of fast bowlers and having won in Australia they will have added confidence,” said Conrad.

He had a first-hand look at Seales and Joseph last season when the pair toured South Africa with a West Indies A team, so there will be no surprises there. Much like England will have noted in their preparation, the West Indies’ batting isn’t as strong.

“There might be some frailties in the batting department that we can expose and exploit,” said Conrad.

The main frailty is inexperience. Among the batters, three haven’t played a Test, while three others — Kavem Hodge, Alick Athanaze and Kirk McKenzie — have a combined nine Tests between them.

They will be heavily reliant on captain Kraigg Brathwaite, former skipper Jason Holder, who wasn’t in Australia because he was contracted to the International League T20 in the UAE at the time, and wicketkeeper Joshua da Silva for their runs.
summary:
* A large chunk of South African players named in the Test squad are currently playing in the Major League Cricket (MLC) T20 tournament in the US.
* These players will need to adjust to the Test format quickly, as they will not have much preparation time before the two Tests against the West Indies next month.
* The MLC contracted players will have to rely on training camps and a sole warm-up match in Trinidad to get ready for the longer format.
* Coach Shukri Conrad is optimistic about the team's preparation, citing the luxury of a warm-up game and 10 days in Trinidad before the first Test.

title: Rickelton hits hundred on MLC debut
body:
Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock powered the Seattle Orcas to a nine-wicket win against the Los Angeles Knight Riders in Major League Cricket on Tuesday.

David Miller struck 44* off 22 balls (five fours, two sixes) to help LA post a competitive 168-5.

But it wasn’t enough as Rickelton smashed 103* off 66 balls (nine fours, five sixes) on his MLC debut, while De Kock contributed 51* off 46 balls (three fours, two sixes), to help Seattle win with a ball to spare.

It was a night to remember for Rickelton, who did not get a game for the Proteas at the recent T20 World Cup.
summary: In the Major League Cricket tournament, the Seattle Orcas defeated the Los Angeles Knight Riders by 9 wickets. LA Knight Riders scored 168-5, thanks to David Miller's 44* off 22 balls. However, Seattle Orcas chased down the target with a ball to spare, led by Ryan Rickelton's exceptional 103* off 66 balls on his MLC debut, and Quinton de Kock's 51* off 46 balls.

title: [Watch] Netravalkar Oozes Class With Wicket Of Centurion Faf Du Plessis In MLC 2024
body:
Faf du Plessis wicket by Saurabh Netravalkar (X.com)

Faf du Plessis is leading Texas Super Kings in Major League Cricket 2024, and after failing in the first game, the man got his form back and smashed a century to take his team to a commendable total of 203.

He scored his century in just 46 balls, but could not carry on and in the penultimate over of the innings, Saurabh Netravalkar got the better of Faf du Plessis. It was a full delivery, outside off and Faf du Plessis danced down the track to play it over extra cover. He did not time it well though, and ended up hitting it left of Steve Smith, who grabbed a fine catch near the 30-yard circle.

Watch the wicket of Faf du Plessis -

However, the century went in vain as rain spoiled proceedings in the second half, and the match was called off after just four overs in which Washington Freedom smashed 62 runs.

Talking about Saurabh Netravalkar, he has been in good form since the T20 World Cup 2024. He was the 'Player of the Match' in the first game of the season for Washington Freedom where he picked three wickets while giving away just 24 runs in his four overs.
summary:
* The article is reporting on a match in the Major League Cricket 2024 tournament.
* Faf du Plessis is the captain of the Texas Super Kings team in the tournament.
* In the match, du Plessis scored a century in 46 balls, helping his team reach a total of 203.
* However, he was dismissed by Saurabh Netravalkar of Washington Freedom in the penultimate over of the innings.
* Unfortunately, the match was called off due to rain after just four overs of the second innings, with Washington Freedom scoring 62 runs.
* Saurabh Netravalkar has been in good form, having been named 'Player of the Match' in the first game of the season where he took three wickets for 24 runs in four overs.

Match Preview

In Match 4 of the Major League Cricket series, the San Francisco Unicorns emerged victorious against the Los Angeles Knight Riders. The Unicorns successfully chased down the target of 165/6 set by LAKR, finishing with 166/4 in just 15.2 overs. This six-wicket win underscored the Unicorns’ impressive performance and their ability to achieve a challenging target efficiently.

The Los Angeles Knight Riders put up a competitive score of 165/6 in their allotted 20 overs. Leading the charge, Andre Russell remained unbeaten with 40 runs off 25 balls. He was well-supported by Shakib Al Hasan, who contributed a steady 35 from 26 balls, and Jason Roy, who added a brisk 26 off 18 balls. On the bowling front, Spencer Johnson was the standout performer, taking 3 wickets for 36 runs in his 4 overs. Captain Sunil Narine also chipped in with 1 wicket for 39 runs in his 4 overs, while Russell bowled a highly economical over, conceding just 17 runs.

In the inaugural match of the Major League Cricket series, MI New York claimed a convincing victory over the Seattle Orcas. The Orcas were bowled out for 108 runs in 19.1 overs. The Seattle Orcas struggled to build a substantial innings, being dismissed for 108 runs in 19.1 overs.
