* Four of the teams are owned by Indian Premier League (IPL) franchises: MI New York (Mumbai Indians), Texas Super Kings (Chennai Super Kings), LA Knight Riders (Kolkata Knight Riders), and Seattle Orcas (Delhi Capitals).
* Each team has a strong squad with top international cricketers, including Kieron Pollard, Wayne Parnell, Quinton de Kock, Faf du Plessis, Sunil Narine, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, and Finn Allen.

**Schedule and Format**

* The teams will compete in a round-robin league format, playing each other once.
* The top four teams will progress to the playoffs.
* The playoffs will consist of an eliminator, qualifier, and challenger, with the final taking place on July 29 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.
* The initial 15 matches will be split between two venues: Church Street Park in North Carolina and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. The final six group matches and the knockout fixtures will be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium.

**Opening Match**

* The tournament will begin with a rematch of last year's final, with MI New York taking on Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park in North Carolina.

I hope this summary provides a concise overview of the MLC 2024 tournament!

title: Haris Rauf, Fakhar Zaman among Pakistan players to get NOC from PCB for T20 leagues
body:
Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has officially confirmed providing No Objection Certificate (NOC) to 12 of their players for different T20 leagues and County Championship. Mohammad Amir is the only player among them to turn up in County Championship for Derbyshire from July 4 to 20. As many as three players will play in the second edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) from July 4 to July 28.

Abrar Ahmed, Haris Rauf and Zaman Khan will be featuring in MLC that is set to commence on July 5 and will conclude on July 28. Interestingly, there is a mention of Amir playing in County Championship but not of Imad Wasim featuring for Seattle Orcas in the PCB press release. Both players took back their international retirement for the recently concluded T20 World Cup but Pakistan got knocked out in the group stage and it is still not clear if they will continue playing for the country.

The fifth edition of the Lanka Premier League (LPL) got underway on July 1 (Monday) and four more players from the country will feature in the tournament. Mohammad Haris, Shadab Khan, Salman Ali Agha and Mohammad Hasnain (not centrally contracted) will turn for different teams in the tournament.

Two players who are not in the scheme of things for Pakistan - Sharjeel Khan and Sohaib Maqsood - have also been granted permission to play in the World Championship of Legends, the tournament in which mostly retired players like Yuvraj Singh and Chris Gayle among many other stars are taking part.

Another Pakistan star Fakhar Zaman has got the NOC from the board to feature in the Caribbean Premier League (CPL) that is to be played from August 29 to October 6. He is set to play for new franchise Antigua and Barbuda Falcons. Imad Wasim and Amir are also set to play for the same team but again, there is no mention of them getting NOC for the same. For the unversed, PCB allows its centrally contracted players to feature in only two T20 leagues apart from Pakistan Super League (PSL).

List of Pakistan players to get NOC from PCB:

Abrar Ahmed – Major League Cricket – 4 to 28 July
summary:
* The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has granted No Objection Certificates (NOCs) to three Pakistani players to participate in the second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament.
* The three players are Abrar Ahmed, Haris Rauf, and Zaman Khan.
* The MLC tournament is scheduled to take place from July 5 to July 28.

title: [Watch] Jason Roy Back In Knight Riders Family; Swings Hard Ahead Of MLC 2024
body:
Jason Roy in action ahead of MLC 2024 (X.com)

Jason Roy opted himself out of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024, in which Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) won the title after 10 long years under the leadership of Shreyas Iyer and mentor Gautam Gambhir.

Of course, Roy's replacement Phil Salt played a crucial role in order to make it happen. However, KKR dearly missed Roy before Salt's carnage began, as he set the stage on fire in the previous edition.

As Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 is set to get underway on July 6, Roy, who has also been signed by Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR), has seen back in Purple and Gold colours. In fact, he had a little candid conversation with the camera person before taking the centre stage by swinging hard.

Watch - Jason Roy Practices Hard Ahead Of MLC 2024

Roy, 33 now, played only three matches for LAKR last year, in which he aggregated 54 runs at a strike rate of 150. He smashed five fours and four sixes, and will be looking to improve his numbers this time around.

LAKR will begin the MLC 2024 campaign by going up against Texas Super Kings on July 6.
summary:
* The MLC 2024 tournament is set to begin on July 6.
* Jason Roy, who opted out of IPL 2024, has joined Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and has been practicing ahead of the tournament.
* Roy played only three matches for LAKR last year, scoring 54 runs at a strike rate of 150, with 5 fours and 4 sixes.
* LAKR will start their MLC 2024 campaign against Texas Super Kings on July 6.

title: I don't have any plan for myself at this moment: Shakib
body:
DHAKA, July 2, 2024 (BSS) - Ace allrounder Shakib Al Hasan said he wants to focus solely on cricket at this moment, rather than thinking about the future of his career.

"I don't have any plan for myself at this moment. I have two T20 tournaments ahead of me--an MLC (Major League Cricket) organized by USA and the next is Canada's Global T20. I will play those two tournaments and see how it is going. After that, there is a Test series against Pakistan and I will play that series. That's the plan for now," Shakib said here today as he was leaving the country for USA to play MLC.

Shakib had below par T20 World Cup campaign this year, which encouraged his critics to lash out at him vehemently. They raised their voice high about his immediate retirement, citing the reason that at the age of 37, it would be tough for the allrounder to regain his form.

Earlier, Shakib revealed that he would retire from the cricket after the Champions Trophy in 2025 but recently in an interview with the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) he revealed that he wants to play another ODI World Cup which is in 2027.

But it looked he changed his plan again.

"I didn't really plan too much. I need to understand my physical condition. At this moment it is not possible for me to plan for the next three or four years. I think it's better to plan for three or six months. For the time being, my plan is for Pakistan series, then I will see what next for me," Shakib added.

Bangladesh won three matches of the group phase in T20 World Cup and moved up to the Supe 8 for only the second time in tournament's history. However they lost all three matches in Super 8 phase and even though they had the golden chance to make it semifinal, Bangladesh's safe cricket sank them at the end.

"May be we didn't play all out cricket. We didn't get the kind of results we expected or the kind of results we had a chance of getting. We fulfilled the initial (Super Eight) target, so it is successful from that point of view. It's a bit disappointing for us because we couldn't go to the semifinal."

In response to a query why they couldn't make it possible to make it semis, Shakib said, 'It is difficult to say. In fact, I am sure those who are there will decide that why we can't make it. The coach, captain, team and others who are in the cricket operations, board and others will discuss together to sort it out."

title: PCB grants noc to 12 cricketers for global league participation
body:
The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has granted no-objection certificates (NOCs) to 12 cricketers, allowing them to participate in various international leagues and tournaments.

This decision enables players to showcase their talents globally while adhering to PCB's policies.

Mystery spinner Abrar Ahmed will compete in Major League Cricket from July 4 to July 28, while Fakhar Zaman will join the Caribbean Premier League, spanning from August 29 to October 6.

Pacer Haris Rauf is set to play in Major League Cricket from July 5 to July 28, and Mohammad Amir will represent County Cricket from July 4 to July 20.

Additionally, Mohammad Haris, Mohammad Hasnain (a non-centrally contracted player), Salman Ali Agha, and Shadab Khan will all participate in the Lanka Premier League from July 1 to July 21.

Sharjeel Khan and Sohaib Maqsood are slated for the World Championship of Legends, scheduled from July 3 to July 13.

Usama Mir will compete in The Hundred, scheduled from July 23 to August 20, and Zaman Khan will join Major League Cricket from July 4 to July 28.

However, Pakistan's wicketkeeper-batsman Azam Khan and opening batsman Saim Ayub could not obtain NOCs as they are part of the Guyana Warriors for the upcoming CPL 2024.

Azam also recently opted out of the Lanka Premier League (LPL) in adherence to the PCB's policy of granting NOCs to players for participation in a maximum of two leagues annually.
summary:
* The Major League Cricket tournament will take place from July 4 to July 28.
* Three Pakistani cricketers will participate in the tournament: Abrar Ahmed, Haris Rauf, and Zaman Khan.
* All three players will play in the tournament from July 4 to July 28.

title: 'I don't have many plans' - Shakib Al Hasan yet to decide on India tour participation
body:
Shakib Al Hasan said he will decide on his participation in Bangladesh's upcoming tour of India only after completing his commitments in Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 and Global T20 League Canada 2024. Bangladesh are scheduled to play two Tests and three T20Is against India from September 19 to October 12 following their tour of Pakistan in August, where they are slated to play a two-match Test series.

The legendary all-rounder departed from Dhaka to the USA on Monday, July 1, to take part in the second edition of MLC. He will be plying his trade for Los Angeles Knight Riders, who finished last in the inaugural season last year. Shakib informed that he isn't thinking too far ahead, having only planned till the tour of Pakistan next month.

“I don't have many plans. There are two T20 tournaments in front of me one is MLC and the other one is the Global T20 League in Canada and let me see where I stand after playing these two tournaments because I need to understand [how I feel],” Shakib was quoted as saying by Cricbuzz.

“There is international cricket and there is a series against Pakistan, and I am planning till that point of time and not planning beyond that. Now I don't have time to plan for three-four years and so planning for three to six months is better and later will think about my next plan and so till now I am planning till the Pakistan series,” the experienced cricketer added.

Also Read: Warner, Babar, Narine, Shakib among galaxy of stars to light up GT20 Canada 2024

Taskin Ahmed apologized for missing the team bus: Shakib

Taskin Ahmed was surprisingly left out of the playing XI in Bangladesh's crucial Super Eights fixture in the recently concluded T20 World Cup 2024 against eventual champions India in Antigua. A Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) official had recently revealed that the pacer woke up late in the morning and missed the team bus. Shakib also spoke along those lines and said that the 29-year-old apologized for his negligence.

“The team bus starts at a certain point and there is a rule for cricketers that team bus does not stop for anyone and if anyone misses it in that case he comes in the next car. The manager's car or a taxi is there and the support of transport was difficult in the West Indies. When Taskin arrived it was five to 10 minutes before the toss, and certainly it was difficult to pick him at that point in the team and it was difficult for him as well,” Shakib said.

Also Read: T20 World Cup 2024: Taskin Ahmed apologises for missing team bus after waking up late for India game

“Taskin apologized to the team for that afterwards and everyone in the team took it normally because a man can mistake and anyone can commit unintentional mistake, and he accepted it and the thing ended at that point of time,” the cricketer said.
summary:
* Shakib Al Hasan has departed for the USA to participate in the second edition of the MLC 2024.
* He will be playing for the Los Angeles Knight Riders, who finished last in the inaugural season last year.
* Shakib will decide on his participation in Bangladesh's upcoming tour of India after completing his commitments in MLC 2024 and the Global T20 League Canada 2024.

No other information about the MLC tournament is mentioned in the article.

title: PCB issues NOC to 12 players including Mohammad Amir
body:
The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) on Tuesday issued a No Objection Certificate (NOC) to 12 players to participate in different leagues across the world.

Some of the players from the list are part of Pakistan’s central contract while the others have not played for the Green Shirts in a long time.

Mystery spinner Abrar Ahmed, and pacers Zaman Khan and Haris Rauf will be in action in the Major League Cricket (MLC) which is set to begin on July 5 in the United States.

Mohammad Haris, Salman Ali Agha, Shadab Khan and Mohammad Hasnain (non-centrally contracted) will be in action in the Lanka Premier League (LPL) which is currently underway in Sri Lanka.

Sharjeel Khan and Sohaib Maqsood, who have not played for Pakistan in a long time will participate in the World Championship of Legends from July 3 to 13.

Left-arm pacer Mohammad Amir will play County Cricket from July 4 to 20, explosive batter Fakhar Zaman will be in action in the Caribbean Premier League (CPL) from August 29 to October 6 while wrist spinner Usama Mir will feature in England’s The Hundred from July 23 to August 20.

It is worth mentioning that the PCB has a policy where centrally contracted players cannot play more than two leagues. Due to that reason, wicketkeeper batter Azam Khan withdrew from LPL as he could not get NOC from the board.

Azam was part of LPL side B-Love Kandy who will begin their campaign against Colombo Strikers on Tuesday.

Saim Ayub and Azam are also part of Guyana Warriors for the upcoming CPL 2024 but both are yet to obtain NOC from the PCB.

List of Pakistani players to get NOCs

Abrar Ahmed – Major League Cricket

Fakhar Zaman – Caribbean Premier League

Haris Rauf – Major League Cricket

Mohammad Amir – County Cricket

Mohammad Haris – Lanka Premier League

Mohammad Hasnain – Lanka Premier League

Salman Ali Agha – Lanka Premier League

Shadab Khan – Lanka Premier League

Sharjeel Khan – World Championship of Legends

Sohaib Maqsood – World Championship of Legends

Usama Mir – The Hundred

Zaman Khan – Major League Cricket
summary:
* The MLC is set to begin on July 5 in the United States.
* Three Pakistani players have been issued NOCs to participate in the MLC: 
  - Abrar Ahmed, a mystery spinner.
  - Haris Rauf, a pacer.
  - Zaman Khan, a pacer.

title: Seattle Orcas include two new brands to their sponsorship kitty ahead of MLC 2024
body:
The Major League Cricket (MLC) team, Seattle Orcas have inked sponsorship deals with Masuri and T10 Sports, ahead of the second season.

As part of the agreement, T10 Sports has been appointed as the unit’s official kit & merchandise partner, while Masuri has become the official supplier of the squad for the MLC 2024.

T10 Sports offers a diverse selection of sports, athleisure, and lifestyle clothes and items, that one can purchase online, in-store, or at one of its locations. The firm provides a worldwide value experience to sports communities throughout the world as well as retail, online brand stores, team wear, schools, and corporate wear to a wide range of clientele.

Masuri is a growing sports goods company that specialises in developing and manufacturing industry-leading safety equipment. The corporation, headquartered in Winchester, is well-known in several worldwide markets, including the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, and India.

Before these agreements, the team also inked partnerships with GMR Group, and Veeam Software.
summary: The Seattle Orcas, a team in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament, have announced sponsorship deals with two companies ahead of the 2024 season. T10 Sports will be the team's official kit and merchandise partner, while Masuri will be the official supplier of safety equipment. This comes after the team previously signed partnerships with GMR Group and Veeam Software.

When does MLC start in 2024?

MLC is scheduled to kick off on July 13, 2024, after facing several delays.

What is the format of MLC?

MLC will follow a format similar to the IPL, with six teams competing in a round-robin style before advancing to the playoffs. title: Major League Cricket 2024 Points Table, Match Schedule and Teams

The second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) will be played from 5 to 28 July 2023 in the USA. The league was established in 2019 and approved by ICC and USA Cricket. The first season was played in 2023. Six teams based out of major US cities like Texas, Los Angeles, Washington, Seattle, New York and San Francisco will take part in the second season.

The first match of the 2024 MLC season is between defending champions MI New York and Seattle Orcas on 6th July 2024 at 1 AM IST at the Church Street Park, Morrisville.

You can join contests for all American Cricket League matches on Howzat and win big daily. Download the fantasy app and make your dream team now!

MLC 2024 Points Table

Major League Cricket 2024 Teams

Four of the six teams (Texas, Los Angeles, New York and Seattle) are owned by the IPL franchise owners.

Major League Cricket 2024 Schedule

The 2024 edition of the USA T20 League will have a total of 25 games (21 group stage and 4 playoffs fixtures) played during the tournament. The day matches have a start time of 12.30/1 AM IST and the evening matches will start at 6 AM IST.

In the group stage, every team will play against each other only once. The top 4 teams will qualify for the playoffs - Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger and the Final. The final will be played on 28 July 2024 (July 31 in India). Two venues - Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas and Church Street Park Stadium in Morrisville will host all the matches. The playoffs will be played in Dallas.

MLC 2024 Team Squads

Every team can include a minimum of 16 and a maximum of 19 players. A maximum of nine international players can be in the squad. title: All you need to know about the MLC Season 2
body:
Major League Cricket is returning with its second season after the grand success and launch of the league during its inaugural run in 2023. The 2024 season starts July 5, with the Championship Final taking place at Grand Prairie Stadium on July 28. Here’s your guide to the upcoming exciting season of the MLC in the USA.

How many teams are going to participate?

Just like the inaugural season, the second season of the MLC will see all the six founding teams clashing against each other with the Seattle Orcas, MI New York, LA Knight Riders, Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns and Texas Super Kings battling it out

Where is it going to be played?

After the success that was the first season, the league will be played across the two venues which also hosted the matches last year - Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

Has the format changed?

Yes. The league's first season was played in a single round robin format with 15 league stages matches. However, the second season will see an increase to 21 league games, with each of the teams playing seven games instead of five last season. The tournament will then move to the playoff stages, which will follow the same format as the first season with a Qualifier, Challenger and Eliminator to be played before the summit clash.

MLC has been given List A status. What does that mean?

Earlier this year, the ICC awarded the MLC with List A status, making it only the second Associate-run franchise competition to acquire the status from the game’s governing body. This basically means all the records, runs, wickets and stats acquired in the MLC will now be added to the official records of the format. It also means that MLC is now an official T20 League, much like the IPL or the SA20 or Big Bash League.

How long are the games?

The T20 format is a shortened version of cricket that lasts approx 3- 3 ½ hours.

Where can we watch MLC?

To cheer on your Seattle Orcas in person, all matches will be broadcast at all 5 locations at Flat Stick Pub (https://flatstickpub.com/locations/). For more info check out our watch party events on Facebook.

Kirkland

Redmond

Pioneer Square

South Lake Union

Bellingham

Spokane

The broadcasters vary, so check your local listings to see if these are included in your channel package:
summary:
**Season Details:**

* The second season of MLC will start on July 5, 2024, and the Championship Final will take place on July 28, 2024, at Grand Prairie Stadium.

**Teams:**

* There will be 6 teams participating in the tournament, the same as the inaugural season: Seattle Orcas, MI New York, LA Knight Riders, Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns, and Texas Super Kings.

**Venues:**

* The tournament will be played across two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

**Format:**

* The format has been changed from a single round-robin to 21 league games, with each team playing 7 games.
* The tournament will then move to the playoff stages, with a Qualifier, Challenger, and Eliminator, followed by the Championship Final.

**List A Status:**

* The MLC has been awarded List A status by the ICC, making it an official T20 League, and all records, runs, wickets, and stats will be added to the official records of the format.

**Game Duration:**

* The T20 format games will last approximately 3-3.5 hours.

**Broadcasting:**

* All matches will be broadcast at 5 locations of Flat Stick Pub, and viewers can also check their local listings for broadcasting channels.

title: WPTF Afternoon News - Steve Rao on Morrisville Hosting Major League Cricket in July 2024 \ 7-2-2024
body: Morrisville is one of only two hosts for the Major League Cricket games in the United States in July 2024. The Town of Morrisville will play host to Cognizant Major League Cricket from July 5-17 at Church Street Park. Major League Cricket will kick off its second season on July 5 at Church Street Park in Morrisville when the defending league champions, MI New York, will face the Seattle Orcas to open a doubleheader. On July 6, MI New York will face the Washington Freedom. Steve Rao, a member of the Morrisville Town Council, joined Jeff Hamlin on the WPTF Afternoon News to discuss the opening weekend of the second season of Major League Cricket.

The tournament's second season will kick off on July 5 with a doubleheader featuring the defending champions, MI New York, against the Seattle Orcas. On July 6, MI New York will face the Washington Freedom.

title: San Francisco Unicorns partners with Bay area Cadillac group
body:
Local Bay Area Cadillac dealership group named as Official Luxury Vehicle of the San Francisco Unicorns for the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) season.

Partnership will see dealership’s branding displayed on the back of the Unicorns’ playing jerseys throughout the tournament.

The second season of MLC will begin on July 5, with the first of the Unicorns’ seven regular-season matches taking place on July 7. Tickets for all matches are available now at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com.

The San Francisco Unicorns has announced local Bay Area dealership group, consisting of Dublin Cadillac, Fremont Cadillac and Stevens Creek Cadillac as its Official Luxury Vehicle partner for the imminent Major League Cricket season.

The agreement sees the famed Cadillac logo displayed on the back of the Unicorns’ player jersey for the duration of the MLC season, set to be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium near Dallas, TX, and the Church Street Park in Morrisville, NC, throughout July.

The Cadillac dealership is a prominent seller of luxury new and used vehicles around the Bay Area, and is currently run by its CEO, founder and automotive entrepreneur Inder Dosanjh.

Inder Dosanjh, CEO and Founder of California Automotive Retailing Group, said: “San Francisco Unicorns continue to make waves among a growing community of cricket fans in the Bay Area, many of whom are regulars across our Cadillac dealerships, and we’re thrilled to partner them towards success in this year’s MLC.

“They’re commitment to excellence both on and off the pitch chimes with our own and Cadillac’s path to success, and our local team are excited to have global superstars like Pat Cummins displaying the logo throughout the event.”

David White, General Manager of San Francisco Unicorns, added: “Our Bay Area footprint is key to our sustainable, ambitious vision to grow cricket and support for the Unicorns over time, and this group partnership with one of the most recognizable dealerships in the area cements this.

“We’ll be proud to display the Dosanjh Family Auto Group and the Cadillac logo around our MLC matches this season, and we hope that those watching back in San Francisco and its surrounds will appreciate the home connection with one of its much-loved institutions.”

The Unicorns’ 2024 roster features Australia captain Pat Cummins, explosive batters Finn Allen and Matt Short, recent USA T20 World Cup hero and club captain Corey Anderson, and express bowler Haris Rauf. For the second successive season, the Unicorns will be coached by two-time Indian Premier League (IPL) Player of the Season Shane Watson.

Get your tickets now for the second season of Major League Cricket – America’s first professional T20 Cricket League! See the superstars of cricket from around the world up close as the SF Unicorns take on the Seattle Orcas.

With matches featuring international icons like Pat Cummins, Andre Russell, David Miller, and many others, this tournament is set to light up stadiums across the country.

The tournament begins on July 5 and runs until the grand finale on July 28. The opening game features MI New York taking on the Seattle Orcas, setting the stage for a thrilling competition.

The matches will be played at 12:30 AM, 1:00 AM, and 6:00 AM Indian Standard Time (IST), accommodating cricket fans worldwide. The tournament will see 21 matches in the group stage, followed by an Eliminator, Qualifier, and Challenger before the much-anticipated final.

The opening match of MLC 2024 will feature MI New York and the Seattle Orcas. title: Cricket has tried to captivate Americans before. Will this time be different?
body:
For Major League Cricket organizers, the timing couldn’t be better.

On the heels of a T20 men’s cricket World Cup in which the American co-hosts scored a signature victory over Pakistan in the group stage, the domestic cricket league sees momentum for greater growth.

MLC opens its second season July 5, six days after the World Cup final won by India. Organizers hope the United States’ success helps push the sport, and ultimately the league, more deeply into America’s sports consciousness.

“Cricket has tried and failed in this country for probably 25, 30 years,” MLC director Justin Geale said. “This is the furthest anyone’s got, so we’ve got to keep that momentum going.”

Cricket’s global popularity may come as a shock to some American sports fans.

It is the most popular sport in India, the world’s most populous country, and enjoys similar appeal in parts of the Caribbean and countries such as England, South Africa and Australia. The Indian Premier League, the country’s top domestic T20 circuit, has grown into one of the world’s most lucrative leagues; and the sport, which is the second-most-watched in the world, will return to the Olympics in 2028 following a 128-year hiatus.

Advertisement

Previous attempts to find a place for cricket in the American sports landscape haven’t worked out.

Short-lived Pro Cricket operated an eight-team league in 2004. It aimed to capitalize on the advent of professional T20 cricket in the United Kingdom but folded after one season. (T20, or Twenty20, is a faster, shortened version of the sport.) The American Premier League, another T20 competition, failed to launch in 2009, though it finally got off the ground in 2021.

Major League Cricket debuted in July 2023. The league features six teams: from New York, Seattle, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Washington and Grand Prairie, Tex. (near Dallas), competing in the T20 format. Bolstered by $120 million in investment, those teams include some of the top players in the world who are able to play during their offseasons. Games have been contested only in Texas and North Carolina, but organizers say most of the funding will be used for building or upgrading eight venues across the country.

Advertisement

Their goal is to grow the sport in America, ideally beyond the South Asian diaspora. They said they don’t want to compete for sports supremacy with the NFL or the NBA. MLC aims to capitalize on burgeoning interest in cricket so the league can eventually become a more casual presence in American sports fans’ lives — and benefit from the more lucrative broadcast deals that expansive popularity invites.

A promising first season outperformed the league’s expectations, with games selling out at the venue (capacity: 3,500) in Morrisville, N.C., outside Raleigh, and those in the stadium in Grand Prairie (capacity: 7,200) averaging more than 80 percent capacity. Saurabh Netravalkar, a breakout star at the World Cup, and other players said they were pleasantly surprised by the professionalism and quality of competition.

“We learned an awful lot,” Geale said. “What’s most pleasing is it actually worked. You spend three years trying to plan and you theorize, but people actually came, so our crowds were really positive — and we didn’t help ourselves. We’re playing in Texas in the middle of summer.”

Advertisement

The league’s priority now is building venues in other cities to connect with fans in those areas. It is a critical but ongoing challenge that could have teams relying on temporary facilities such as the one used in New York for the World Cup as they work to secure more permanent grounds.

The Seattle Orcas are developing a stadium east of the city in Redmond, Wash., and the San Francisco Unicorns are planning a Santa Clara venue the team hopes will become part of a larger sports and entertainment hub. The Washington Freedom was in negotiations with George Mason University to build a temporary baseball and cricket stadium on the Northern Virginia school’s west campus, but plans fell through in March after students and local residents opposed the project, and the university president later said it “does not meet the strategic objectives and interests of our campus and community and the Washington Freedom.” Franchises in New York and Los Angeles also are seeking stadiums.

That’s why teams play in North Carolina and Texas, though the league has mandated each team secure a home ground by 2028, when Los Angeles will host the Summer Olympics.

Advertisement

“Our biggest challenge is infrastructure. If we had more places to play, we’d go and play, so that’s holding back our growth,” Geale said. “We’re looking to build stadiums as quick as we can in all these areas. As soon as we can do that, I think we can grow quicker, the season can get longer; we can really talk to local fans and build a brand around, say, the Washington Freedom, rather than trying to do that over a distance.”

For players, that can mean little to no connection to their “home” city for the time being.

Last season, Freedom players attended a preseason camp in the Dallas area a few weeks before the start of the season in July. The first half of their schedule was in Texas, the second half in North Carolina, then back to Dallas for the playoffs. Netravalkar plays for the Freedom while working as a software engineer for Oracle in the Bay Area. He said last year he only ventured east for MLC events in Texas and North Carolina.

Advertisement

Ahead of Year 2, some things will change.

MLC games were broadcast in more than 80 countries last year and were shown via Sling TV and Willow TV, which streams overseas cricket events. Select games aired on CBS Sports Network. To expand coverage in 2024, MLC is negotiating partnerships with regional sports networks in its six cities. There will be six more matches on the schedule, up from 19. Teams such as the Freedom are considering how to engage their local fans from a distance — through clinics, meet-and-greets or contests where winners are flown out to watch games in person.

Despite its stadium struggles, MLC is poised for expansion. Geale said it could add two teams by 2026 and is eyeing franchises in Atlanta, Chicago, Toronto, New Jersey and South Florida.

MLC has a developmental minor league through which it is helping cultivate young domestic talent. Over time, the idea is for pro teams and their players to be more involved in their communities through coaching, mentorship and other forms of outreach.

Advertisement

Then there is the development of the U.S. men’s and women’s national teams.

The men’s upset over 2022 T20 World Cup runner-up Pakistan last month helped them qualify for the tournament’s second round, called the Super Eight, where the team’s dream run ended. Still, its advancement means it automatically qualifies for the 2026 edition of the tournament hosted by India and Sri Lanka. Geale believes the success drives more attention to the sport and opens the door for the league to negotiate better broadcast opportunities.

Netravalkar, a bowler for the U.S. national team, said MLC already has contributed to that effort.

“I think Major League the first season really helped us because that gave us the platform to play on quality pitches within the U.S. and to sort of rub shoulders with some of the top cricketers across the globe in front of good crowds,” he said.

“It’s really heartening to see that cricket has arrived,” he added. “We planted a seed for growth, and Major League being immediately after the World Cup helps a lot to continue that trajectory and make it even bigger.”
summary:
**Timing and Momentum**: The MLC's second season is set to start on July 5, just six days after the T20 men's cricket World Cup final, which could help capitalize on the momentum of the US team's recent success.

**Background**: Cricket is the second-most-watched sport in the world, but previous attempts to establish a professional league in the US have failed. MLC debuted in July 2023 with six teams competing in the T20 format, featuring top players from around the world.

**Season 1**: The first season of MLC outperformed expectations, with sold-out games in Morrisville, NC, and high attendance in Grand Prairie, TX. The league received positive feedback from players and fans alike.

**Challenges and Goals**: The league's biggest challenge is building infrastructure, including permanent venues in each city. The goal is to create a more casual presence in American sports fans' lives and eventually secure more lucrative broadcast deals.

**Expansion and Growth**: MLC is planning to expand to new cities, including Atlanta, Chicago, Toronto, New Jersey, and South Florida, with the aim of adding two new teams by 2026. The league is also developing a minor league to cultivate young domestic talent and plans to increase community outreach and engagement.

**Broadcast and Partnerships**: MLC games will be broadcast in more than 80 countries, and the league is negotiating partnerships with regional sports networks in its six cities. Select games will air on CBS Sports Network.

**US National Teams**: The success of the US men's national team, including their upset win over Pakistan, has helped drive more attention to the sport. MLC's director believes this will open up better broadcast opportunities for the league.

title: Andre Russell Slams Haris Rauf For 107m Six In Major League Cricket. Watch.
body:
Perhaps the greatest six-hitter in T20s, West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell has proved his ability once again, with a stunning 107m six. Playing for Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) in USA's Major League Cricket (MLC), Russell hammered Pakistan's Haris Rauf for a towering 107m six in the final over of their innings. Russell's six and 15 runs off the 20th over helped LAKR to a total of 165/6 against the San Francisco Unicorns, which they were unable to defend.

The video of the six went viral on social media, posted by the official account of Major League Cricket.

Watch: Andre Russell's gigantic 107m six

In the third ball of the final over, the mighty Jamaican power-hitter heaved a pitched-up ball by Haris Rauf into the stands over the mid-wicket region, making it the longest six of MLC season two. Russell contributed an unbeaten 25-ball 40 to help LAKR to a fighting score.

However, LAKR's total would not be enough, as the San Francisco Unicorns made mincemeat of the target and chased it down in just 15.2 overs.

LAKR now stand on one win and two defeats after three games, having finished the previous season at the bottom of the table.

Andre Russell has been in good form in 2024. Russell contributed heavily with both bat and ball as Kolkata Knight Riders won IPL 2024. He scored 222 runs and picked up 19 wickets, finishing as the joint fourth-highest wicket-taker in the tournament.

His turnout wasn't as great in the 2024 T20 World Cup on home soil, as West Indies crashed out in the Super 8 stage after winning all of their group games.

However, Russell has put his T20 World Cup disappointment behind him, and reunited with Kolkata Knight Riders teammate Sunil Narine, who's captaining LAKR in MLC. LAKR's next match is against the San Francisco Unicorns again, on Sunday, July 14.
summary:
* Andre Russell hit a 107m six, the longest of MLC season two, while playing for Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) against San Francisco Unicorns.
* Russell scored an unbeaten 40 off 25 balls to help LAKR reach a total of 165/6, but they were unable to defend it.
* LAKR now has one win and two defeats after three games, having finished at the bottom of the table in the previous season.
* LAKR's next match is against San Francisco Unicorns again, on Sunday, July 14.

title: Major League Cricket: Seattle Orcas down La Knight Riders by 9 Wickets
body:
Now the Major League Cricket in the United States is in full swing. The Seattle Orcas, have registered their first win of the competition. Following the disappointment of the first game, when the team from Washington state went down tamely to MI New York, the Orcas, led by South Africa international Heinrich Klaasen came back strong to down the La Knight Riders by nine Wickets.

It was a measured performance by the Seattle Orcas. Having restricted the powerful La Knight Riders batting lineup to 168 for 5 in their 20 overs, the Orcas didn’t seem it necessary to rush their response. Having lost opener Nauman Anwar early, the team settled down to pace the innings, and to get to the target with as few risks as possible. Which is what they did.

Seattle Orcas Restrict the La Knight Riders

Despite losing their last game against the San Francisco Unicorns, the La Knight Riders are a force to be reckoned with. With top-class batters like David Miller, and Andre Russell in the lineup. And the Knight Riders got off to a decent start, posting 67 in 9.3 overs at the fall of the 2nd wicket. However, that is when the Seattle Orcas’ bowling attack put the screws on the La middle order.

With Cameron Gannon, Zaman Khan, and Imad Wasim locking down the opposition batsman and knocking a few off as well. Jason Roy was the top scorer for the La Knight Riders with 69 off 52 deliveries. With late impetus provided by David Miller who smashed 44 off 22 inclusive of two sixes. The trouble was this was not enough, especially given the batting of the opposition.

Orcas Chase – The Ryan Rickelton Show

169 was one of those scores in T20 cricket. A score that is not too imposing but not an easy one either. And a lot depends on how the top order of the chasing side pace themselves in going about it. For the Seattle Orcas, that man happened to be Ryan Rickelton. The 27-year-old South African native played a superb 103 off 66 inclusive of five sixes.

This meant that other players, Quinton de Kock to be exact, just had to hang around and provide support whilst Rickelton blasted the Knight Riders bowling to all corners. However, as the game neared its end, things became a bit tricky, as the Orcas got to the score with just one ball to spare. But a win is a win. However going forward, they would not like to cut it that fine. With the power-hitting that is at their disposal, finishing games off sooner rather than later should be the way forward for the Orcas.

Major League Cricket Table – No Clear Leaders At the Moment

Whilst it is still early days for the season and the league as a whole-things are already shaping up pretty nicely, as the six major franchises battle it out for the top spot. With five of the six teams registering a win, with no result leaves the Texas Super Kings with no points. For cricket fans in America and elsewhere, if there were questions surrounding the quality of players and competitiveness of the cricket being played, games like this should put those doubts to rest.
summary:
**Match Result:** Seattle Orcas won their first match of the tournament, defeating La Knight Riders by 9 wickets.

**Key Performances:**

* Ryan Rickelton of Seattle Orcas scored 103 off 66 balls, including 5 sixes, to lead his team's chase.
* Jason Roy of La Knight Riders top-scored with 69 off 52 balls.
* David Miller of La Knight Riders scored 44 off 22 balls, including 2 sixes.

**Tournament Standings:** The league table is currently tight, with five out of six teams having registered a win. The Texas Super Kings are the only team without a point.

**Notable Mentions:**

* Seattle Orcas restricted La Knight Riders to 168/5 in their 20 overs, thanks to a strong bowling performance by Cameron Gannon, Zaman Khan, and Imad Wasim.
* The La Knight Riders' top-class batting lineup, including David Miller and Andre Russell, was unable to overcome the Orcas' bowling attack.

title: Gerald Coetzee out of MLC 2024 due to injury | Major League Cricket, 2024
body:
Texas Super Kings (TSK) fast bowler Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 due to a low-grade left side strain. He suffered the injury during TSK's first game of the season against Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR), where he finished with figures of 1/28. A replacement is yet to be named for the 23-year-old, but veteran all-rounder Dwayne Bravo replaced him in the XI for the upcoming game against Washington Freedom.

Coetzee was part of South Africa's T20 World Cup 2024 squad, but he did not play a game despite playing a couple of games in the T20 International (T20I) series against the West Indies prior to the tournament. The Proteas finished runners-up at the marquee event, losing to India by seven runs in the final in Barbados.

South Africa will hope that their fast bowler recovers in time for the tour of the West Indies. He was recently named in the 16-member Test squad. The first Test of the series will begin on August 7 in Trinidad, while the second match will be played in Guyana from August 15.

Coetzee has played three Tests since making his debut last year. He has picked up 10 wickets at 24.50 in the format so far.
summary:
* Texas Super Kings (TSK) fast bowler Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of MLC 2024 due to a low-grade left side strain suffered during a game against Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR).
* Coetzee finished with figures of 1/28 in the affected game, and a replacement is yet to be named.
* Veteran all-rounder Dwayne Bravo has replaced Coetzee in the XI for the upcoming game against Washington Freedom.

title: Mohsin Mohammed, Devon Conway propel Texas Super Kings to first win in MLC 2024
body:
Morrisville [US], : The Texas Super Kings secured their first win in the 2024 Major League Cricket season, beating San Franciso Unicorns by seven wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Thursday.

With a handy total of only 127 needed for a win, openers Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway got off the blocks quickly, setting the tone for the innings. Faf was not as aggressive as he was on the way to his century in the previous game against Washington Freedom but played second fiddle to his New Zealand partner's power-hitting.

Eventually scoring 34 off 17, du Plessis gave away a simple catch, but by then more than half of the total was chased down. Conway took a blow to his fingers and was forced to retire hurt after scoring 32 off 19, but Aaron Hardie took the game on his shoulders thereafter. His 34 off 23 balls effectively helped his team reach the target despite Hassan Khan's efforts.

Earlier in the day, the San Francisco Unicorns found themselves in a bind on what was a slightly slow pitch. Their powerplay was strong, having scored 74 runs, but they also lost three wickets, losing their momentum because of this.

After Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk were sent back to the pavilion courtesy of some brilliant bowling by Zia Ul-Haq, Matt Short continued the ante with a fighting 33. His wicket in the 6th over was a big blow, as the rest of the batting lineup faltered under the disciplined bowling of the Super Kings.

Mohammad Mohsin was the standout performer with the ball for the Super Kings, delivering a stellar spell that yielded figures of 4/13. His consistent line and length, coupled with his ability to extract some purchase from the pitch, made life difficult for the Unicorns' batters.

Brief Scores: Texas Super Kings beat San Francisco Unicorns .
summary:
* The Texas Super Kings won their first match in the 2024 Major League Cricket season, defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville.
* The Unicorns set a target of 127 runs, which the Super Kings chased down comfortably thanks to opening partnership between Faf du Plessis (34 off 17) and Devon Conway (32 off 19).
* Aaron Hardie's 34 off 23 balls ensured the Super Kings reached the target despite Conway's retirement due to injury.
* The Unicorns struggled with their batting, losing momentum after a strong powerplay, with only Matt Short scoring a notable 33.
* Mohammad Mohsin was the star performer for the Super Kings, taking 4 wickets for just 13 runs with a disciplined bowling spell.

title: MLC 2024 Updated Points Table & Most Runs, Wickets List After Los Angeles vs Seattle Match
body:

South Africa batter Ryan Rickelton’s unbeaten 66-ball 103 run knock, along with Quinton de Kock’s half century, ensured that Seattle chased the target set by Los Angeles with nine wickets left and one ball remaining.

The Seattle Orcas won the toss and chose to bowl first. Opener Jason Roy and lower middle-order batter David Miller powered LAKR to the total of 168-5 in 20 overs.

They reached the target in 19.5 overs and helped the team win by nine wickets.

title: Prime Video snags exclusive 2024 MLC season broadcast rights for ANZ
body:
Prime Video and Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) today announced a partnership to grant Prime Video exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season. All 25 matches will be available on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand from 6 July – 29 July local time (5 July – 28 July in the USA) at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership.

The announcement comes off the back of a hugely entertaining ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, which saw co-host USA progress to the Super Eight stage in their tournament debut. The second season of MLC will provide a stage for the best international T20 superstars to compete alongside the USA’s top domestic players from six major cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C. Across the six teams, eight Australian players and five New Zealander players have been confirmed to participate in the tournament. Key signings include:

Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins joins the San Francisco Unicorns alongside bowler Josh Inglis, batter Jake Fraser-McGurk, and New Zealand all-rounder Matt Henry.

Seattle Orcas have nabbed Kiwi batsman Michael Bracewell and bowler Lance Morris.

Washington Freedom have secured Ricky Ponting as coach, as well as Australian batters Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell. New Zealand’s bowlers Rachin Ravindra and Lockie Ferguson are also named in the squad.

MI New York will see batter Tim David and bowler Trent Boult return for a second season.

Australian bowler Adam Zampa will join the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

“At Prime Video, we are always looking for ways to deliver more value to our customers across our movies, TV series and live sports offerings,” said Hushidar Kharas, head of Prime Video Australia and New Zealand. “The feedback from cricket fans in Australia for our first major event, ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, has been really positive and we are delighted to expand our live sports offering through the Cognizant Major League Cricket. We are also excited to offer our customers in New Zealand the first live sports event included in their Prime Video membership.”

“We are thrilled to announce Prime Video as our broadcast partner for Cognizant Major League Cricket in New Zealand and Australia,” said MLC’s CEO, Vijay Srinivasan. “This partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey to grow the season, which is in it’s second year, as well as bring the excitement of cricket to fans across the globe. Prime Video has solidified its position as a premier destination for cricket enthusiasts in Australia and New Zealand, showcasing major events such as the World Cup and acclaimed series such as The Test. MLC eagerly anticipates joining this platform, poised to contribute thrilling cricket action to its global audience through Prime Video’s extensive reach and expertise.”

Prime Video is a premier entertainment destination where millions of viewers around the world can enjoy their favourite content. It has demonstrated its commitment to delivering premier sports viewing to Australian and New Zealand audiences through a series of acclaimed documentaries. These include The Test S1-S3, Making Their Mark, Shane, Warriors on the Field, and Kick Like Tayla. In Australia, Prime members cheered on the Australian team in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, who made it to the Super 8. The T20 World Cup Women’s tournament will commence in October this year.

Since 2019, Prime Video has commissioned 29 Amazon Originals in Australia — The Test S1-S3, LOL: Last One Laughing Australia with Rebel Wilson, a series of 10 stand-up comedy specials, Back to the Rafters, Luxe Listings Sydney S1 – S3, The Moth Effect, Making Their Mark, Warriors on the Field, Kick Like Tayla, award-winning, feature-length documentary Burning, Head Above Water, Class of ’07, Deadloch, The Lost Flowers of Alice Hart, the lifestyle special Hugh van Cuylenburg: G.E.M, a series of five stand-up comedy specials, Hot Potato: The Story of the Wiggles, Neighbours, Five Blind Dates, Dance Life, the upcoming The Office, The Narrow Road to the Deep North and Top End Bub.

Prime members in Australia and Prime Video customers in New Zealand will be able to watch all live MLC matches anywhere and anytime on their Prime Video app for smart TVs, mobile devices, Fire TV, Fire TV stick, Fire tablets, Apple TV, and stream online. In the Prime Video app, Prime Video customers can download matches on their mobile devices and tablets and watch anywhere offline at no additional cost.
summary:
**Partnership and Broadcast Rights**: Prime Video has secured exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season, with all 25 matches available on Prime Video at no extra cost to Prime or Prime Video membership.

**Tournament Details**: The second season of MLC will begin on July 6th in Australia and New Zealand (July 5th in the USA) and will feature six teams from six major cities in the USA: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.

**Player Signings**: Notable players participating in the tournament include:

* Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins (San Francisco Unicorns)
* Australian players Jake Fraser-McGurk, Josh Inglis, Steve Smith, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, and Adam Zampa
* New Zealand players Matt Henry, Michael Bracewell, Lance Morris, Rachin Ravindra, Lockie Ferguson, and Trent Boult
* Ricky Ponting will coach the Washington Freedom team

**Availability**: Prime members in Australia and Prime Video customers in New Zealand can watch all live MLC matches on the Prime Video app on various devices, including smart TVs, mobile devices, and tablets, with the option to download matches for offline viewing at no additional cost.

title: MLC 2024: Mohammad Mohsin Stars in Texas Super Kings' Win Over San Francisco Unicorns
body:
oi-Aditya K Halder

In a standout performance at Church Street Park, the Texas Super Kings clinched their first victory of the Major League Cricket 2024 -- MLC 2024 -- season with a decisive seven-wicket win against the San Francisco Unicorns at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Thursday.

This all-round display not only marked their first win but also propelled them to the top of the points table, leapfrogging from the bottom with three points from three games.

The match began with Texas Super Kings winning the toss and opting to bowl. Their decision proved fruitful as they managed to restrict the Unicorns to a modest 127 in 17.5 overs. The standout performer with the ball was Mohammad Mohsin, who claimed four wickets for just 13 runs in 3.5 overs, effectively dismantling the Unicorns' batting lineup.

Dwayne Bravo provided crucial support, taking 2 for 20, and ensuring the Unicorns' middle and lower order never settled. Matthew Short was the only bright spot for the Unicorns, scoring a quickfire 33 off 15 balls.

In response, the Super Kings' chase was clinical. Openers Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway set a blistering pace with a 61-run partnership in just 4.5 overs. Du Plessis, who scored 34 off 17 balls, and Conway, with 32 off 19, laid the foundation for a swift chase.

Aaron Hardie further stabilized the innings, contributing 34 off 23 balls, guiding the Super Kings to their target in just 12.5 overs with seven wickets in hand.

This victory not only lifted the Super Kings from the bottom of the standings but also showcased their potential to dominate the league. With this win, they now lead the points table, while the Unicorns, with two points from two games, find themselves in fifth place in the six-team competition. The win has certainly set the tone for what promises to be an exciting season ahead in the Major League Cricket 2024.
summary:
* The Texas Super Kings won their first match of the MLC 2024 season, defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville.
* The Super Kings bowled first and restricted the Unicorns to 127 in 17.5 overs, thanks to Mohammad Mohsin's 4/13 and Dwayne Bravo's 2/20.
* The Super Kings chased the target clinically, with openers Faf du Plessis (34 off 17) and Devon Conway (32 off 19) setting the tone, and Aaron Hardie (34 off 23) guiding them to the target in 12.5 overs.
* With this win, the Super Kings jumped to the top of the points table with 3 points from 3 games, while the Unicorns slipped to 5th place with 2 points from 2 games.

title: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs Seattle Orcas Highlights: Rickelton, de Kock star as Seattle Orcas thrash LA Knight Riders by 9 wickets
body:
Right then, that is it from this exciting encounter between the Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas. However, the action doesn’t stop here and we will be back with more games from Major League Cricket 2024. The next game will be played between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Texas Super Kings at Morrisville on 11th July, Thursday. The first ball will be bowled at 12.30 am IST (7.00 pm GMT the previous day) but our coverage will start much earlier. Until then, goodbye and cheers!

Ryan Rickelton is the Player of the Match for his scintillating knock of 103 runs in 66 deliveries. He says that he is just happy to be out there and contribute to the team. Adds that he was panicking when he got close to the ton and Quinton de Kock wasn't helping as well. Says that it is always fun to play with him and he is a phenomenal player. Mentions that the wicket was a bit sticky early on but it got better and that is why they chased. Further adds that it was a shocking run with which he completed the hundred, and they decided before that whatever happens, they would run and luckily Narine missed.

Heinrich Klaasen, the captain of Seattle Orcas says that they executed the plan perfectly and credits Quinton de Kock and Ryan Rickelton for their partnership. Mentions that they had to work on their mistakes in the previous game. Says that they have a quality group of local players and the experience of overseas players which makes his task a bit easier. Mentions that he was a bit nervous in the last over but he had faith in his batters.

Sunil Narine, the skipper of Los Angeles Knight Riders says that they had a decent start but they couldn't take wickets at regular intervals. Feels that they played a good game and mentions that another 15-20 runs on the board would help them. Says that the conditions are better for the team batting second and that has been the norm on this side of the world. Ends by saying they will adapt and bounce back strongly.

Earlier in the innings, we saw that after a good start by the Los Angeles Knight Riders in the initial phases, they fell behind the eight-ball in the middle overs. A few good overs by the Orcas put them under pressure and that resulted in a few wickets as well. However, the show that David Miller put up in the last few overs helped the Knight Riders end their innings at 168 runs.

Wayne Parnell from the Seattle Orcas is up for a chat. He says that they bounced back very well after losing the first game. Adds that they bowled nicely and there were some good pieces of fielding as well, and then the brilliant partnership between Quinton de Kock and Ryan Rickelton. Says that he has been unwell but is recovering well. Mentions that the communication between the two batters was important. Ends by saying that the bucket hat is a part of trying to grow cricket in the US.

Spencer Johnson gave a strong start to the Los Angeles Knight Riders as he sent back Nauman Anwar early on in the innings. After that, things went downhill for them as they failed to get any breakthrough and allowed a big partnership to be formed. They managed to keep things quiet for a while but after 10 overs they had to face the onslaught of the batters. They made some errors in the field as well which might be discussed in the team meetings later on. They took the game till the last over but Ali Khan didn’t have much left to defend. They fought hard but fell short of the win.

Seattle Orcas had a shaky start with the early dismissal of Nauman Anwar. However, a strong partnership between the South African pair of Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock released the pressure. Ryan Rickelton took the aggressive approach initially while de Kock took his time to get used to the conditions and then unleashed his array of shots. They dominated after the halfway mark of the innings and attacked every bowler. The constant rotation of strike too kept the pressure on the opponents and allowed them to bat freely. Ryan Rickelton got to his maiden T20 century while Quinton de Kock scored a half-century to finish things in their favor.

It was another last-over finish in the Major League Cricket but the Seattle Orcas have taken home those two points. Thanks to the 152-run stand between Quinton de Kock and Ryan Rickelton, they have managed to do it in style and earned themselves their first win of the season.

0

Overs19.3

Score167 - 1

Ali Khan to Quinton de Kock, Overpitched and on off, Quinton de Kock drives it a bit too well as the ball zips to mid off, Ryan Rickelton wants the run but is sent back. 2 runs needed in 3 balls now!

6

Overs18.3

Score164 - 1

Andre Russell to Quinton de Kock, SIX! FIFTY FOR QDK! He says it's his turn now! Fuller and on middle, in the slot, Quinton de Kock clears his front leg away and tonks it over the bowler's head for a biggie.

1

Overs18.2

Score158 - 1

Andre Russell to Ryan Rickelton, HUNDRED FOR RICKELTON! What a feat for the young South African! A maiden T20 ton and he has waited for this for a long time after getting out in the 90s on a few occasions. This is full and around off, Ryan Rickelton drives it straight to extra covers and sets off for the run, Sunil Narine picks up and has a shy at the bowler's end but misses with Rickelton putting in a dive.

1

Overs17.6

Score155 - 1

Spencer Johnson to Quinton de Kock, Short of a length and around middle, Quinton de Kock goes for the pull but does not get the power as the ball goes wide of deep square leg for one more. Seattle Orcas need 14 runs to win in the last two overs!

0

Overs16.6

Score147 - 1

Sunil Narine to Quinton de Kock, Flatter, short and on leg, Quinton de Kock backs away to cut but gets a bottom edge onto the ground as the ball bounces over the keeper and goes nowhere. Just one run off the over!

Strategic Break! The Seattle Orcas are inches away from a victory courtesy of this partnership between Quinton de Kock and Ryan Rickelton. Both these batters have shown intent and batted sensibly keeping the pressure on the opponents. Los Angeles Knight Riders, on the other hand, will need a few quick wickets to get back in the game. Their morale seems to have dropped as seen by their fielding in the last couple of overs. With less than run a ball required to win, Seattle Orcas should look to keep the aggressive approach and improve their NRR.

Corne Dry to Ryan Rickelton, FOUR! Oh..no! Another midfield and it costs LAKR again! This is slower, on a length and around off, Ryan Rickelton punches it with good timing wide of deep point, Shakib Al Hasan runs to his left and dives but the ball just bounces before him and he only manages to parry it to the fence for another boundary.

Ali Khan to Quinton de Kock, Ali Khan serves it short and outside off. Quinton de Kock reads the slower one and he slaps it to long off for a single. A good over for the Seattle Orcas.

**Match Result:** Seattle Orcas won against Los Angeles Knight Riders.

**Player of the Match:** Ryan Rickelton for his scintillating knock of 103 runs in 66 deliveries.

**Key Performances:**

* Ryan Rickelton: 103 runs in 66 deliveries, maiden T20 century
* Quinton de Kock: 50+ runs, partnered with Ryan Rickelton for a 152-run stand

**Post-Match Quotes:**

title: SF vs TEX Dream11 Prediction Today Match 7 MLC 2024
body:
Dream11 fantasy cricket tips and guide for 7th match of MLC 2024 to be played between SF vs TEX in Morrisville.

Match No. 7 of the second edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 will be played on July 10 (Wednesday). This match will be played between San Francisco Unicorns and Texas Super Kings at the Church Street Park in Morrisville.

The Unicorns started the ongoing tournament with a win and currently have two points. This will be the second match for them this season, and two points here can help them to get to the top of the table. On the other hand, the Super Kings are still searching for their first win after two matches. Another defeat can push them behind in the race.

SF vs TEX: Match Details

Match: San Francisco Unicorns (SF) vs Texas Super Kings (TEX), Match 7, MLC 2024

Match Date: July 10, 2024 (Wednesday)

Time: 12:30 A.M. IST (Thursday) / 07:00 PM GMT / 03:00 PM LOCAL

Venue: Church Street Park, Morrisville

SF vs TEX: Head-to-Head: SF (0) – TEX (1)

title: Fiery Coetzee in doubt for West Indies tour
body:
The Proteas are sweating over the fitness of the young fast bowler, Gerald Coetzee, ahead of their tour to the West Indies.

On Monday the 23-year-old from Bloemfontein was named in the Proteas squad for the two Tests in Trinidad & Tobago, and Guyana.

However, he has been released by the Major League Cricket side, the Texas Super Kings, due to an injury.

On Friday, Coetzee sustained a low-grade left abdominal strain and this has put his tour to the West Indies in doubt.

Cricket South Africa confirmed that Coetzee will be returning to South Africa for further medical attention and they will monitor his progress.

“Proteas fast bowler Gerald Coetzee has been released by Texas Super Kings after sustaining a low-grade left strain in the team's fixture against LA Knight Riders on 5 July in the Major League Cricket.”

“The 23-year-old will undergo further medical assessments by Cricket South Africa’s medical team upon his return home.

“An update will be provided in due course.”

Coetzee has less than a month to recover and prove his fitness in order to be ready for the tour to the Windies.

While Coetzee was named in the Test squad, he was also expected to be named in the squad for the three-match T20 International series.

Coetzee was a part of the Proteas team that recently reached the final of the ICC T20 World Cup in the USA and West Indies, however, he did not play in a single game during the campaign.
summary:
* Gerald Coetzee, a 23-year-old fast bowler, was playing for the Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket.
* On July 5, Coetzee sustained a low-grade left abdominal strain during a match against the LA Knight Riders.
* As a result, he was released by the Texas Super Kings due to the injury.
* Coetzee will return to South Africa for further medical attention and assessment by Cricket South Africa's medical team.

title: Mohsin Mohammed, Devon Conway Propel Texas Super Kings to First Win in MLC 2024
body:
Mumbai, July 11: The Texas Super Kings secured their first win in the 2024 Major League Cricket season, beating San Franciso Unicorns by seven wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Thursday. With a handy total of only 127 needed for a win, openers Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway got off the blocks quickly, setting the tone for the innings. Faf was not as aggressive as he was on the way to his century in the previous game against Washington Freedom but played second fiddle to his New Zealand partner's power-hitting. MLC 2024: Faf du Plessis’ Century in Vain As Texas Super Kings vs Washington Freedom Match Washed Out.

Eventually scoring 34 off 17, du Plessis gave away a simple catch, but by then more than half of the total was chased down. Conway took a blow to his fingers and was forced to retire hurt after scoring 32 off 19, but Aaron Hardie took the game on his shoulders thereafter. His 34 off 23 balls effectively helped his team reach the target despite Hassan Khan's efforts.

Earlier in the day, the San Francisco Unicorns found themselves in a bind on what was a slightly slow pitch. Their powerplay was strong, having scored 74 runs, but they also lost three wickets, losing their momentum because of this.

After Finn Allen (10) and Jake Fraser-McGurk (11) were sent back to the pavilion courtesy of some brilliant bowling by Zia Ul-Haq, Matt Short continued the ante with a fighting 33. His wicket in the 6th over was a big blow, as the rest of the batting lineup faltered under the disciplined bowling of the Super Kings. MLC 2024: Finn Allen, Matthew Short Star As San Francisco Unicorns Down LA Knight Riders by Six Wickets.

Mohammad Mohsin was the standout performer with the ball for the Super Kings, delivering a stellar spell that yielded figures of 4/13. His consistent line and length, coupled with his ability to extract some purchase from the pitch, made life difficult for the Unicorns' batters.

Brief Scores: Texas Super Kings (Devon Conway 32, Aaron Hardie 34, Hassan Khan 2/16) beat San Francisco Unicorns (Matthew Short 33, Mohammad Mohsin 4/13).
summary: The Texas Super Kings won their first match of the 2024 MLC season, defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville. The Unicorns set a target of 127, but the Super Kings' openers, Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway, made quick work of the chase. Conway scored 32 off 19 before retiring hurt, while du Plessis scored 34 off 17. Aaron Hardie took over, scoring 34 off 23 to seal the win. The Unicorns' top scorer was Matt Short with 33, but they struggled against the Super Kings' bowling, particularly Mohammad Mohsin who took 4/13.

title: Gambhir wants Ryan ten Doeschate to be part of India's new coaching staff: Report
body:
India’s new head coach Gautam Gambhir wants Ryan ten Doeschate to be part of the team's backroom staff, Cricbuzz reported on July 11 (Thursday). The former Netherlands all-rounder recently worked with Gambhir at the Kolkata Knight Riders, serving as the team's fielding coach in the championship-winning campaign.

Ten Doeschate is also part of the supporting staff of KKR's subsidiaries in the Caribbean Premier League, Major League Cricket and ILT20. Gambhir has already advocated for Abhishek Nayar and the former India all-rounder is almost certain to join the Indian team as an assistant coach, a role similar to the one he wants ten Doeschate for.

In a video shot at a KKR function during the IPL 2024, Gambhir said: "When I talk about selflessness, I have never said this in 42 years of my career. And I wanted to say this. The greatest team man I ever played with, the most selfless human being, someone I can take a bullet for, someone who I can trust for life.

"I can tell you this because in 2011, my first game as a KKR captain, we only had four overseas (players) available. And this man had a fabulous 50-over World Cup. And we went in that game with only three overseas players. He was carrying drinks in that game with no disappointment on his face. He taught me selflessness. Ryan ten Doeschate (sic)."

It’s not a secret that the BCCI prefer Indian coaches, so it will be interesting to see how they react to this demand of Gambhir who has requested a free hand in managing the team. The BCCI might not prefer having two assistant coaches for a national team. They could give Nayar the batting coach role and make ten Doeschate the assistant coach.

T Dilip, who served as the fielding coach under outgoing head coach Rahul Dravid, is likely to be retained. As far as the bowling coach is concerned, the names of Lakshmipathy Balaji and Vinay Kumar have been doing the rounds, but it is believed that the BCCI is seeking a higher-profile candidate who would mentor and mould the upcoming crop of fast bowlers.

Gambhir and his support staff will take charge of the side from the Sri Lanka tour, consisting of three T20 Internationals (T20I) and as many One-Day Internationals (ODI), starting July 27.
summary:
* Ryan ten Doeschate, a former Netherlands all-rounder, is part of the supporting staff of KKR's subsidiaries in the Caribbean Premier League, Major League Cricket, and ILT20.

Note: There is no other information about the Major League Cricket tournament in the article beyond this mention of Ryan ten Doeschate's involvement. The rest of the article focuses on his potential role in the Indian cricket team's backroom staff and Gautam Gambhir's comments about him.

title: [Watch] CSK’s Mitchell Santner Launches A 106 M Six Against PAK Spinner In MLC 2024
body:
Mitchell Santner's 106 M six in MLC 2024 (X.com)

Mitchell Santner smashed one of the longest sixes of his career, if not the longest, on Thursday while representing Texas Super Kings in Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 against San Francisco Unicorns at Church Street Park.

The Kiwi all-rounder, who also plays for Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in IPL, launched a 106-metre biggie, against Pakistani spinner named Hassan Khan.

Santner Dispatches Hassan Khan For A Massive 106 M Six

While chasing a below-par 128, Santner came to bat at No. 6 after Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis set the platform. Just before finishing things off, Santner brought out something special during the 12th over of the innings.

Hassan, the left-arm spinner, bowled a flighted delivery outside the off stump, and the Kiwi picked it up perfectly before smashing it out of the ground.
summary: In the MLC 2024 tournament, Mitchell Santner of the Texas Super Kings hit a massive 106-meter six against San Francisco Unicorns at Church Street Park. Santner, a Kiwi all-rounder, achieved this feat in the 12th over of the innings while chasing a target of 128. The six was hit off Pakistani spinner Hassan Khan's delivery. Santner's team was in a strong position to win, thanks to a good start provided by Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis.

The Match 7 of the Major League Cricket 2024 will see the clash between San Francisco Unicorns and Texas Super Kings at the Church Street Park, Morrisville on Thursday, 11 July 2024. Keep reading to find out the SFU vs TSK Match Prediction Match 7 Major League Cricket 2024.

Match Preview

In the fourth match of the Major League Cricket series, the San Francisco Unicorns secured a victory over the Los Angeles Knight Riders. LAKR set a challenging target of 165/6 in their 20 overs. The Unicorns showcased their batting prowess by successfully chasing it down, finishing at 166/4 in just 15.2 overs. This six-wicket win highlighted their strategic gameplay and solid performance.

Finn Allen was instrumental in the Unicorns’ chase, scoring a brisk 63 off 37 balls. Matthew Short also made a significant contribution with a rapid 58 from 26 deliveries. The wicketkeeper, Josh Inglis, added 15 runs from 11 balls to the total. On the bowling front, Brody Couch was impressive with figures of 2/24 in 4 overs, while Haris Rauf took 2/38 in his 4 overs. Liam Plunkett also chipped in with 1/29 in his 4 overs, rounding off a strong team effort.

In the fifth match of the Major League Cricket series, Washington Freedom got off to a strong start, reaching 62/0 in just 4 overs. However, the match was abandoned before it could conclude. Earlier, the Texas Super Kings had set a formidable target by scoring 203/5 in their allotted 20 overs. The Texas Super Kings’ total was largely built on a brilliant innings from their captain, Faf du Plessis, who scored an impressive 100 off 58 balls. title: LAS vs SEA, MLC 2024: Match Prediction, Dream11 Team, Fantasy Tips & Pitch Report | Los Angeles Knight Riders vs Seattle Orcas
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders, seeking redemption after a 6-wicket defeat to San Francisco Unicorns, lock horns with the Seattle Orcas in a crucial Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 encounter. The Orcas themselves are coming off a similar 6-wicket loss to MI New York.

Both teams will be eager to bounce back and secure a win at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. This promises to be a battle between two sides desperate to get their campaigns back on track.

MLC 2024, Match 6: SF vs LAS:

Date and Time: July 9, 07:30 pm Local/ July 10, 12:30 am GMT/ 06:00 am IST

Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

Grand Prairie Stadium Pitch Report:

The wicket at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas fosters a thrilling contest between bat and ball. Pace bowlers get a taste of swing with the new ball, keeping the initial overs exciting. Spinners then come into their own, finding purchase and extracting turn as the innings progress. However, this doesn’t mean batters are left out. The pitch rewards well-timed shots, allowing batsmen to score freely.

Wicketkeepers: Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen

title: Texas Super Kings Clinch Maiden 2024 Victory Against San Francisco Unicorns
body:
The Texas Super Kings secured their first victory in the 2024 Major League Cricket season, triumphing over the San Francisco Unicorns by seven wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Thursday. Chasing an achievable total of 127, openers Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway set the tone early. While du Plessis played a supporting role with 34 off 17 balls, Conway led with a rapid 32 off 19 before retiring hurt.

Aaron Hardie stepped up after Conway's injury, scoring 34 off 23 balls to guide the Super Kings to their target, despite a valiant effort from Unicorns' bowler Hassan Khan. Earlier, the Unicorns started strong with 74 runs in the powerplay but lost momentum due to consistent wickets, ending their innings at a modest total. Key contributions included Matt Short's 33, while Zia Ul-Haq significantly impacted with early wickets.

The standout performer was Mohammad Mohsin, whose bowling figures of 4/13 were pivotal. His disciplined bowling and ability to extract movement off the pitch made scoring challenging for the Unicorns.

(Disclaimer: With inputs from agencies.)
summary: In the 2024 Major League Cricket season, the Texas Super Kings secured their first victory by defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville. The Super Kings chased down a target of 127, thanks to contributions from Faf du Plessis (34 off 17), Devon Conway (32 off 19), and Aaron Hardie (34 off 23). The Unicorns were restricted to 127 due to consistent wickets, with Matt Short scoring 33. Mohammad Mohsin was the standout performer, taking 4 wickets for 13 runs and playing a crucial role in the Super Kings' victory.

title: India head coach Gautam Gambhir wants Ryan ten Doeschate as part of team’s coaching staff: Report
body:
India’s newly-appointed head coach Gautam Gambhir is reportedly pushing for the inclusion of former Netherlands international Ryan ten Doeschate into the team's coaching staff.

Ten Doeschate recently worked with Gambhir at the Kolkata Knight Riders, where he played the role of a fielding coach during their triumphant IPL 2024 campaign.

Moreover, Ten Doeschate holds multiple positions within KKR’s subsidiaries in the Caribbean Premier League, Major League Cricket, and ILT20.

According to a report published in Cricbuzz, Gambhir, who has requested a free hand in managing the team, wants the former Dutch cricketer as one of his key associates.

However, the final call will be made by the BCCI, which has favoured hiring only Indian personnel for coaching roles in recent years.

The report also claims that the board is already discussing Ryan ten Doeschate's name but it wants T Dilip to continue in his role as the fielding coach. In that case, the Dutchman might be considered for a different role.

Earlier, multiple reports suggested that Gautam Gambhir wants to bring along Abhishek Nayar as his assistant coach for the Indian team.

Nayar, who has represented India in three ODIs, currently serves as assistant coach at the Kolkata Knight Riders. He also holds the position of director at the KKR academy

If the BCCI secures the services of both Abhishek Nayar and Ryan ten Doeschate, it will leave a major void in KKR's coaching setup.

Gambhir, who replaced Rahul Dravid as India's head coach, will begin his stint with the white-ball tour of Sri Lanka later this month.
