title: The Cognizant Major League Cricket season is here, but what exactly is Major League Cricket? We’ve got the scoop!
body:
Dallas-Fort Worth continues to expand its sports landscape and the state of Texas took a front row seat with the launch of Cognizant Major League Cricket in the United States in 2023.

Texas Super Kings, the Major League Cricket franchise based in Texas, is headlined by veteran South African and Top Order Batter Faf du Plessis, who returns for his second season. He will be joined by wicket-keeper Devon Conway, Australian power-hitter Marcus Stoinis, fast-bowler Naveen Ul Haq, and Team USA’s Milind Kumar.

What is Major League Cricket?

Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States, which began in 2023. Exclusively sanctioned by USA Cricket, MLC showcases superstar players from around the globe, bringing world-class T20 cricket to America.

As the 2024 season is underway, here’s some quick facts on MLC and what you can expect from T20 Cricket:

Where are the matches played?

Matches will take place at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina. The full schedule and available tickets can be viewed here.

Who are the teams?

There’s six teams currently in the MLC, representing different cities and regions within the United States - The Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom.

Who won last year?

MI New York claimed victory in the inaugural 2023 MLC season, defeating the Seattle Orcas.

What is T20 Cricket?

T20, or Twenty20 is one format of cricket.

It is a shortened format (around 3 hours) where each team has 20 overs (this includes 120 balls) to score the most runs.

It’s known for its explosive batting as the time constraints means more incentive to hit big “sixes” and take risks. (Sixes are similar to homeruns for all the baseball fans out there).

An 'over' is the name given to six consecutive balls bowled by one ‘bowler’. There are 20 of these overs in an ‘inning’.There are two innings in a game.

What are the rules?

Each team has 11 batsmen that will attempt to score more runs (points) than their opponent.

The fielding side will be trying to get all the batsmen out as soon as possible to keep the runs total low.

A team earns one run when a batsman hits the ball and runs from one set of stumps to the other.

Teams earn four runs for hitting the ball out of bounds and six runs for hitting the ball out of bounds without it hitting the ground.

The bowler is the player who throws the ball at the stumps to try to knock the ‘bails’ off. (The bowlers are the equivalent of a pitcher in baseball).

Wickets/stumps are the three vertical sticks with two smaller ones called bails laid horizontally on top. The goal is to knock the bails off.

A player on the fielding team stands behind the stumps to catch the ball.

The white lines on the ground is the crease, this is where the wickets and batsman should be.

What has MLC done for Cricket in the USA?

MLC has revolutionized the cricket landscape in the USA. Cognizant Major League Cricket was recently awarded List-A status, recognized by the ICC as an official T20 league, making it America’s first world-class domestic tournament. The inaugural 2023 season was a huge success, with sold-out matches garnering millions of viewers worldwide. The recent T20 World Cup was played across the USA and West Indies and saw team USA both co-host and participate in the tournament for the first time. Forty-seven of the players who took part in the World Cup will remain in the USA for MLC.

MLC FAMILY DAYS - SUNDAY SPECIAL

Make your next family outing one to remember. Enjoy a world-class cricket match and save big with an MLC family value offer!

Watch the world's best cricketers this summer and take advantage of the new family special offer for Sundays only. Receive 30% off when purchasing four or more tickets by selecting the ‘Family’ option at checkout. Available for all Sunday games (excluding Championship match), valid on all GA tickets, and up to 12 tickets per transaction.
summary:
**Tournament Overview**

* Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States, launched in 2023.
* MLC is exclusively sanctioned by USA Cricket and features superstar players from around the world.

**2024 Season**

* The 2024 season is underway, with matches being played at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina.
* There are six teams participating in the tournament, representing different cities and regions in the United States.

**Teams and Last Year's Winner**

* The six teams are: Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom.
* MI New York won the inaugural 2023 MLC season, defeating the Seattle Orcas.

**T20 Cricket Format**

* T20 is a shortened format of cricket, lasting around 3 hours.
* Each team has 20 overs to score the most runs, with an emphasis on explosive batting and taking risks.

**Gameplay and Rules**

* Each team has 11 batsmen who attempt to score more runs than their opponent.
* The fielding side tries to get all the batsmen out as soon as possible to keep the runs total low.
* Runs can be scored by hitting the ball and running between stumps, or by hitting the ball out of bounds.

**Impact of MLC**

* MLC has revolutionized the cricket landscape in the USA, with the tournament being awarded List-A status by the ICC.
* The inaugural 2023 season was a huge success, with sold-out matches and millions of viewers worldwide.

title: Bally Sports and Willow by Cricbuzz Partner to Broadcast LA Knight Riders and Texas Super Kings MLC Matches
body:
Story Highlights

Willow by Cricbuz announces an all new streaming and linear distribution partnership with the Bally Sports Regional Sports Networks. Under this agreement, Bally Sports West/SoCal and Bally Sports Southwest will deliver regional Major League Cricket matches featuring the LA Knight Riders and Texas Super Kings to their hometown fans.

From July 5, 2024, Southern California and Texas fans will be treated to exclusive live broadcasts of the LA Knight Riders and Texas Super Kings via Bally Sports West/SoCal, Bally Sports Southwest and the Bally Sports app. This partnership ensures that every exhilarating play and major moment is delivered directly to the regional supporters of these teams, enhancing the local fan experience and deepening their connection to the rapidly expanding world of Major League Cricket.

“Our partnership with Bally Sports arrives at a pivotal time when cricket is capturing the hearts of Americans, fueled by the T20 World Cup’s dramatic impact,” says Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz. “Now, fans in Texas and Southern California can rally behind their teams, celebrating the international stars they admired during the World Cup right in their backyard. With this effort, we’re not just expanding cricket’s footprint; we’re weaving it into the fabric of local communities, offering fans a personal stake in the global excitement of cricket.”

Willow by Cricbuzz will distribute all MLC matches this season on TV and its dedicated streaming app.

title: Andre Russell breaks Travis Head's bat during Major League Cricket match, video goes viral - WATCH
body:
Travis Head was left stunned after a delivery from Andre Russell broke his bat during the match between Washington Freedom and Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket on Monday.

New Delhi: Andre Russell left Travis Head surprised when his delivery broke the Australian batter’s bat into two pieces in the match between Washington Freedom and Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket (MLC) on Monday. Russell’s ball hit Head’s bat hard leading to its handle getting disintegrated from the rest of the body.

The incident happened in the second over of Washington Freedom’s run-chase against the LA Knight Riders at Church Street Park in Morrisville. Head tried to pull a shortish delivery from Russell but ended up losing control as his bat was broken into two pieces. The video of the incident caught the attention of fans on social media.

Watch Andre Rusell breaks Travis Head’s bat into two pieces:

A number of big names are currently in action for their respective teams in the ongoing Major League Cricket. Steve Smith-led Washington Freedom defeated the Los Angeles Knight Riders by 8 wickets on Monday to continue their unbeaten run in MLC 2024. Washington Freedom rode on Head’s fifty to chase down the target of 130 runs with 4 overs to spare.

Head stars in Washington Freedom’s thumping win

Head starred in Washington Freedm’s victory against the LA Knight Riders with a cracking knock of 54 runs off 32 balls laced with 6 sixes and 2 fours. The left-hander got his team off to a flyer with his opening partner Smith in the run-chase as the duo added 79 runs for the first wicket.

Their partnership set the tone for a comprehensive win for Freedom, who were able to nail down the target with 24 balls to spare. Despite his bat getting broken into two, the incident didn’t affect Head’s rhythm as he finished as the top run-getter for his side with his 52-run knock.

Earlier, LA Knight Riders were skittled out for 129 runs in just 18.4 overs after brilliant spells from Saurabh Netravalkar and Glenn Maxwell. Left-arm pacer Netravalkar picked up a four-wicket haul and finished with excellent figures of 4/35 while Maxwell finished with 3/15 off his 4 overs.
summary:
* The article reports on a match between Washington Freedom and Los Angeles Knight Riders in the MLC 2024, where Steve Smith-led Washington Freedom won by 8 wickets.
* Travis Head's bat was broken into two pieces by a delivery from Andre Russell during the match, but it didn't affect his performance as he scored 54 runs off 32 balls with 6 sixes and 2 fours.
* Washington Freedom chased down the target of 130 runs with 4 overs to spare, thanks to Head's fifty and a strong opening partnership with Steve Smith.
* Saurabh Netravalkar and Glenn Maxwell were instrumental in restricting LA Knight Riders to 129 runs in 18.4 overs, with Netravalkar taking 4/35 and Maxwell taking 3/15.

Overall, the article highlights Washington Freedom's dominant performance in the MLC 2024, with Travis Head's impressive batting and the team's strong bowling efforts.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 - Match 13, SO vs SFU - Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions: July 15
body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 13- Seattle Orcas vs San Francisco Unicorns, which will be played on the 13th of July at the Church Street Park, Morrisville.

Points Table

LIVE SCORES - Match 13 - Seattle Orcas vs San Francisco Unicorns (Church Street Park, Morrisville)

Current Form Seattle Orcas:

Seattle Orcas are currently placed at the bottom most position on points table with 1 win to their credit.

The top run scorer for Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket is Ryan Rickelton with 107 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket is Cameron Green with 4 scalps under his belt.

Seattle Orcas have lost their previous match against Washington Freedom by 5 wickets.

Seattle Orcas batted first and they posted a total of 124 before being bowled out. Ryan Rickelton and Nauman Anwar got out cheaply. Quinton de Kock showed some promise and early signs of form but couldn't prolong his innings. Heinrich Klaasen played well, scored 51 off 30 balls and helped his team get to 124 on a very tough pitch to bat on. For Washington Freedom, Saurabh Netravalkar picked up 3 wickets while Lockie Ferguson accounted for 4 wickets.

During the chase, Washington Freedom got off to a shaky start, losing both their openers cheaply. Rachin Ravindra played well and utilized the powerplay overs by scoring 26 runs in 16 balls. A couple of wickets fell in quick succession in the middle overs but Obus Pienaar kept his cool, scored 31 runs and won the match for Washington Freedom with 5 wickets in hand.

Current Form San Francisco Unicorns:

San Francisco Unicorns are currently placed at the 4th position on points table with 1 win to their credit.

The top run scorer for San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket is Matthew Short with 91 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket is Haris Rauf with 2 scalps under his belt.

San Francisco Unicorns have lost their previous match against Texas Super Kings by 7 wickets.

San Francisco Unicorns batted first and they posted a total of 127 before being bowled out. Finn Allen got them off to a flier but his innings was very short lived as he got out after scoring 10 off 4 balls. Matthew Short also showed a lot of promise in his knock of 33 runs in 15 balls. He also threw his wicket away when his team needed him to stay until the end. After his dismissal, San Francisco Unicorns simply surrendered to the phenomenal bowling performance by Texas Super Kings and they were bowled out for a small total of 127. For Texas Super Kings Mohammad Mohsin picked up 4 wickets.

During the chase, Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway led the chase with good conviction. They scored 32 and 34 runs respectively to almost seal the deal in favor of Texas Super Kings. Mitchell Santner hit the winning runs as Texas Super Kings emerged victorious by 7 wickets.

Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 14- MI New York vs Washington Freedom, which will be played on the 16th of July at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.

Points Table

LIVE SCORES - Match 14 - MI New York vs Washington Freedom (Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas)

Current Form MI New York:

MI New York are currently placed at the 4th position on points table with 1 win and 2 losses to their credit.

The top run scorer for MI New York in the Major League Cricket is Nicholas Pooran with 107 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for MI New York in the Major League Cricket is Trent Boult with 5 scalps under his belt.

MI New York have lost their previous match against Texas Super Kings by 15 runs.

Texas Super Kings batted first and they posted a total of 176 for 6 in 20 overs. Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis were simply superb at the top of the order. The scored 40 and 61 runs respectively. The middle order failed to capitalise on the start they got and Texas Super Kings had to settle for an average total of 176 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, MI New York lost 4 wickets for just 39 runs and looked in deep waters. Nicholas Pooran also perished within the powerplay overs to the bowling of Zia-ul-Haq. Monank Patel and Rashid Khan then led the fightback as they scored 61 and 50 runs respectively but the required rate was impossible to achieve. MI New York were eventually restricted to 161 for 7, as they lost the match by 15 runs.

Current Form Washington Freedom:

Washington Freedom are currently placed at the 1st position on points table with 3 wins to their credit.

The top run scorer for Washington Freedom in the Major League Cricket is Steven Smith with 126 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for Washington Freedom in the Major League Cricket is Saurabh Netravalkar with 12 scalps under his belt.

Washington Freedom have won their previous match against LA Knight Riders by 8 wickets.

LA Knight Riders batted first and they posted a total of 129 before being bowled out. The top order struggled a lot and they were 4 wickets down for 18 runs. All of their big players including Jason Roy, Shakib Al Hasan and Sunil Narine failed terribly with the bat. Saif Badar led a fightback by scoring 35 runs in 28 balls but he also got out at a wrong time as LA Knight Riders were then bowled out for a paltry 129.

During the chase, Travis Head and Steven Smith started off very well. They stitched a partnership of 79 runs for the first wicket to kill the game. Travis Head scored 54 runs, while Steven Smith stayed not out at 42 and steered his team home in the 16th over with 8 wickets in hand.

Let’s have a look at the squads:

MI New York - Nicholas Pooran, Shayan Jahangir, Nosthusha Kenjige, Dewald Brevis, Rushil Ugarkar, Ruben Clinton, Anrich Nortje, Monank Patel, Steven Taylor, Romario Shepherd, Trent Boult, Ehsan Adil, Tim David, Heath Richards, Kagiso Rabada, Rashid Khan, Kieron Pollard

Washington Freedom- Rachin Ravindra, Ian Holland, Akeal Hosein, Lockie Ferguson, Justin Dill, Jack Edwards, Lahiru Milantha, Andries Gous, Amila Aponso, Steve Smith, Saurabh Netravalkar, Yasir Mohammed, Obus Pienaar, Glenn Maxwell, Akhilesh Bodugum, Marco Jansen, Mukhtar Ahmed, Andrew Tye, Travis Head

Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions* - PrePlay

Who will win the toss? – Washington Freedom

Who will win?- Washington Freedom

Top Batter (Runs Scored) - Andries Gous (Washington Freedom), Steven Taylor (MI New York)

Top Bowler (Wickets taken) - Saurabh Netravalkar (Washington Freedom), Rashid Khan (MI New York)

Most Sixes – Andries Gous (Washington Freedom), Steven Taylor (MI New York)

Player of the Match- Saurabh Netravalkar (Washington Freedom)

Team Scores Batting first – Washington Freedom 150+, MI New York 140+

Match Handicap: Washington Freedom

Live Cricket Streaming Major League Cricket 2024: The live cricket streaming page which enables you to watch live cricket - Geo-restrictions apply

*NB these predictions may be changed nearer the start of the match once the final starting teams have been announced and we will be running ‘In-Play’ features, so stay tuned.

© Cricket World 2024

**Top Performers:**

* For MI New York, Nicholas Pooran is the top run scorer with 107 runs, and Trent Boult is the top wicket taker with 5 scalps.

title: Fans Want to See Saurabh Netravalkar Play in IPL As India-Born USA Pacer Continues Good Form in MLC 2024 With Dazzling Four-Wicket Haul in LA Knight Riders vs Washington Freedom Match
body:

title: [Watch] Haris Rauf 'Angry' As Jayasuriya's Audacious Reverse Scoop Turns Him A Rookie
body:
Haris Rauf giving a look at Shehan Jayasuriya in MLC 2024 (X.com)

In recent times, Haris Rauf has been belted by most of the batters, whether it is in the ODIs, the T20Is, or even the T20s. Sri Lanka’s 32-year-old Shehan Jayasuriya on Tuesday (July 16), as he played a shot against the extreme speedster, which he will remember for some time when they met in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

Haris Rauf 'In Disbelief' After Shehan Jayasuriya's Reverse Scoop

It was Match 13 of MLC 2024, where Rauf, representing San Francisco Unicorns, was up against Jayasuriya, who came to bat for Seattle Orcas. During the sixth over of Orcas’ innings, Rauf bowled a short-of-a-length delivery outside the off stump. Jayasuriya, after anticipating a similar delivery, went for a bizarre stance.

Then he played an audacious reverse scoop, and the timing was so perfect that, it nonchalantly went for an effortless four over the keeper’s head.

Rauf could not believe what the Sri Lankan batter just did, as he gave him an angry look before going towards his run-up.
summary: In Match 13 of MLC 2024, Shehan Jayasuriya of Seattle Orcas played a remarkable reverse scoop shot against Haris Rauf of San Francisco Unicorns. Rauf bowled a short-of-a-length delivery outside the off stump, which Jayasuriya anticipated and responded to with an audacious shot that sailed over the keeper's head for four. Rauf was left in disbelief, giving Jayasuriya an angry look before resetting for his next delivery.

title: Match Award to a Fan During Major League Cricket
body:
Australia allrounder Glenn Maxwell’s wholesome gesture after a Major League Cricket (MLC) match is winning internet.

The superstar cricketer led the Washington Freedom to an eight-wicket victory over the LA Knight Riders recently with impressive bowling figures of 3/15 in his four-over spell.

Also Read: WI Coach Hopes Team Can Dip Into Gabba Spirit to Bounce Back

After winning the Player of the Match award, Maxwell decided to hand the prize to one of his fans.

Washington Freedom shared a clip of the Aussie star handing over the trophy after the game.

In the video, Maxwell can be seen handing over the award to a fan behind the advertisement banners.

His gesture drew a round of applause from the supporters nearby.

Maxwell was then also seen signing some autographs for the fans before taking pictures too.

Fans have been praising the 35-year-old.

One of them wrote, “Proud of you as an RCBian.”

Another suggested how lucky the fan was to meet one of the best all-rounders in the game. “His men are so lucky that they met Maxi,” read the comment/

Another agreed and wrote, “Luckiest guys who met him.”

One fan feels that Australian players are all kind-hearted. “Australia’s players’ heart is made up of diamonds.”

“So proud to call ourselves his fans,” wrote another.

Playing at the Chruch Street Park, Washington Freedom bowled out LA Knight Riders for 129 in 18.4 overs. Apart from Maxwell’s starring role, Saurabh Netravalkar also played a massive role by taking four wickets.

Their chase was powered by Travis Head and Steve Smith with the pair adding 79 runs for the first wicket.

Maxwell did not have the best T20 World Cup 2024 campaign with Australia. he struggled for form as his side crashed out in the Super Eight phase. They were handed a crushing defeat by a Rohit Sharma-led India which ended their semi-finals hopes.
summary: In a recent MLC match, Glenn Maxwell led the Washington Freedom to an 8-wicket victory over the LA Knight Riders, taking 3/15 in his 4-over spell. He was awarded the Player of the Match award, which he generously handed over to a fan in the stands. The Washington Freedom team shared a video of the heartwarming moment, which received praise from fans on social media. In the match, the Washington Freedom bowled out LA Knight Riders for 129 in 18.4 overs, with Saurabh Netravalkar taking 4 wickets. The Freedom's chase was led by Travis Head and Steve Smith, who added 79 runs for the first wicket.

title: Latest Cricket News on Washington freedom on Cricketnmore
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders: Washington Freedom defeated Los Angeles Knight Riders by eight wickets to register their third consecutive victory of the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) at Church Street Park on Sunday.

Washington’s Saurabh Netravalkar (4/35) and Glen Maxwell (3/15) were exceptional with the ball, ensuring the Los Angeles Knight Riders were restricted to 129/10. In the second innings, a hard-hitting knock from Travis Head (54) and a composed innings from Steven Smith (42*), helped the Washington Freedom romp home with four overs to spare.

The Washington Freedom dominated the run chase from the outset. Openers Travis Head and Steven Smith ensured an explosive powerplay, with Head clearing the ropes effortlessly. By the end of six overs, Washington Freedom were well ahead at 61/0. While Steven Smith batted cautiously, Travis Head reached his half-century in just 27 balls, including six maximums. However, Shadley Van Schalkwyk broke the 79-run partnership by dismissing Head in the ninth over.

title: [Watch] Imad Wasim Shatters Jake Fraser-McGurk's Stumps Using A Masterplan In MLC 2024
body:
Imad Wasim rattles Jake Fraser-McGurk's stumps [Seattle Orcas/X]

Pakistan all-rounder, Imad Wasim cleaned up the dangerous Jake Fraser-McGurk as Seattle Orcas (SEO) faced San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) in Match 13 of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 in Morrisville.

Seattle Orcas asked San Fransisco Unicorns to bat first on Tuesday, as they looked to get the second win under their belt. Imad Wasim opened the bowling for Seattle alongside Nadre Burger as he dismissed Fraser-McGurk to stop him from taking the game away from the Unicorns.

The incident occurred at the 2.3 over mark as Wasim came in to bowl his second over and bowled a ball pitching outside off which nipped back in with his arm to dismantle the Aussie batter's leg stump, where he looked to swing it across the line on the leg side.

Watch: Imad Wasim knock over Fraser-McGurk in MLC

The 22-year-old left the field scoring 11 (10) including two fours off Burger in the previous over. The wicket reduced SFU to 20/1 after 2.3 overs. They went on to score 165/ in their 20 overs with the Pakistan all-rounder finishing with the figures of 2/28 in his quota of 4 overs.

However, SO fell short in the run chase by 23 runs, finishing at 142/6 with Liam Plunkett winning the game for SFU with his 3/26 in 4 overs.
summary:
**Match Details:**

* Match 13 of MLC 2024 between Seattle Orcas (SEO) and San Francisco Unicorns (SFU)
* Venue: Morrisville
* Date: Tuesday

**Key Events:**

* Imad Wasim, Pakistan all-rounder, bowled Jake Fraser-McGurk for 11 in the 2.3 over to reduce SFU to 20/1.
* SFU scored 165/8 in 20 overs, with Imad Wasim finishing with figures of 2/28 in 4 overs.
* SEO fell short in the run chase, finishing at 142/6, with Liam Plunkett taking 3/26 in 4 overs to win the game for SFU.

title: [Watch] Andre Russell's Fiery Delivery Breaks Travis Head's Bat In MLC 2024
body:
Andre Russell breaks Travis Head's bat [X.com]

In a thrilling Major League Cricket (MLC) encounter, Australian batting sensation Travis Head experienced a shocking moment when his bat was shattered by a fiery delivery from West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell.

The dramatic incident occurred during the match between the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and Washington Freedom (WSF) on Sunday, July 14, at Church Street Park in Morrisville.

The match began with the Washington Freedom, led by captain Steve Smith, opting to bowl first. The Knight Riders struggled against the disciplined bowling attack of Washington Freedom, managing only 129 runs in 18.4 overs.

Watch - Andre Russell breaks Travis Head's bat

In response, Washington Freedom's openers, Head and Smith, laid a solid foundation with a partnership of 79 runs, making the chase look easy. However, the highlight of the innings came in the second over when Andre Russell bowled a short-pitched delivery.

Head attempted a pull shot, but the ball struck the upper part of his bat, splitting it into two pieces. The shocking moment left Head holding just the handle while the broken bat flew towards mid-wicket, the videos and images quickly went viral on social media.

Despite the unexpected interruption, Head's composure and Washington's strong start ensured they cruised to an eight-wicket victory, maintaining their unbeaten streak and solidifying their position at the top of the points table.
summary: In the Major League Cricket (MLC) match between the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and Washington Freedom (WSF) on July 14, Washington Freedom won by 8 wickets. Washington Freedom, led by captain Steve Smith, opted to bowl first and restricted LAKR to 129 runs in 18.4 overs. In response, Washington Freedom's openers Travis Head and Smith built a strong foundation, but the match was highlighted by a dramatic moment when Andre Russell's delivery broke Head's bat into two pieces. Despite the interruption, Washington Freedom cruised to victory, maintaining their unbeaten streak and solidifying their top position in the points table.

title: Saffas Abroad: Du Plessis, Rickelton go big in MLC
body:
Former Proteas captain Faf du Plessis and Ryan Rickelton were the star South African performers in the latest round of Major League Cricket.

Major League Cricket

Justin Dill, who was born in Port Elizabeth, took 3-33 in the Washington Freedom’s four-run victory over MI New York.

Faf du Plessis smashed 100 off 58 balls (12 fours, five sixes) for the Texas Super Kings in their match against the Washington Freedom. There was no-result due to rain.

The former Proteas captain also scored 62 off just 38 deliveries (four fours, four sixes) in the Super Kings’ 15-run win against MI New York.

Ryan Rickelton scored 103* off 66 balls (nine fours, five sixes) in the Seattle Orcas’ nine-wicket victory over the LA Knight Riders.

Heinrich Klaasen struck 51 off 30 deliveries (four fours, three sixes) in the Seattle Orcas’ five-wicket loss to the Washington Freedom.

T20 Blast

Former Proteas spinner and Essex captain Simon Harmer took 3-44 as his team lost to Surrey by 13 runs.

Lanka Premier League

Rilee Rosssouw scored 108* off 50 deliveries (12 fours, six sixes) to lead the Jaffna Kings to a seven-wicket victory over the Colombo Strikers.

– Compiled by Dylan Johnson
summary: In the latest round of Major League Cricket, several South African players made notable performances. Faf du Plessis starred for the Texas Super Kings, scoring 100 off 58 balls in a rain-affected match against the Washington Freedom, and 62 off 38 deliveries in a 15-run win against MI New York. Ryan Rickelton impressed for the Seattle Orcas, scoring an unbeaten 103 off 66 balls in a nine-wicket victory over the LA Knight Riders. Heinrich Klaasen also contributed 51 off 30 deliveries in the Orcas' five-wicket loss to the Washington Freedom. Additionally, Justin Dill took 3-33 in the Washington Freedom's four-run win over MI New York.

title: [Watch] Imad Wasim 'Can't Believe It' As He Catches A One-Handed Stunner In MLC 2024
body:
Imad's reaction on his catch [X]

Pakistan's premier white-ball cricketer, Imad Wasim, has grabbed the limelight with his incredible all-round prowess in the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States.

Besides scalping three wickets with his wily left-arm off-spin, the veteran cricketer has also been magnificent on the field, putting up several spectacular fielding efforts.

One of Imad's exceptional catches has been included among the best grabs in the tournament's second week.

Watch- Imad's animated reaction after one-handed blinder

During Seattle Orcas' group-stage match against Washington Freedom, Imad exhibited his fielding attributes, grabbing a sensational one-handed catch in the second half.

The incident occurred during the seventh over of Washington's innings when they had already lost three early wickets.

Bowling the third over of his spell, Seattle's Nandre Burger had a poor start, conceding a boundary on his first ball. However, he bounced back remarkably, giving away only two runs off his next three deliveries.

From around the wicket, Burger bowled a short-of-good-length delivery outside the off stump, with Washington's Mukhtar Ahmed punching it in the air.

As the ball flew towards the off side, Imad, stationed at cover, pulled off a magnificent one-handed catch to stun the batter.
summary: In the ongoing MLC tournament in the United States, Pakistani cricketer Imad Wasim has impressed with his all-round skills. He took three wickets with his left-arm off-spin and made several spectacular fielding efforts, including a one-handed catch during a group-stage match between Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom. The catch was considered one of the best in the tournament's second week. Imad's fielding skills were on display when he grabbed a catch at cover off a delivery by Seattle's Nandre Burger in the seventh over of Washington's innings.

title: MLC 2024: Glenn Maxwell wins hearts as he gives his POTM award to a fan
body:
Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell displayed a heartwarming gesture after his side’s match at the MLC (Major League Cricket) 2024. After Washington Freedom’s clash against Los Angeles Knight Riders in the tournament, Glenn Maxwell had won the Player of the Match award; however, he gave his award to a fan and even gave him an autograph.

In the clip, which has gone viral all over social media, Maxwell was captured giving a big box to a young fan after the game. Despite not getting the chance to bat, Maxwell impressed with his bowling.

Taking three wickets, Maxwell conceded 15 runs in his spell and helped limit Knight Riders to a total of 129 runs in the first innings of the game. Furthermore, Freedom chased down the target in just 16 overs, losing just two wickets in the process, winning the game by eight wickets.

The clip of Maxwell giving his award to a fan was shared by Washington Freedom on their official X handle. “The winner of the hearts award goes to **Glenn Maxwell, who graciously gave his POTM award to his fan,” Freedom captioned the post.

It was nice to get some help from the wicket: Maxwell

After the game, Glenn Maxwell came forward to talk about his performance in the clash, and how it was good that the surface was helping the bowlers. He also opined that he loves not having to bat.

“We're fortunate with the conditions and Saurabh picking wickets at top. It was nice to get some help from the wicket. There was little bit of spin, little bit of inconsistency. It was a good day and nice to go at the top as well. I'm absolutely loving not having to bat; great to give my body a bit of rest. Smudge (Steve Smith) is doing a great job as a leader and opener, very fortunate to have him,” Maxwell said in the post-match presentation ceremony.
summary:
* Glenn Maxwell, the Australian all-rounder, played a crucial role in Washington Freedom's win against Los Angeles Knight Riders in the MLC 2024.
* Despite not getting a chance to bat, Maxwell impressed with his bowling, taking three wickets and conceding 15 runs, helping limit Knight Riders to 129 runs.
* Washington Freedom successfully chased the target in 16 overs, winning the game by 8 wickets.
* Maxwell was awarded the Player of the Match, but he gave the award to a young fan and even signed an autograph for him.
* In a post-match interview, Maxwell credited the conditions and his teammate Saurabh for helping the bowlers, and expressed his relief at not having to bat, allowing his body some rest.

title: WATCH: Travis Head shocked as his bat breaks in two against Andre Russell’s bowling at MLC 2024
body:
A dramatic turn of events unfolded during the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) match between Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and Washington Freedom (WF) at the Church Street Park on Sunday. All-rounder Andre Russell’s fiery delivery left the cricketing world awestruck after it resulted in a shattered bat for Washington opener Travis Head.

Andre Russell’s delivery shatters Travis Head’s bat

Chasing a modest target of 130 runs, Washington openers Head and Steve Smith set the tone for a comfortable chase with a strong 79-run partnership. However, Head’s batting was about to take an unexpected detour.

In the second over of the innings, Russell unleashed a pacy short-of-length delivery that deceived Head. The southpaw attempted a pull shot, but the ball rocketed into the upper part of his bat, shattering the willow into two pieces. The force of the blow sent the handle flying in one direction and the rest of the bat in another, leaving Head with a look of disbelief.

Here’s the video:

Also WATCH: Steve Smith grabs a screamer off Glenn Maxwell’s bowling in WF vs LAKR game at MLC 2024

Despite the shocking incident, Head remained composed and continued his batting. He went on to score a well-deserved half-century (54 runs off 32 balls), laced with two fours and six maximums, guiding Washington Freedom to a convincing eight-wicket victory.

Washington Freedom cruises towards playoffs

Washington Freedom’s dominant performance secured a well-deserved win, keeping their unbeaten record intact. They now hold the top spot in the standings with seven points from four completed matches and a no-result. With only three games remaining, they are almost guaranteed a spot in the top four and a berth in the playoffs.

On the other hand, the loss was a setback for Los Angeles Knight Riders. This defeat marks their third in four completed matches, leaving them precariously placed second-last on the points table with just three points from five games. Their qualification for the playoffs appears increasingly challenging.
summary:
* The Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) faced the Washington Freedom (WF) in a 2024 MLC match at Church Street Park on Sunday.
* In the second over of Washington's innings, Andre Russell's fast delivery shattered Travis Head's bat, but Head remained composed and went on to score 54 runs off 32 balls, helping Washington to an eight-wicket victory.
* Washington Freedom now tops the standings with seven points from four completed matches and a no-result, and is almost guaranteed a spot in the top four and a berth in the playoffs.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders, on the other hand, suffered their third defeat in four completed matches, leaving them second-last on the points table with three points from five games, making their playoff qualification challenging.

title: [WATCH]- Travis Head Shocked To See His Broken Bat While Attempting To Pull Andre Russell In The MLC 2024 Match
body:
During the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) clash between the Los Angeles Travis HeadKnight Riders (LAKR) and Washington Freedom (WSF) at Morrisville on Sunday, July 14, a humorous incident unfolded with Travis Head.

The left-hander was taken aback when his bat broke and unexpectedly flew out of his grip while attempting a pull shot against a brisk short-of-length delivery from West Indian all-rounder Andre Russell. As the ball headed towards mid-on, Head’s bat veered towards the square leg umpire, leaving the Aussie opener visibly astonished.

After that incident, Head quickly found his form, smashing a superb 54 off just 32 balls, including two fours and six sixes. In pursuit of a modest 130 for victory, the 30-year-old ensured WSF encountered no difficulties, wrapping up the chase in just 16 overs with eight wickets in hand. Head received strong support from captain Steve Smith, who remained unbeaten on 42 off 36 balls.

This marked Head’s maiden half-century in the tournament, bringing his total runs to 87 in four matches at an average of 29 and a striking rate exceeding 164.

The victory ensured WSF’s undefeated streak continued, securing their third win in three completed matches, alongside one No Result. Leading comfortably with 7 points from 4 matches and three games remaining, WSF are well positioned for a top-four finish and advancement to the playoffs.

WSF’s stellar bowling preceded Travis Head’s exploits

Travis Head’s half-century stood out in WSF’s chase, following a dominant bowling performance in the first innings. Opting to field after winning the toss, WSF restricted LAKR to just 129 runs in 18.4 overs.

USA’s Saurabh Netravalkar, continuing his impressive form from the 2024 T20 World Cup, recorded exceptional figures of 4/35 in 3.4 overs. He was well-supported by Glenn Maxwell (3/15) and Lockie Ferguson (2/31), keeping LAKR’s batsmen under constant pressure.

This defeat marked LAKR’s third loss in four completed matches, placing them second from the bottom with three points from five games. They face a crucial match against the Seattle Orcas on Wednesday, July 17.

Meanwhile, WSF will aim to maintain their unbeaten streak when they meet MI New York (MINY) on Tuesday, July 16.
summary:
**Match Result**: Washington Freedom (WSF) defeated Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) by 8 wickets, chasing down a target of 130 in just 16 overs.

**Notable Performances**: Travis Head scored his maiden half-century in the tournament, making 54 off 32 balls, including 2 fours and 6 sixes. He was supported by captain Steve Smith, who remained unbeaten on 42 off 36 balls. Saurabh Netravalkar took 4/35 in 3.4 overs, while Glenn Maxwell and Lockie Ferguson took 3/15 and 2/31 respectively to restrict LAKR to 129 runs.

**Tournament Standings**: WSF remains undefeated with 7 points from 4 matches, while LAKR has 3 points from 5 games. WSF is well-positioned for a top-four finish and advancement to the playoffs.

**Upcoming Matches**: WSF will face MI New York on Tuesday, July 16, while LAKR will play Seattle Orcas on Wednesday, July 17.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom continues reign on top with a thumping eight
body:
Saurabh Netravalkar and Glenn Maxwell headlined an incisive bowling attack as Washington Freedom beat Los Angeles Knight Riders by eight wickets in their fourth Major League Cricket 2024 match at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina on Sunday.

Netravalkar picked up 4/35 while Player of the Match Maxwell bowled a miserly spell of 3/15 in four overs as we dismissed LAKR for 129 in 18.4 overs. Saif Badar scored 35 off 28 balls for the Knight Riders.

In response, we reached 130/2 in 16 overs with Travis Head top-scoring in the contest with 54 off just 32 balls. The southpaw’s first fifty in MLC was laden with six sixes and two fours. Our skipper Steve Smith hit two sixes and two fours to remain unbeaten on 42 off 36 balls.

Opting to bowl first, Netravalkar struck with his first ball of the day to beat LAKR Skipper Sunil Narine for a duck. The left-arm pacer made his first over even more memorable with the wicket of Unmukt Chand off the last ball.

Smith introduced spinner Maxwell in the third over. The off-spinner reaped immediate reward going through the gate of Shakib Al Hasan as LAKR were three down with the score reading just 13. Soon it became 18/4 with Lockie Ferguson also getting into the act to clean up Jason Roy.

Maxwell returned to pick up two more wickets including the big-hitting Andre Russell, who was dismissed for 20. Netravalkar polished off the tail to end with four wickets as the LAKR innings folded up for 129. Meanwhile, Ferguson also chipped in with 2/31 in four overs.

Chasing a modest target, Smith and Head gave us a flying start racing to 61 at the end of the powerplay. Head was particularly severe smashing sixes off all four bowlers introduced in the first six overs as 44 runs came from boundaries during the period.

Head brought up his fifty, off just 27 balls, in style with a huge six down the ground as the Australian duo added 79 for the opening wicket, the highest partnership for us, for any wicket in the history of MLC.

Smith took charge once Head departed and remained unbeaten to see us through with four overs to spare. Smith jumped to second in the overall batting charts of MLC 2024 with 126 runs at an unbelievable average of 126.00 and a strike rate of 140.00.

After yet another victory, we continue on top of the MLC 2024 points table with seven points from four matches.

We are up against MI New York in our next match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Tuesday.

Los Angeles Knight Riders vs Washington Freedom MLC 2024 brief scores: LAKR 129/10 in 18.4 overs (Saif Badar 35, Andre Russell 20, Saurabh Netravalkar 4/35, Glenn Maxwell 3/15) vs WF 130/2 in 16 overs (Travis Head 54, Steve Smith 42, Shadley van Schalkwyk 1/17, Spencer Johnson 1/33).

Washington Freedom won by eight wickets.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated Los Angeles Knight Riders by 8 wickets in their fourth MLC 2024 match.

**Scorecard:** LA Knight Riders: 129/10 in 18.4 overs, Washington Freedom: 130/2 in 16 overs.

**Key Performers:** Saurabh Netravalkar (4/35), Glenn Maxwell (3/15), Travis Head (54 off 32 balls), Steve Smith (42 off 36 balls, unbeaten).

**Tournament Standings:** Washington Freedom continue to top the MLC 2024 points table with 7 points from 4 matches.

**Next Match:** Washington Freedom will play against MI New York in their next match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Tuesday.

title: America’s Major League Cricket Set To Ride Momentum Of T20 World Cup
body:
After a momentous T20 World Cup co-hosted by the U.S., marked by a $30 million cricket stadium in New York along with a stirring underdog performance by the national team, hopes are high for a pivotal second season of Major League Cricket.

While this year's marquee cricket tournament was expectantly mostly in the shadows in the world's biggest sports market, it did receive significant exposure with coverage in media institutions like The New York Times, CNN and The Washington Post.

No one thinks it will become mainstream in the U.S. but the sleeping giant - with cricket by some metrics the second most popular sport in the world - has finally awakened.

It came just before the much-anticipated second season of MLC, the lucrative professional T20 league in the U.S. luring top players around the world. MI New York and Seattle Orcas launched the latest edition on Friday in a rematch of last year's final.

As I reported, the MLC's historic first season exceeded financial targets with revenues of $8 million, but its launch was undoubtedly helped by the novelty factor after previous attempts by administrators to strike gold in America failed.

ForbesAmerica's Major League Cricket Debut Surpassed Expectations On And Off The Field

"Could have been some element of that (novelty factor), but I think this fanbase is looking for high quality cricket on the field," MLC chief executive Vijay Srinivasan told me.

"We want to make sure of the standards befitting American professional sports and I think we delivered that (last season) and were recognized in the world of cricket."

MLC has been able to secure major sponsorship deals, highlighted by Cognizant - a multinational information technology services and consulting company - becoming its first title sponsor.

"We are growing. We definitely have been very successful in sponsorship sales and certainly we want to deliver and show value," Srinivasan said.

As I reported previously, salary caps for teams are to remain the same, but top players will still be handsomely remunerated and earn around $175,000 for a minimum of five games - rivalling the highest figure per game in T20 leagues outside of the money-spinning Indian Premier league.

While Indian players are not allowed to play outside of the IPL, a slew of stars will play in this season's MLC - many from Australia highlighted by San Francisco's marquee signing of Pat Cummins to a four-year deal.

Ahead of this season, MLC received official T20 league status with tournament playing records counted towards format statistics.

"The goal is to be competitive (financially) with the top leagues and there will be adjustment that happens as we grow," Srinivasan said. "That's (salary caps) something we'll have to review every season.

"We've got some really strong names coming here. Ultimately, the teams and the players are what defines the product."

While things are looking rosy in American cricket, there has been familiar warring behind the scenes with governing body USA Cricket amid continual turmoil after a spate of resignations and chief executive Dr. Noor Murad having his contract terminated earlier this year.

As I reported in April, USA Cricket avoided calls for suspension, but its funding is being 'controlled' by the sport's governing body. The situation is likely to be a talking point at the International Cricket Council's upcoming Annual General Meeting.

Forbes'Controlled Funding' Put In Place For USA Cricket Ahead Of Home T20 World Cup

USA Cricket sanctions MLC, which is administered by American Cricket Enterprises after signing a 50-year commercial rights agreement in 2019.

"Governance is always a challenge, but it needs to sort itself out," Srinivasan, a co-founder of ACE, said. "We are certainly hopeful that things will stabilize."

There are plans to expand MLC, with Chicago and Atlanta touted as possible new franchises amid a longer tournament earmarked to be played over much of June and July moving forward.

But, right now, MLC is hoping to continue the trajectory of the British bat and ball sport with deep roots in a cricket backwater. While figures have varied, with the sport's governing body having claimed that there are 50 million cricket fans in the U.S., there is already an invested fanbase for MLC.

"Willow (cricket broadcaster into North America) goes into around four-five million homes, so that probably translates to a fanbase of something in the range of 10 million people," Srinivasan said.

"There's a lot of interest and excitement in MLC after the T20 World Cup. I think we can ride that momentum."
summary:
**Season 2 of MLC**: The second season of MLC has kicked off with a rematch between MI New York and Seattle Orcas, following a successful first season that exceeded financial targets with revenues of $8 million.

**Expanding Reach**: The tournament has secured major sponsorship deals, including a title sponsorship with Cognizant, and has received official T20 league status, with tournament playing records counted towards format statistics.

**Player Contracts**: Top players will earn around $175,000 for a minimum of five games, rivaling figures in other T20 leagues outside of the Indian Premier League. Stars from Australia, including Pat Cummins, will participate in this season's MLC.

**Future Plans**: There are plans to expand MLC, with Chicago and Atlanta touted as possible new franchises, and a longer tournament earmarked to be played over much of June and July in the future.

**Challenges**: Despite the progress, MLC faces challenges, including governance issues with USA Cricket, the sport's governing body in the US.

**Fanbase**: MLC has an invested fanbase, with cricket broadcaster Willow reaching around 4-5 million homes, translating to a fanbase of around 10 million people. The tournament hopes to ride the momentum generated by the recent T20 World Cup.

title: Major League Cricket Live telecast: When and where to watch the USA's MLC 2024 on TV and streaming in India?
body:
With the signings of Steve Smith, Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Glenn Maxwell and likes of Ricky Ponting and Shane Watson as coaches, in just its second season, the Major League Cricket (MLC) is starting to flex its muscles. Despite cricket not being the first sport in the USA, MLC has grown leaps and bounds in a span of 12 months and since the second season is taking place right after the T20 World Cup where the national cricket team of the country did well and qualified for the second round, the competition will benefit it majorly.

A few key players have switched sides including Lockie Ferguson and David Miller but the since the local American players have become household names now, there is anticipation and excitement and hopefully a lot more things to come in the future.

When and where to watch Major League Cricket on TV and streaming in India?

The second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to take place from July 5 to 28 and all 25 matches will be broadcast on Sony Sports Network on TV in India. The day matches are scheduled to have a 12:30/1 AM IST start while the evening matches as per the local time have been scheduled for a 6 AM IST kick-off. All the matches will be available on the JioCinema app and website for live streaming.

title: Major League Cricket: Nicholas Pooran Powers MI New York To Six-Wicket Win Over Seattle Orcas In Season Opener
body:
The Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season commenced on Friday as MI New York began their title defence with a commanding six-wicket win over Seattle Orcas at the Church Street Park Stadium. All eyes were on Nicholas Pooran at Church Street Park in Morrisville as the West Indian wicketkeeper-batter continued his form from the 2023 edition. His unbeaten 62 off just 37 balls helped MI New York chase down a total of 109 runs in just 14.2 overs.

With the early wickets of Ruben Clinton (6) and USA's national team skipper Monank Patel (8), the initial momentum seemed to be in the Seattle Orcas' favour. Cameron Gannon was the main bowling aggressor, getting both batters in the third over and giving his team a ray of hope.

But then, Pooran proceeded to hit Gannon for two sixes and as many fours in his next over. This turned the tide in MI New York's favour.

Eventually, Pooran's power-hitting abilities proved to be too much for the Seattle Orcas. They got the wickets of Shayan Jahangir (3) and Tim David (12) as well, but the left-handed Pooran and his countryman Kieron Pollard (8*) took their team over the line for their first win of MLC 2024.

Earlier in the day, the skills of the MI New York bowlers were on display as they bowled out the Seattle Orcas for just 108 runs. Rashid Khan and Trent Boult bagged three wickets each, never really allowing their opponents to settle into the match.

New Zealand's star pacer Boult got the early breakthrough in the opening over itself, sending Nauman Anwar back to the pavilion for a duck. The Pakistan batter's late attempt to cut the ball away caught a faint edge which travelled to the wicketkeeper and eventual match-winner Pooran.

With Quinton de Kock (5) still at the crease, the Seattle Orcas could still hit a competitive score, but he was also removed by Boult in the next over. His attempt to hit the ball through the leg side was met with a top edge, and Pooran did well to get underneath it and send de Kock back to the pavilion.

From then on, MI New York were in the driving seat, getting the regular wickets. For the Seattle Orcas, Shubham Ranjane ended as the highest run-getter with a tidy innings of 35 runs in 31 balls. Finding the boundary regularly, Ranjane proved to be a threat before he tried to hit Rashid Khan for consecutive sixes but fell short in his second attempt, hitting the ball to Tim David instead.

Harmeet Singh, who recently featured for the USA in the T20 World Cup, played a 20-run cameo as the side set a target that was eventually chased down by the defending champions with 34 balls to spare.

(This story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)
summary:
**Match Result:** MI New York won by 6 wickets against Seattle Orcas in the opening match of the MLC 2024 season.

**Score:** Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 108 runs, and MI New York chased down the target in 14.2 overs with 34 balls to spare.

**Top Performers:** Nicholas Pooran top-scored for MI New York with an unbeaten 62 off 37 balls, while Rashid Khan and Trent Boult took three wickets each for MI New York.

**Key Moments:** Pooran's power-hitting turned the tide in MI New York's favor, while Boult's early breakthroughs and Rashid Khan's regular wickets restricted Seattle Orcas to a low score.

**Other Notable Performances:** Shubham Ranjane was the highest run-getter for Seattle Orcas with 35 runs in 31 balls, and Harmeet Singh played a 20-run cameo for the Orcas.

title: Washington Freedom vs MI New York Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

The Washington Freedom get their 2024 Major League Cricket campaign underway looking to build upon finishing third in the inaugural season in 2023 as they take on the defending champions and the well grooved franchise of MI New York.

WASHINGTON FREEDOM FORM: AUSSIE AUSSIE AUSSIE

The Washington Freedom come into the tournament captained by Australian batting legend Steve Snith with fellow Aussies Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Andrew Tye and Jack Edwards in the squad. They have a seriously strong side all-round with the likes of Akeal Hosein, Marco Jansen, Rachin Ravindra, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andries Gous and Lockie Ferguson in their squad.

LAST THREE: LLWWW

MI NEW YORK FORM: WINNING MACHINE

MI New York cruised to an opening game victory against the team that they defeated in the final, the Seattle Orcas, after they skittled the Orcas for 108 in 19.1 overs yesterday. They gave teams a head start after a poor beginning to the 2023 campaign before clicking and they appear to have clicked almost immediately this time around.

LAST THREE: WWWL

WASHINGTON FREEDOM BETTING ANALYSIS

The Washington Freedom have an excellent side throughout but the one man, of the many, that they will rely upon for quick runs at the top of the order will be the ever impressive and still improving Travis Head. Backing the Aussie T20 opener and potential future captain to be their best bat in this one looks a good bet.

With the ball, MI New York lost both of their openers, Ruben Clifton and Monank Patel, to the change up right arm medium bowling of Cameron Gannon. That will leave Andrew Tye licking his lips and Tye to take two or more wickets is something worth having a look at here.

MI NEW YORK BETTING ANALYSIS

Last season, the excellence of West Indian Nicholas Pooran saw him become the tournament’s top run scorer and he got off to another strong start the other night in what proved to be a match-winning knock in a small chase. Backing Pooran to continue his fine form is always fairly safe and him scoring 30 or more seems a good bet.

With the ball, MI New York ripped through the Orcas’ top order in the powerplay with the excellent Trent Boult taking 3-25 in the end off his four overs. Rashid Khan’s spin also claimed three wickets and that is a known weakness of Head so Khan or Boult taking two or more wickets appears a more than reasonable bet.

WASHINGTON FREEDOM VS MI NEW YORK EXPERT PREDICTION

Now then, this one might actually be tough to call. Whilst MI New York began with a comfortable victory in their opening game and they are the defending champions of this competition, the Washington Freedom have real star names of the T20 circuit littered throughout their side and will be captained by an excellent tactician in Steve Smith. One bet that seems a decent shout, though, is for Pooran to continue his good form and even top sore in the match, once again.

title: San Francisco Unicorns vs Los Angeles Knight Riders Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

It is the opening match of the 2024 Major League Cricket season for the San Francisco Unicorns, coached by Shane Watson, as they take on the Los Angeles Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas on Sunday evening in the United States.

DATE & TIME: Sunday 7th July, 2024 - USA ET – 8:30pm / USA PT – 5:30pm / West Indies – 7:30pm & Monday 8th July, 2024 - UK – 1:30am / South Africa – 2:30am / Pakistan – 5:30am / India – 6:00am / Bangladesh – 6:30am / Australia – 10:30am

VENUE: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, Texas, United States

WEATHER: 31c or 87.8 F with thunderstorms forecasted

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – N/A

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports app / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – Amazon Prime Video

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS FORM: A GUTTING FIRST SEASON

The San Francisco Unicorns missed out on a top four spot and the playoffs in 2023 due to net run rate so they will be out to right that underperformance. Captained by Corey Anderson, there is plenty of experience in the Unicorns’ side such as Pat Cummins, Matt Henry and Liam Plunkett but the star attraction is likely to be West Indian all-rounder Sherfane Rutherford.

LAST THREE: LLWLW

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS FORM: A TERRIBLE FIRST SEASON

In contrast to the Unicorns’ narrow miss on the top four last season, the Los Angeles Knight Riders, affiliated with Indian Premier League side the Kolkata Knight Riders, endured a miserable campaign last season. LAKR began with four defeats, and all four defeats were fairly heavy, before finishing the season, in last place, with a slender two-wicket defeat against league winners Seattle Orcas.

LAST THREE: WLLLL

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS BETTING ANALYSIS

The biggest weakness in a weak LAKR side would be their bowling department so San Francisco Unicorns to score big runs would appear quite likely. There aren’t too many standout candidates for that role, though, with emphasis on their own bowling but one man who will be key to any success is likely to be Jake Fraser-McGurk, set to be a leading light of Australia’s next white-ball era. Fraser-McGurk to start his newest franchise journey off well as their top scorer in this match would be worth a shot.

In the bowling attack, T20 has arguably been Pat Cummins’ weakest format but the Australian Test captain took hat-tricks in successive matches at the World Cup so will come into this feeling a bit of form. Cummins to begin his campaign with two or more wickets seems a good bet.

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS BETTING ANALYSIS

As mentioned, LAKR’s weakness is probably with the ball but with the bat they are not too much stronger, at least on paper. Former England international Jason Roy is likely to be in the top three but it will be middle-order hitting they rely on and, in particular, David Miller who is likeliest to be their best batter in most matches.

With the ball, though, they will believe that some skilful bowling will be able to hurt what is not the most star-studded Unicorns lineup. That is where the excellent spin of Adam Zampa comes into play and the Australian international to take two or more wickets seems a good bet.

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS VS LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS EXPERT PREDICTION

These two were the weakest teams in the competition last season but both sides will be hoping to be a little rejuvenated this time around. There is one clear ‘top tip’ to offer here, though. The Unicorns’ strength is in their pace-bowling attack, whilst LAKR look quite weak at the top of the order. Naturally, then, if the Unicorns open up with seam, LAKR may well struggle and that should result in the San Francisco Unicorns having the better of the powerplay and the higher opening stand.
summary:
**Match Details:**
The opening match of the 2024 Major League Cricket season will be played between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Los Angeles Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas on July 7, 2024.

**Teams:**
The San Francisco Unicorns, coached by Shane Watson and captained by Corey Anderson, are looking to improve on their disappointing first season where they missed out on the playoffs due to net run rate. The team consists of experienced players like Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Liam Plunkett, with West Indian all-rounder Sherfane Rutherford being the star attraction.

The Los Angeles Knight Riders, affiliated with the Indian Premier League side Kolkata Knight Riders, had a poor first season, finishing last with a slender two-wicket defeat against the league winners Seattle Orcas. They are looking to bounce back this season.

**Key Players:**
For the San Francisco Unicorns, Jake Fraser-McGurk is expected to be a leading light in their batting lineup, while Pat Cummins will be key to their bowling attack.

For the Los Angeles Knight Riders, David Miller is expected to be their best batter, while Adam Zampa's spin bowling will be crucial to their success.

**Expert Prediction:**
The San Francisco Unicorns are expected to have the better of the powerplay and higher opening stand due to their strong pace-bowling attack and the Los Angeles Knight Riders' weaknesses at the top of the order.

title: FAQs: All you need to know about MLC 2024
body:
The teams, the format, the big names, and everything else you might have been wondering about

Abhimanyu Bose

05-Jul-2024 • 20 hrs ago

Did you think the cricket fever would die in the USA after the T20 World Cup? Think again, because the second season of Major League Cricket (MLC) is upon us. The first edition had high scores and thrilling individual performances as some of the biggest names in T20 cricket showcased their talent in Texas and North Carolina. So what's in store for us this year? Find all your answers here.

First things first. When does it start?

The first match is on Friday, July 5, with MI New York taking on Seattle Orcas in Morrisville. The tournament will go on till July 28. There will be a total of 25 matches.

So who are the teams participating? And who won it the first time around?

The six teams are Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings and Washington Freedom.

It was MI New York, inspired by a whirlwind Nicholas Pooran century, who beat Seattle Orcas in the final to win the inaugural title.

Are you sure it's the MLC and not the IPL? There seem to be a lot of familiar names...

That's because IPL franchises have invested in most of the teams in the tournament, as they have in other franchise leagues like SA20, ILT20 and the CPL. IPL franchises own four teams in the MLC. Apart from the three obvious ones, Seattle Orcas are owned by the GMR Group, who co-own Delhi Capitals.

Washington Freedom, owned by Indian-American entrepreneur Sanjay Govil, have Cricket New South Wales as their high-performance partner. San Francisco Unicorns, owned by Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan, have a partnership with Cricket Victoria.

We saw games in New York and Lauderhill in the T20 World Cup, apart from Dallas. Will the MLC also be played in those grounds?

No. This year's MLC, like in 2023, will only be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina's Morrisville.

Last season, the first eight league games were played in Dallas and the next seven in Morrisville, before the tournament shifted back to Dallas for the knockout rounds. This year, however, both stadiums will host games throughout the season.

So you said Pooran played the last season. Who are some other big names that were there last season and will play this year as well?

A total of 23 overseas players who turned out in the inaugural season will be in action in MLC 2024 as well. Among them, some of the big names include Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, Heinrich Klaasen and Kieron Pollard.

Afghanistan's left-arm wristspinner Noor Ahmad will replace Daryl Mitchell - who has been ruled out by an injury and is currently doing rehab in New Zealand - for Texas Super Kings. You can find the full list of retained overseas players here.

And any exciting new additions this year?

Yes indeed. Pat Cummins, Travis Head and Steven Smith are some high-profile Australian signings, while Daryl Mitchell, Shakib Al Hasan and Romario Shepherd are some of the other new signings. You can see the full squads here.

USA pulled off a surprise and made it to the Super Eight stage of the T20 World Cup. So who will their local heroes line up for?

USA did have an impressive showing at the T20 World Cup, with a Super Over win over Pakistan the highlight. Their captain Monank Patel, Noshthush Kenjige and Shayan Jahangir will be representing defending champions MI New York, while last year's runners-up Seattle Orcas have USA vice-captain Aaron Jones and Harmeet Singh in their ranks.

Milind Kumar, who took a blinder against Pakistan as a substitute fielder, will play for Texas Super Kings, while Andries Gous and Saurabh Netravalkar will play for Washington Freedom.

All this sounds good. So, what is the format of the league?

Like most franchise leagues, the MLC will first have a round-robin league stage. Last year, each team played the other once, but this time every team will play seven matches each in the league stage. This has contributed to the tournament growing from 19 games last year to 25 this season.

The top two teams will meet in the Qualifier, with the winners of that match advancing to the final.

The third and fourth-placed teams will meet in the Eliminator. The winner of the Eliminator will face the team that loses the Qualifier in the Challenger, where the second finalist will be decided.

You can see the full fixture list here.

But the MLC games don't count as official T20s, right?

That was the case last year, but the tournament has been given List A status by the ICC. It has become the second Associate-run franchise competition to acquire List A status from the ICC, following the UAE's ILT20 earlier this year.

This means MLC will now be recognised as an official T20 league, with tournament playing records now counted as official format statistics.

And with the packed cricket schedule, is it not clashing with any of the several other T20 leagues around the world?

The Lanka Premier League is on till July 21, so Matheesha Pathirana will remain unavailable till Colombo Strikers are knocked out.

There will also be a six-day clash with the Hundred , which means that 12 players who are part of the MLC could arrive late at the UK.

Abhimanyu Bose is a sub-editor with ESPNcricinfo
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* The second season of MLC starts on July 5 and ends on July 28, with a total of 25 matches.
* The tournament will be played at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

**Teams**

* There are six teams participating: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
* IPL franchises own four teams in the MLC, while Seattle Orcas are owned by the GMR Group, and Washington Freedom have Cricket New South Wales as their high-performance partner.

**Big Names**

* 23 overseas players who played in the inaugural season will return, including Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, Heinrich Klaasen, and Kieron Pollard.
* New signings include Pat Cummins, Travis Head, Steven Smith, Daryl Mitchell, Shakib Al Hasan, and Romario Shepherd.

**Local Heroes**

* USA cricketers who will participate in the tournament include Monank Patel, Noshthush Kenjige, Shayan Jahangir, Aaron Jones, Harmeet Singh, Milind Kumar, Andries Gous, and Saurabh Netravalkar.

**Format**

* The tournament will follow a round-robin league stage, where each team will play seven matches.
* The top two teams will meet in the Qualifier, with the winners advancing to the final.
* The third and fourth-placed teams will meet in the Eliminator, with the winner facing the team that loses the Qualifier in the Challenger.

**Official Status**

* MLC has been given List A status by the ICC, making it an official T20 league.
* Tournament playing records will now be counted as official format statistics.

**Scheduling Conflicts**

* There will be a clash with the Lanka Premier League, which ends on July 21, and the Hundred, which means 12 players may arrive late in the UK.

title: Major League Cricket Live Streaming: When & How To Watch MLC 2024 in India, Pakistan & Rest of the World?
body:
oi-Mark Hoover

The second season of the Major League Cricket - MLC 2024 is scheduled to get underway with the league phase from Friday (July 5) as six teams look to battle it out across 23 days in two venues for the title.

The six teams - MI New York, LA Knight Riders, Texas Super Kings, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom - return to face off in 21-matches round-robin format to decide the playoff qualifying spots.

The top four head into the MLC playoffs, which will feature the Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger and then the final. The league phase ends on July 23 and the playoff action starts the very next day on July 24 with the final set to take place on July 28.

A total of 25 matches will be played across two venues - Church Street Park in Morrisville and Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. While the first 15 matches will be split between the two venues, the final six round robin matches and the playoffs will be held in Dallas, Texas.

As the season approaches closer, here is a look at the full schedule with start times and dates as well as the broadcast details - telecast & live streaming info for MLC 2024 in India, Pakistan & rest of the world:

When is MLC 2024 starting and ending?

The second season of Major League Cricket will start on July 5 and end with the final on July 28. Due to time difference, the event starts on July 6 and ends on July 29 in the Asian continent, including India and Pakistan.

What time do MLC 2024 matches start?

There are three different start times with the earliest start being 3 PM Local Time (7 PM GMT / 12 AM PKT & 12:30 AM IST), followed by a second start time of 3:30 PM Local Time (7:30 PM GMT / 12:30 AM PKT & 1 AM IST).

The third start time is a night match, which starts at 7:30 PM Local Time (12:30 AM GMT / 5:30 AM PKT & 6 AM IST on the next day due to time difference). Most matches start at 7:30 PM Local Time.

Where and how to watch MLC 2024 in India, Pakistan & Rest of the World?

In India, the Major League Cricket season 2 broadcast will be available on Sony Sports Network via Sony Sports TEN 1 channels, while MLC 2024 live streaming will be available on JioCinema. In Pakistan, the tournament will be telecast live on A Sports. Here is the broadcast list:

MLC 2024 Broadcast List

India: Sony Sports TEN 1 & JioCinema

Pakistan: A Sports

Australia & New Zealand: Amazon Prime

USA & Canada: Willow by CricBuzz

Middle East & North Africa (MENA): CricBuzz

South Africa & Sub-Saharan Africa: ESPN

United Kingdom & Ireland: TNT Sports
