title: MLC 2024: Everything you need to know about USA’s franchise T20 league | Major League Cricket, 2024
body:
What is MLC?

Major League Cricket (MLC) is a T20 franchise tournament played in the United States of America (USA), consisting of six teams. The 2024 edition will be the second season of the tournament – first since the US co-hosted the T20 World Cup 2024.

What is the duration of the tournament?

MLC 2024 will get underway from July 5 onwards (July 6 in India) and will go on till July 28 (29 in India). Just like the first season, all 25 matches will be shared between Morrisville and Dallas. The playoffs and the final will be played in Dallas. You can check out the full schedule here

What is the format of the tournament?

Teams will play each other twice in the group stage, and the top four sides will progress to the playoffs. The No. 1 and 2 placed sides will face each other in the Qualifier, and the winner of that game will make it through to the final. The Eliminator will feature the third-placed team taking on the fourth, with the winner progressing to the Challenger, where they will face the losing team from the Qualifier.

The winner of the Challenger will then take on the winner of the Qualifier in the final.

Who won the previous edition?

MI New York rode on a superb 137* (55) by their stand-in skipper Nicholas Pooran to beat Seattle Orcas by seven wickets in the final to lift the trophy at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

Who are the captains and coaches of teams in MLC 2024?

A couple of changes from last year. Corey Anderson will lead San Francisco Unicorns, taking over from the retired Aaron Finch. Steven Smith has been named the captain of Washington Freedom, with Moises Henriques making way. Head coaches have also been rejigged, with Ricky Ponting taking over as the Washington head coach.

Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) – Captain: Sunil Narine, Head coach: Phil Simmons

MI New York (MINY) – Captain: Kieron Pollard, Head coach: Robin Peterson

San Fransisco Unicorns (SFU) – Captain: Corey Anderson, Head coach: Shane Watson

Seattle Orcas (SO) – Captain: Wayne Parnell, Head coach: Pravin Amre

Texas Super Kings (TSK) – Captain: Faf du Plessis, Head coach: Stephen Fleming

Washington Freedom (WF) – Captain: Steven Smith, Head coach: Ricky Ponting

How many players can each team have?

All teams need a minimum of 16 players, but the number cannot exceed 19. No team can have more than nine overseas players.

Who are the overseas players retained from the previous edition?

Los Angeles: Spencer Johnson, Sunil Narine, Jason Roy, Andre Russell, Adam Zampa

New York: Trent Boult, Dewald Brevis, Tim David, Rashid Khan, Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard, Kagiso Rabada

San Francisco: Finn Allen, Haris Rauf

Seattle: Heinrich Klaasen, Quinton de Kock, Wayne Parnell, Imad Wasim

Texas: Devon Conway, Faf du Plessis, Mitchell Santner

Washington: Akeal Hosein, Marco Jansen

Tell me a bit about the local players – who among US’ T20 World Cup squad will feature in the tournament?

Thirteen of the US’ 15-member squad for the T20 World Cup 2024 will take part in MLC 2024. Here’s the full list:

Los Angeles: Ali Khan, Nitish Kumar, Shadley van Schalkwyk

New York: Steven Taylor, Nostush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Shayan Jahangir

San Francisco: Corey Anderson

Seattle: Harmeet Singh, Aaron Jones

Texas: Milind Kumar

Washington: Andries Gous, Saurabh Netravalkar

You can check out the entire squad of each team here

Who are some of the top new additions in MLC 2024?

ODI World Cup-winning captain Pat Cummins will turn up for San Francisco Unicorns, along with Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Steven Smith and Jake Fraser-Mcgurk. All-rounder Marcus Stoinis will play for Texas Super Kings with Aiden Markram, Naveen ul Haq and Aaron Hardie, among others will feature for them for the first time this season.

Moreover, New Zealand’s Daryl Mitchell will miss the tournament due to an injury and Afghanistan spinner Noor Ahmad will take his place for TSK.

Will all the matches be counted as official T20s?

Yes. On May 28, the ICC granted MLC a List A status, which implies that all the matches played in the tournament will be counted as official T20s, unlike the first season. MLC is only the second T20 league hosted by an associate to get this honour after UAE’s International T20 (ILT20).

Where can I watch MLC in India?

Indian viewers can watch every ball on Jio Cinema. Unfortunately, the tournament will not be telecast on any TV channel.
summary:
**Introduction**: MLC is a T20 franchise tournament played in the United States of America, consisting of six teams.

**Duration**: The 2024 edition of MLC will take place from July 5 to July 28, with all 25 matches being played in Morrisville and Dallas.

**Format**: Teams will play each other twice in the group stage, and the top four teams will progress to the playoffs. The winner of the Challenger will face the winner of the Qualifier in the final.

**Previous Edition**: MI New York won the previous edition, beating Seattle Orcas by seven wickets in the final.

**Teams and Captains/Coaches**:

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Captain - Sunil Narine, Head Coach - Phil Simmons
* MI New York: Captain - Kieron Pollard, Head Coach - Robin Peterson
* San Francisco Unicorns: Captain - Corey Anderson, Head Coach - Shane Watson
* Seattle Orcas: Captain - Wayne Parnell, Head Coach - Pravin Amre
* Texas Super Kings: Captain - Faf du Plessis, Head Coach - Stephen Fleming
* Washington Freedom: Captain - Steven Smith, Head Coach - Ricky Ponting

**Team Composition**: Each team can have a minimum of 16 players and a maximum of 19, with no more than nine overseas players.

**Overseas Players Retained**: The article lists the overseas players retained by each team from the previous edition.

**Local Players**: Thirteen of the US' 15-member squad for the T20 World Cup 2024 will participate in MLC 2024.

**New Additions**: Notable new additions to MLC 2024 include Pat Cummins, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Steven Smith, and Jake Fraser-Mcgurk.

**Official T20 Status**: All matches played in MLC 2024 will be counted as official T20s, thanks to the ICC granting List A status to the tournament.

**Broadcast**: Indian viewers can watch MLC 2024 on Jio Cinema, but it will not be telecast on any TV channel.

title: Sony Sports Network acquires exclusive television rights for Major League Cricket 2024 in India
body:
Culver Max Entertainment Private Limited, owner of Sony Sports Network, announces the acquisition of exclusive television rights for T20 cricket league Major League Cricket (MLC) in India for one year. The second edition begins with MI New York facing Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park, Morrisville, live telecast in India on July 6, 2024. The league’s final will be at Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas, live in India on July 29, 2024.

MLC has gained attention from India’s cricket enthusiasts, featuring teams like Mumbai Indians, Kolkata Knight Riders, and Chennai Super Kings. Key players expected include Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, and Nicholas Pooran.

The broadcast team includes Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Danny Morrison, Daren Ganga, Pommie Mbangwa, Matthew Hayden, Chris Morris, Natalie Germanos, Scott Styris, and Mike Haysmen.

In the first season, MI New York won the championship against Seattle Orcas at Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas. Nicholas Pooran, top scorer for the champions, was Player of the Season with 388 runs.

Sony Sports Network aims to strengthen its cricket broadcasting with MLC rights, adding to its portfolio covering New Zealand Cricket, England Cricket Board, Sri Lanka Cricket, and India’s T20I series against Zimbabwe.

* The final will take place on July 29, 2024, at Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.
* The tournament has gained popularity in India, featuring teams like Mumbai Indians, Kolkata Knight Riders, and Chennai Super Kings.

**Key Players:**

* Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, and Nicholas Pooran are some of the key players expected to participate.

**Broadcast Team:**

* The broadcast team includes renowned cricket experts like Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Danny Morrison, and others.

**Previous Season:**

* In the first season, MI New York won the championship against Seattle Orcas, with Nicholas Pooran being the top scorer and Player of the Season with 388 runs.

**Broadcast Rights:**

* Sony Sports Network has acquired the exclusive television rights for MLC in India for one year, strengthening its cricket broadcasting portfolio.

title: 2024 COGNIZANT MAJOR LEAGUE SEASON INDIA BROADCASTERS ANNOUNCED
body:
Sony Sports Network is India's official television broadcast partner, and JioCinema is the exclusive streaming partner for the 2024 of the Major League Cricket.

RICHMOND, VIC, AUSTRALIA, July 5, 2024 /EINPresswire.com/ -- Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC), America’s T20 league, has announced its remaining broadcasting partners for its 2024 season. Sony Sports Network is MLC’s official television broadcast partner in India, and JioCinema will be MLC’s exclusive digital streaming partner in India for the upcoming season.

Sony Sports Network will leverage its extensive network and state-of-the-art technology to deliver live television coverage of MLC matches, ensuring fans in India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and Nepal can enjoy every moment of the action from the comfort of their homes. Meanwhile, JioCinema, renowned for its robust digital infrastructure and wide-reaching platform, will provide seamless digital streaming services, making MLC matches accessible to viewers in India on various devices anytime, anywhere.

In addition, MLC has confirmed that ESPN will broadcast MLC throughout the Caribbean. MLC has also added more regional sports networks to broaden its reach across the US, with Monumental Sports Network, Bally LA, Bally Dallas, and Root Sports Northwest joining the Willow by Cricbuzz and YES Network to bring MLC into American homes.

The opening match is on Friday, July 5th, with a Championship rematch between 2023 inaugural winners MI New York and the Seattle Orcas in Morrisville, NC. It will be followed by the Texas Super Kings vs. LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium, TX, later that evening.

The MLC’s second season features an all-star lineup of announcers, including the former captain of the Indian national cricket team and great batsman Sunil Gavaskar, Pakistani legendary bowler Wasim Akram, former New Zealand and Auckland cricketer Danny Morrison, alongside Daren Ganga, Pommie Mbangwa, Matthew Hayden, Chris Morris, Natalie Germanos, Scott Stylis, and Mike Haysmen.

Cognizant Major League Cricket’s broadcast partners are as follows:

India Television: Sony Sports Network

India Digital Streaming: JioCinema

Caribbean: ESPN

USA: Willow by Cricbuzz, YES Network, Monumental Sports Network, Bally LA, Bally Dallas, Root Sports Northwest

Canada: Willow by Cricbuzz

Australia and New Zealand: Prime Video

Middle East and North Africa: Cricbuzz

Pakistan: A Sports

Sub-Saharan Africa: ESPN

UK and Ireland: TNT Sports

Vijay Srinivasan, CEO of Cognizant Major League Cricket, said:

“These agreements mark a significant milestone for our league, ensuring our games reach fans everywhere. The Sony television broadcast deal and the extension of our JioCinema streaming deal from last year in India are monumental, reaching the passionate Indian audience and solidifying our presence in one of the world's largest markets.”

In addition to the world-class matches, fans have several ticket options to choose from, with general admission tickets starting at $30 per person. The season's excitement extends beyond the pitch, with entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings and meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the tournament.

Tickets for all matches, including the four playoffs, are available at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com

For more information about Major League Cricket and to view the full schedule for the 2024 season, visit www.majorleaguecricket.com
summary:
**Broadcasting Partners:**

* India: Sony Sports Network (TV) and JioCinema (exclusive digital streaming partner)
* Caribbean: ESPN
* USA: Willow by Cricbuzz, YES Network, Monumental Sports Network, Bally LA, Bally Dallas, Root Sports Northwest
* Canada: Willow by Cricbuzz
* Australia and New Zealand: Prime Video
* Middle East and North Africa: Cricbuzz
* Pakistan: A Sports
* Sub-Saharan Africa: ESPN
* UK and Ireland: TNT Sports

**Tournament Details:**

* The 2024 MLC season starts on July 5th with a championship rematch between MI New York and the Seattle Orcas.
* The season will feature an all-star lineup of announcers, including Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, and Matthew Hayden, among others.
* Tickets are available, with general admission starting at $30 per person.
* The tournament will include entertainment, fireworks, and other activities beyond the cricket matches.

**Schedule and Tickets:**

* The full schedule for the 2024 season can be viewed on www.majorleaguecricket.com.
* Tickets for all matches, including playoffs, are available at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Get MLC schedule and watch live streaming in India
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 will start on Saturday, July 6 (as per Indian Standard Time) in the United States of America (USA).

Operated by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) and sanctioned by USA Cricket, MLC 2024 - the second edition of the tournament - will witness six teams competing for the title.

Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom are the six franchises that will feature in this T20 League.

Four of the six franchises have Indian T20 League team owners either in part of full ownership. MI New York won the inaugural edition of the tournament by defeating the Seattle Orcas by seven wickets in the final.

As per the schedule released by the organisers, a total of 25 matches will be played, including the playoffs.

Each team will play seven league games. The top four teams will qualify for the MLC 2024 playoffs, which comprise the Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger and the Final.

The playoff system scheduled at Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas, begins with the Eliminator where the third-placed team will face off against the fourth.

The winner advances to the Challenger match where they will meet the loser of the Qualifier match.

The Qualifier features the first-placed team against the second team in the standings to determine direct entry to the final.

All 25 matches are scheduled to be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and North Carolina’s Church Street Park.

The MLC 2024 final will be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium on Monday, July 29 (as per IST).

Major League Cricket has become the second associate-run franchise competition to acquire List A status from the ICC, following on from the UAE's ILT20 earlier this year.

MLC is currently a six-team tournament but has the intention to grow into 10 sides in the future. MLC plans to expand from the current six teams to 10 over the next few years, jumping from 19 games in 2023 to 34 by 2025.

As many as 25 games have already been scheduled for this season. Each team is required to have between 16 and 19 players in their squad, featuring at least nine domestic players and no more than 10.

Additionally, each squad must include at least one U23 player. Teams are permitted a maximum of nine international players.

However, matchday XIs can field a maximum of six overseas players and a minimum of five domestic players.

The upcoming MLC campaign promises to captivate with big international stars now a part of the league.

Australian captain Pat Cummins has signed a four-year contract with San Francisco Unicorns, becoming one of the highest-profile players on the roster of a Major League Cricket (MLC) franchise.

Cummins is joined by hard-hitting Australian batter Jake Fraser-McGurk in the San Francisco Unicorns squad.

Meanwhile, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and Steven Smith are among other high-profile Australian players signed by the Washington Freedom. Rachin Ravindra is also a part of the Washington Freedom squad.

Other notable MLC signings for 2024 include Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan and South Africa's David Miller with Los Angeles Knight Riders, while South Africa's Anrich Nortje and West Indies' Romario Shepherd are with MI New York.

South Africa's Aiden Markram and New Zealand's Daryl Mitchell will represent Texas Super Kings, and the Proteas’ Nandre Burger and West Indies' Obed McCoy will play for Seattle Orcas.

Where to watch Major League Cricket 2024 live in India

Broadcast details of MLC 2024 matches in India are yet to be announced.

Live streaming of MLC 2024 matches will be available on the JioCinema app and website in India.

summary:
**Schedule and Format:**

* The tournament will start on July 6, 2024, and will feature six teams playing 25 matches, including playoffs.
* Each team will play seven league games, and the top four teams will qualify for the playoffs.
* The playoffs will consist of the Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger, and Final matches.
* All matches will be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and North Carolina's Church Street Park.

**Teams and Players:**

* The six participating teams are Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom.
* Four of the six franchises have Indian T20 League team owners either in part or full ownership.
* Notable international players participating in the tournament include Pat Cummins, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, Steven Smith, Shakib Al Hasan, and David Miller.

**Broadcasting:**

* The broadcasting details for MLC 2024 matches in India are yet to be announced.
* Live streaming of MLC 2024 matches will be available on the JioCinema app and website in India.

**Future Plans:**

* MLC has acquired List A status from the ICC, making it the second associate-run franchise competition to do so.
* The league plans to expand from six teams to 10 teams in the future, with the aim of increasing the number of games from 25 to 34 by 2025.

title: Sony Sports Network acquires television rights for Major League Cricket 2024 in India
body:
Culver Max Entertainment, who owns and operates Sony Sports Network, the sports broadcaster in India, announces the acquisition of exclusive television rights for T20 cricket spectacle Major League Cricket (MLC) for one year in India. The second edition of the league will kickstart with reigning champions MI New York facing Seattle Orcas in the opener at Church Street Park, Morrisville and will be live telecast in India 6th July 2024. The grand finale of the tournament will be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and will be live telecast in India on 29th July 2024.

A major share from the ongoing cricket revolution in the United States can be attributed to MLC, which has attracted eyeballs of India’s evergreen cricket fraternity. The participation from Indian cricket franchises Mumbai Indians, Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings brings a whole new level of excitement for fans of the respective teams. Some of the most popular cricketers including Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran are expected to feature in the upcoming edition of the league.
summary:
**Tournament Details:**

* The second edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to start on July 6, 2024, with the opening match between MI New York and Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park, Morrisville.
* The grand finale will take place on July 29, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Broadcasting Rights:**

* Culver Max Entertainment, owner of Sony Sports Network, has acquired the exclusive television rights for MLC in India for one year.

**Participating Teams and Players:**

* Indian cricket franchises Mumbai Indians, Kolkata Knight Riders, and Chennai Super Kings are participating in the league.
* Popular cricketers such as Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, and Nicholas Pooran are expected to feature in the upcoming edition of the league.

title: MLC 2024 Commentators List: Who is Doing Commentary in Major League Cricket Season 2?
body:
oi-Mark Hoover

Major League Cricket (MLC), America's own T20 league, will kick start it's second season following on from a successful first season with an all-star commentary panel set to call the game from July 5.

The opening match is on Friday, July 5th, with a Championship rematch between 2023 inaugural winners MI New York and the Seattle Orcas in Morrisville, NC. It will be followed by the Texas Super Kings vs. LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium, TX, later that evening.

MLC's second season features an all-star lineup of announcers, including some of the very familiar voices in the sport from across the world doing commentary over the next two weeks in Dallas and Morrisville.

The star-studded commentary panel includes legendary names as well as some of yesteryear stars who turned to the profession in recent years following their retirement from the sport. The broadcast of the Major League Cricket will be spread across the world this year.

Major League Cricket Live Streaming: When & How To Watch MLC 2024 in India, Pakistan & Rest of the World?

While Willow by CricBuzz will take care of coverage in the United States and Canada, MLC has also confirmed this season's international broadcast schedule for India, Pakistan, Australia, New Zealand, the Middle East, Africa, the United Kingdom, and Ireland.

Who is doing commentary in Major League Cricket Season 2?

The announcers list for MLC includes, the former captain of the Indian national cricket team and great batsman Sunil Gavaskar, Pakistani legendary bowler Wasim Akram, former New Zealand and Auckland cricketer Danny Morrison, and Australian commentator Mike Haysman.

The English commentary panel will also feature former West Indies star Daren Ganga, Zimbabwe pacer Pommie Mbangwa, Australian opener Matthew Hayden, South African all-rounder Chris Morris, New Zealand all rounder Scott Styris and former women's cricketer Natalie Germanos.

MLC 2024 Squads: Players List & Captains of All Six Teams For Major League Cricket Season 2

In addition to the on-air team, MLC also has on board emerging broadcasters Nikhil Uttamchandani, Aaman Patel, and Andrew Leonard (associate cricket expert), who will announce matches throughout the season as part of MLC's commitment to supporting the development of cricket talent in the United States.

**Commentary Panel**

* The commentary panel includes legendary cricketers such as Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Matthew Hayden, and Chris Morris, among others.

**Broadcast Schedule**

* The broadcast of MLC will be spread across the world, with Willow by CricBuzz covering the United States and Canada.
* International broadcast partners have been confirmed for India, Pakistan, Australia, New Zealand, the Middle East, Africa, the United Kingdom, and Ireland.

title: Nicholas Pooran propels MI New York to season-opening 6-wicket victory over Seattle Orcas
body:
Cognizant Major League Cricket Game 1 Highlights, Seattle Orcas vs. MI New York

© MLC Network

The 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket season kicked off on Friday with MI New York starting their defense in impressive fashion, securing a commanding six-wicket victory over the Seattle Orcas.

Match Summary

MI New York 111/4 (14.2 ov) MI New York 111/4 (14.2 ov)

Seattle Orcas 108/10 (19.1 ov)

MI New York won by 6 wickets Seattle Orcas 108/10 (19.1 ov)

MI New York won by 6 wickets

SCORECARD

All eyes were on Nicholas Pooran at Church Street Park in Morrisville as the West Indian wicketkeeper-batter continued his form from the 2023 edition. His unbeaten 62 off just 37 balls helped MI New York chase down the total of 109 runs in just 14.2 overs.

With the early wickets of Ruben Clinton (6) and USA’s national team skipper Monank Patel (8), the initial momentum seemed to be in the Seattle Orcas’ favour. Cameron Gannon was the main bowling aggressor, getting both batters in the third over and giving his team a ray of hope.

But then, Pooran proceeded to hit Gannon for 2 sixes and as many fours in his next over. This turned the tide in MI New York’s favour.

Eventually, Pooran’s power-hitting abilities proved to be too much for the Seattle Orcas. They got the wickets of Shayan Jahangir (3) and Tim David (12) as well, but the left-handed Pooran and his countryman Kieron Pollard (8*) took their team over the line for their first win of MLC 2024.

Earlier in the day, the skills of the MI New York bowlers were on display as they bowled out the Seattle Orcas for just 108 runs. Rashid Khan and Trent Boult bagged three wickets each, never really allowing their opponents to settle into the match.

New Zealand’s star pacer Boult got the early breakthrough in the opening over itself, sending Nauman Anwar back to the pavilion for a duck. The Pakistan batter’s late attempt to cut the ball away caught a faint edge which travelled to the wicketkeeper and eventual match-winner Nicholas Pooran.

With Quinton de Kock (5) still in the crease, the Seattle Orcas could hit a competitive score, but he was also gone in Boult’s next over. His attempt to hit the ball through the leg side was met with a top edge, and Pooran did well to get underneath it and send de Kock back to the pavilion.

From then on, MI New York were in the driving seat, getting the regular wickets. For the Seattle Orcas, Shubham Ranjane ended as the highest run-getter with a tidy innings of 35 runs in 31 balls. Finding the boundary regularly, Ranjane proved to be a threat before he tried to hit Rashid Khan for consecutive sixes but fell short in his second attempt, hitting the ball to Tim David instead.

Harmeet Singh, who recently featured for the USA in the T20 World Cup, played a 20-run cameo as the side set a target that was eventually chased down by the defending champions with 34 balls to spare.

**Match Result:** MI New York won by 6 wickets against Seattle Orcas in the opening match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket season.

**Score:** Seattle Orcas 108/10 (19.1 ov), MI New York 111/4 (14.2 ov)

**Key Performances:** Nicholas Pooran (MI New York) scored an unbeaten 62 off 37 balls, while Rashid Khan and Trent Boult (both MI New York) took three wickets each.

**Match Summary:** Seattle Orcas struggled to score runs, with only Shubham Ranjane (35) and Harmeet Singh (20) making notable contributions. MI New York's bowlers, led by Boult and Khan, restricted the Orcas to 108 runs. In response, Pooran's power-hitting helped MI New York chase down the target in just 14.2 overs, losing four wickets in the process.

**Notable Mentions:** Cameron Gannon (Seattle Orcas) took two early wickets, but Pooran's hitting turned the tide in MI New York's favor. Kieron Pollard (MI New York) remained unbeaten on 8, supporting Pooran in the chase.

title: MLC 2024: When, where and how to watch MLC 2024 live streaming
body:
by Cricbuzz Staff • Last updated on

Major League Cricket 2024 will kick off on July 5 © MLC

The second edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) kicks off on July 5, 2024. Defending champions MI New York face off against last year's runners up Seattle Orcas in the MLC 2024 opener at Church Street Park in Morrisville. Our users based in North America can watch all the action of MLC cricket unfold on Willow by Cricbuzz! And not just the opening game, but the entire coverage for all the 25 MLC 2024 matches, including the final.

Viewers can make use of the special free-to-view broadcasts on Sunday nights on www.willow.tv, www.cricbuzz.com, the Cricbuzz app, and the Willow app. Not only that, Willow by Cricbuzz has partnered with several regional sports networks to cater to the local markets. The Partnered Regional Sports Networks include: Monumental Sports Network (Washington Freedom), YES Network (MI New York), ROOT SPORTS (Seattle Orcas), Bally Sports Southwest (Texas Super Kings), Bally Sports SoCal (LA Knight Riders).

When is MLC 2024 scheduled to take place?

MLC 2024 begins on July 5 and will run for 23 days, with the final to take place on July 28. There are six teams - MI New York, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Texas Super Kings, Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas - who will face off against each other. This will be followed by the playoffs stage.

What's the playoffs stage and how does one get there?

After the six teams are done with the first round of matches, the top four teams will qualify for the playoffs stage. The top two teams will compete in the Qualifier on July 25, with the winner gaining an entry into the final and the losing side going into the Challenger match. The teams placed third and fourth will face off in the Eliminator on July 24, with the winner progressing to the Challenger match. The winner of the Challenger match will become the second team to qualify for the final.

Here's where to watch MLC 2024 on Willow by Cricbuzz in North America.

Which are the venues hosting MLC 2024?

The Church Street Park in Morrisville will host the nine matches while the remaining 16 matches, including the playoffs, will be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas.

Who are the star attractions in MLC 2024?

US cricket stars like Saurabh Netravalkar, Aaron Jones, Andries Gous, Monank Patel, Ali Khan, Harmeet Singh and Corey Anderson, among others, will be the star attractions among the local players. There will be additional interest in MLC 2024, not only in the US but also in other countries around the world, considering USA's recent exploits in the T20 World Cup in which the co-hosts made it to the Super 8s stage, having pulled off a stunning super over victory against Pakistan early in the competition.

Several renowned overseas players are set to feature in MLC 2024. West Indian stars include Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard and Dwayne Bravo. There is plenty of South African presence - Faf du Plessis, Heinrich Klaasen, Kagiso Rabada, Quinton de Kock, Anrich Nortje, etc. New Zealand players like Rachin Ravindra, Devon Conway, Trent Boult and Lockie Ferguson are also part of the league along with Pakistan players like Haris Rauf and Shadab Khan. Afghanistan stars Rashid Khan and Naveen-ul-Haq, who led their country into the T20 World Cup semis, are also part of the league while the major attraction this time will be the Australian players, including the 2023 World Cup winning captain Pat Cummins, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head and Steve Smith.

Tune in to Willow by Cricbuzz to ensure you don't miss any of the MLC 2024 action.

title: Los Angeles Knight Riders triumph over Texas Super Kings in thrilling 12-run victory
body:
Cognizant Major League Cricket Game 2 Highlights, Texas Super Kings vs. LA Knight Riders

© MLC Network

Los Angeles Knight Riders put up a brilliant show to take down the Texas Super Kings by 12 runs in the second match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, on the opening night of the season.

Match Summary

Texas Super Kings 150/8 (20 ov)

Los Angeles Knight Riders 162/7 (20 ov)

Los Angeles Knight Riders won by 12 runs.

SCORECARD

Unmukt Chand's brilliant 68 off 45 balls powered the LA Knight Riders to a total of 162/7 in their allotted 20 overs. Ali Khan then delivered a match-winning performance, taking four wickets for 33 runs, to restrict the Texas Super Kings to 150/8, clinching the win by 12 runs.

On what turned out to be a challenging batting wicket, the Texas Super Kings began their chase of 163 runs cautiously. Skipper Faf du Plessis (14 off 14), who attempted to accelerate the run rate, was dismissed by Spencer Johnson in the fifth over. Trying his signature scoop, he mistimed the shot and was caught by Derone Davis at mid-wicket. Aaron Hardie (11 off 14) was then sent packing by Shakib Al Hasan in the ninth over.

Opener Devon Conway kept the scoreboard ticking, steadily taking the Super Kings closer to the target with timely boundaries. However, Ali Khan turned things around for the LA Knight Riders by taking three wickets in the 14th over. He bowled Conway, hitting the off-stump, then dismissed Joshua Tromp (18 off 14), who was by Derone Davis with a stunning catch, as the ball was flying off the edge to third man. The subsequent delivery saw Milind Kumar (0 off 1) caught at slip by Andre Russell. Marcus Stoinis (2 off 6) fell in the following over, scoring just two off six balls, leaving the Super Kings reeling from 100/2 to 107/6 after 15 overs.

However, Calvin Savage took matters into his hands and kept the Super Kings in the game with a flurry of boundaries and sixes. He along with Naveen-ul-Haq smashed 17 runs off Ali Khan in the 18th over to take the equation down to 27 runs from 12 balls. Russell and Khan then bowled exceptional final two overs to close out the game for LA Knight Riders.

Earlier in the contest, Texas Super Kings won the toss and opted to bowl first. Zia-ul-Haq shook the LA Knight Riders' lineup, dismissing both openers, Jason Roy (2 off 11) and Sunil Narine (2 off 3), in the third over, leaving the Knight Riders struggling at 10/2 after three overs.

Unmukt Chand and Shakib Al Hasan attempted to steady the innings, but the latter fell to Aaron Hardie in the seventh over, having scored 18 off 13 balls. Nitish Kumar then added 26 runs off 17 deliveries before being dismissed in the 11th over, with the score at 78/4.

Despite the rapid fall of wickets, including those of impactful players like David Miller (4 off 9) and Andre Russell (10 off 5), Chand kept one end intact. He played a magnificent knock of 68 runs from 45 balls, laced with six boundaries and three sixes, to anchor the Knight Riders' innings. He got out in the last over, but Corne Dry's onslaught of three fours off Marcus Stoinis powered the LA Knight Riders to a respectable total of 162/7 in 20 overs

**Match Result:** Los Angeles Knight Riders won by 12 runs against Texas Super Kings in the second match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**Scorecard:**

* Texas Super Kings: 150/8 (20 ov)

**Match Summary:**

The match was played on July 6, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. Texas Super Kings won the toss and opted to bowl first. Los Angeles Knight Riders struggled early on, losing two wickets in the third over. However, Unmukt Chand's brilliant 68 off 45 balls helped the Knight Riders post a total of 162/7 in 20 overs. In response, the Texas Super Kings began cautiously, but lost wickets regularly, with Ali Khan taking four wickets to restrict them to 150/8, resulting in a 12-run win for the LA Knight Riders.

title: MLC 2024: Unmukt Chand stars for LA Knight Riders, MI New York begin campaign with win
body:
The Major League Cricket 2024 season commenced on Friday with MI New York beginning their title defense with a commanding six-wicket win over the Seattle Orcas. All eyes were on Nicholas Pooran at Church Street Park in Morrisville as the West Indian wicketkeeper-batter continued his form from the 2023 edition. His unbeaten 62 off just 37 balls helped MI New York chase down 109 in just 14.2 overs. With the early wickets of Ruben Clinton (6) and USA’s national team skipper Monank Patel (8), the initial momentum seemed to be in the Seattle Orcas’ favor. Cameron Gannon was the main bowling aggressor, dismissing both batters in the third over and giving his team a ray of hope.

But then, Pooran proceeded to hit Gannon for two sixes and as many fours in his next over, turning the tide in MI New York’s favor. Eventually, Pooran’s power-hitting abilities proved to be too much for the Seattle Orcas. They got the wickets of Shayan Jahangir (3) and Tim David (12) as well, but the left-handed Pooran and his countryman Kieron Pollard (8*) took their team over the line for their first win of MLC 2024. Earlier in the day, the skills of the MI New York bowlers were on display as they bowled out the Seattle Orcas for just 108 runs. Rashid Khan and Trent Boult bagged three wickets each, never really allowing their opponents to settle into the match.

New Zealand’s star pacer Boult got the early breakthrough in the opening over itself, sending Nauman Anwar back to the pavilion for a duck. The Pakistan batter’s late attempt to cut the ball away caught a faint edge which traveled to the wicketkeeper and eventual match-winner, Nicholas Pooran. With Quinton de Kock (5) still in the crease, the Seattle Orcas could still hit a competitive score, but he was also gone in Boult’s next over. His attempt to hit the ball through the leg side was met with a top edge, and Pooran did well to get underneath it and send de Kock back to the pavilion.

From then on, MI New York were in the driving seat, getting regular wickets. For the Seattle Orcas, Shubham Ranjane ended as the highest run-getter with a tidy innings of 35 runs in 31 balls. Finding the boundary regularly, Ranjane proved to be a threat before he tried to hit Rashid Khan for consecutive sixes but fell short in his second attempt, hitting the ball to Tim David instead. Harmeet Singh, who recently featured for the USA in the T20 World Cup, played a 20-run cameo as the side set a target that was eventually chased down by the defending champions with 34 balls to spare.

UNMUKT CHAND STARS FOR LA KNIGHT RIDERS

In the second match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket, Los Angeles Knight Riders put up a brilliant show to take down the Texas Super Kings by 12 runs at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, on the opening night of the season. Unmukt Chand's brilliant 68 off 45 balls powered the LA Knight Riders to a total of 162/7 in their allotted 20 overs. Ali Khan then delivered a match-winning performance, taking four wickets for 33 runs, to restrict the Texas Super Kings to 150/8, clinching the win by 12 runs.

On what turned out to be a challenging batting wicket, the Texas Super Kings began their chase of 163 runs cautiously. Skipper Faf du Plessis (14 off 14), who attempted to accelerate the run rate, was dismissed by Spencer Johnson in the fifth over. Trying his signature scoop, he mistimed the shot and was caught by Derone Davis at mid-wicket. Aaron Hardie (11 off 14) was then sent packing by Shakib Al Hasan in the ninth over.

Opener Devon Conway kept the scoreboard ticking, steadily taking the Super Kings closer to the target with timely boundaries. However, Ali Khan turned things around for the LA Knight Riders by taking three wickets in the 14th over. He bowled Conway, hitting the off-stump, then dismissed Joshua Tromp (18 off 14), who was caught by Derone Davis with a stunning catch, as the ball was flying off the edge to third man. The subsequent delivery saw Milind Kumar (0 off 1) caught at slip by Andre Russell. Marcus Stoinis (2 off 6) fell in the following over, scoring just two off six balls, leaving the Super Kings reeling from 100/2 to 107/6 after 15 overs.

However, Calvin Savage took matters into his own hands and kept the Super Kings in the game with a flurry of boundaries and sixes. He, along with Naveen-ul-Haq, smashed 17 runs off Ali Khan in the 18th over to take the equation down to 27 runs from 12 balls. Russell and Khan then bowled exceptional final two overs to close out the game for LA Knight Riders.
summary:
**MI New York vs Seattle Orcas:**

* MI New York won by 6 wickets, defending their title in the opening match of the 2024 season.
* Nicholas Pooran scored an unbeaten 62 off 37 balls, helping MI New York chase down 109 in 14.2 overs.
* Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 108, with Rashid Khan and Trent Boult taking 3 wickets each.

**LA Knight Riders vs Texas Super Kings:**

* LA Knight Riders won by 12 runs in the second match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket.
* Unmukt Chand scored 68 off 45 balls, powering LA Knight Riders to 162/7 in their allotted 20 overs.
* Ali Khan took 4 wickets for 33 runs, restricting Texas Super Kings to 150/8 and clinching the win for LA Knight Riders.

title: Sony Sports Network gets exclusive television rights for MLC' 24 in India
body:
Culver Max Entertainment Private Limited, which owns and operates Sony Sports Network, one of the pioneering sports broadcasters in India, has announced the acquisition of exclusive television rights for T20 cricket spectacle Major League Cricket (MLC) for a tenure of one year in India. The second edition of the league will begin with reigning champions MI New York facing Seattle Orcas in the opener at Church Street Park, Morrisville and will be live telecast in India on July 6th, 2024. The grand finale of the tournament will be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and will be live telecast in India on 29th July 2024.

A major share from the ongoing cricket revolution in the United States can be attributed to MLC, which has attracted eyeballs of India’s evergreen cricket fraternity. The participation from Indian cricket franchises Mumbai Indians, Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings brings a whole new level of excitement for fans of the respective teams. Some of the most popular cricketers including Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran are expected to feature in the upcoming edition of the league.

The MLC’s second season features an all-star lineup of announcers, including the former captain of the Indian national cricket team and great batsman Sunil Gavaskar, Pakistani legendary bowler Wasim Akram, former New Zealand and Auckland cricketer Danny Morrison, alongside Daren Ganga, Pommie Mbangwa, Matthew Hayden, Chris Morris, Natalie Germanos, Scott Styris, and Mike Haysmen.

The inaugural edition of MLC attained critical success with six teams participating i.e. San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings, Seattle Orcas, Los Angeles Knight Riders and MI New York. Team MI New York was crowned champions after they defeated Seattle Orcas in the final played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. Nicholas Pooran, who featured for the champions, registered 388 runs and was adjudged the Player of the Season last year.

With the acquisition of television rights for Major League Cricket, Sony Sports Network has asserted its solid footprint in broadcasting cricket properties. The broadcaster’s cricket portfolio already boasts of rights for New Zealand Cricket, England Cricket Board, Sri Lanka Cricket & the recent addition of India Tour of Zimbabwe T20I series.

Watch Major League Cricket Season 2 from 6th July 2024, 1:00 AM IST onwards, LIVE on Sony Sports Ten 1 SD & HD & Sony Sports Ten 5 SD & HD channels.

*Live matches timings & channel destinations are subject to change.

For the latest updates from the world of sport, follow the Sony Sports Network on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

About Culver Max Entertainment Private Limited (formerly known as Sony Pictures Networks India):

Sony Pictures Networks India is the consumer-facing identity of Culver Max Entertainment Private Limited (the “Company”), which is an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation, Japan.

The Company has several channels including Sony Entertainment Television (SD HD), one of India's leading Hindi general entertainment television channels; Sony MAX, India's premium Hindi movies and special events channel; Sony MAX 2, another Hindi movie channel showcasing great India Cinema; Sony MAX HD, a high definition Hindi movie channel airing premium quality films; Sony WAH, the Hindi movies channel for rural markets; Sony SAB and Sony SAB HD the family-oriented Hindi comedy entertainment channels; Sony PAL, a genre leader in rural Hindi speaking markets (HSM) showcasing the best of Hindi general entertainment and Hindi movies from its content library; Sony PIX and Sony PIX HD, Sony BBC Earth and Sony BBC Earth HD, the premium factual entertainment channels, Sony AATH, the Bangla entertainment channel; Sony Yay!, the kids entertainment channel; Sony Sports Network – Sony Sports Ten 1, Sony Sports Ten 1 HD, Sony Sports Ten 2, Sony Sports Ten 2 HD, Sony Sports Ten 3, Sony Sports Ten 3 HD; Sony Sports Ten 4, Sony Sports Ten 4 HD; Sony Sports Ten 5; Sony Sports Ten 5 HD; Sony Marathi, the Marathi general entertainment channel; Sony LIV - the digital entertainment VOD platform and Studio NEXT the independent production venture for original content and IPs for TV and digital media. The Company reaches out to over 700 million viewers in India and is available in 167 countries.

The Company is recognised as an employer of choice within and outside the media industry. It is a recipient of several awards, including India’s Best Companies to Work For 2021 by the Great Place to Work® Institute, India, ‘Aon Best Employers India’ awards in recognition of the company’s unique workplace culture and exceptional people practices, consistently ranking amongst India’s Top 10 Companies with Best Health & Wellness Practices by SHRM & CGP Partners and listed by Working Mother & AVTAR as one of the 100 Best Companies for Women in India.

The Company is in its 28th year of operations in India. Besides having overseas subsidiaries, it has a subsidiary MSM-Worldwide Factual Media Private Limited, and an affiliate, Bangla Entertainment Private Limited in India.
summary:
**Acquisition of Television Rights:** Sony Sports Network has acquired the exclusive television rights for the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in India for a period of one year.

**Tournament Schedule:** The second edition of the MLC will start on July 6, 2024, with the reigning champions MI New York facing Seattle Orcas in the opening match. The grand finale will be played on July 29, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Participating Teams and Players:** The tournament will feature six teams, including MI New York, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings, and Los Angeles Knight Riders. Popular cricketers like Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, and Nicholas Pooran are expected to participate in the tournament.

**Broadcasting Details:** The tournament will be live telecast in India on Sony Sports Ten 1 SD & HD and Sony Sports Ten 5 SD & HD channels, starting from 1:00 AM IST on July 6, 2024.

**Commentary Team:** The tournament will feature an all-star lineup of announcers, including Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Danny Morrison, and others.

title: MLC 2024: All you need to know about the second season
body:
by Smit Patel • Last updated on

MI New York were the inaugural champions © MLC

Cricket in America again?

Yes. The new kid on the block in world cricket is back again albeit for a private bash this time. Major League Cricket (MLC) is returning for its second season, kicking off with a finale rematch from the inaugural season between MI New York and Seattle Orcas on July 5 at 2pm local time in Morrisville, North Carolina.

Errm, I am new to this MLC thing. American cricket only caught my attention after the World Cup. Who are the teams? How long will the tournament last?

MLC is currently a six-team tournament with an intention to grow into 10. The IPL teams like going global and they did not need an invite to invest in the biggest sports media market in the world. MI New York, Texas Super Kings and Los Angeles Knight Riders are the American offshoots of the respective IPL franchises. GMR, the part owners of Delhi Capitals also own some stake in the Seattle Orcas, co-owned by a consortium led by Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella. The Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns are owned by tech tycoon Sanjay Govil and a consortium led by Venky Harinarayan and Anand Rajaraman, founders of Junglee respectively. The MLC is a $120m startup with added investments of other Silicon Valley bigwigs.

Season 1 was a single round-robin followed by the knockouts. Season 2 will see 7 league games followed by the knockouts with the final on July 28 with games in Morrisville and Dallas.

Who all are playing? The tournament starts within a week's time of the World Cup final in Barbados. Surely, your A-list stars are putting their feet up somewhere after a gruelling IPL and world cup odyssey.

Who doesn't like coming to America for a quick round of bat and ball and endless amounts of golf! That's right, some of them hit more golf balls than cricket balls last year with a myriad of spectacular golf courses to choose from. And this is what Pat Cummins had to say after his signing with the Unicorns: "While cricket is integral to my involvement, the global network and long-term possibilities offered by the owners specifically, and Silicon Valley more broadly presented a unique opportunity for me and my life beyond cricket."

Seven members from the Australian T20 World Cup team headed stateside including Pat Cummins, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, Tim David and Marcus Stoinis. World cricket's newest sensation Jake Fraser-McGurk will turn up to live up to his hype in the IPL. Some of the South African World Cup contingent namely David Miller, Kagiso Rabada, Aiden Markram, Heinrich Klaasen and Anrich Nortje too will scamper to America after Hurricane Beryl disrupted travel schedules. Nicholas Pooran, Sunil Narine and Andre Russel will bring the Caribbean flavour. Trent Boult and Lockie Ferguson represent the cream of Kiwi talent in the competition.

What about the locals? Is Saurabh Netravalkar playing? Does he have enough leaves now?

Fortunately he does. And he will be back on the park for Washington Freedom. USA captain Monank Patel has recuperated from his dreaded shoulder injury and will turn out for MI New York. Steven Taylor, Nosthush Kenjige and Shayan Jahangir are the other USA players on MINY roster. Unmukt Chand was seen refining his wicketkeeping skills and will be buzzing to prove a point after his World Cup snub. Chand has been retained by LAKR along with Nitish Kumar and Ali Khan.

How's the crowd buzz with no Indian players in the offing?

Last year, Texas Super Kings played all of home night games in front of packed crowds and so did teams like LAKR and MINY. Super Kings fan made a spectacle out of any home game and things weren't that different at the Morrisville. By the end of the season, TSK ran out of whistles and teams like MINY ran short on merchandise despite playing at away venues in Dallas and Morrisville. The league has had a soaring fanbase right from its inception, cashing in on the already established support base of the IPL franchises among cricket watchers in America.

© Cricbuzz

title: Major League Cricket 2024 Schedule, Teams, India Telecast, Live Streaming In India, Squads, Venues, Broadcast in India
body:
Major League Cricket 2024 is all set to witness its second edition in July 2024. Major League Cricket is a franchise T20 tournament of the United States, which recently hosted the recent ICC T20 World Cup 2024.

A total of 6 teams are set to clash in Major League Cricket 2024. MI New York is the defending champion who won the title last year by defeating Seatle Orcas in the final by 7 wickets. Many IPL franchises also have their teams in MLC.

The opening match of Major League Cricket 2024 takes place on Friday, July 5 with the clash between last season's finalists MI New York and Seattle Orcas. The MI New York vs Seattle Orcas encounter will be played at Church Street Park, Morrisville.

On the same day, Texas Super Kings and Los Angeles Knight Riders will take on each other in the second match. The Major League Cricket final will be played on Sunday, July 28 at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. The match will take place on July 29 morning according to Indian Standard Time (IST).

A total of 25 games will take place between the six teams in Major League Cricket's second season. Below is all you need to know about the franchise tournament.

Major League Cricket 2024 Schedule

[Note: Due to about 20+ hours difference between US and India time, all the Major League Cricket 2024 matches will be telecast in India after one day. Hence, it is to be noted that the IST time for every match is for the next day i.e. after 12 AM midnight].

Major League Cricket 2024 Teams

There are six teams in Major League Cricket 2024. They are MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Washington Freedom, and San Francisco Unicorns. All these teams will undergo a rigorous battle for over three weeks for the MLC 2024 title.

Also Read: Watch: Unseen footage shows Rahul Dravid's emotional reaction after seeing Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli hugging each other

Major League Cricket 2024 Format

The MLC 2024 format is quite simple. All six teams will face each multiple during the tournament, playing a total of 7 games during the league stage. The top 4 teams in the points table after the league stage will enter the playoffs.

Just like IPL, the No.3 and No.4 will collide with each other in the Eliminator. The No.1 and No.2 will clash in the Qualifier. The winner of the Qualifier will book a berth in the Major Cricket League 2024 final.

The winner of the Eliminator and the loser of the Qualifier will wrestle in the Challenger match and the winner of the encounter will be the second finalist.

The last two teams in the points table after the league stage will not reach playoffs. Also, the loser of the Eliminator and the loser of the Challenger will be eliminated from the race to the finale.

Major League Cricket 2024 Squads

Below are the squads of all the 6 teams of Major League Cricket 2024. Players from different countries, other than India, are part of MLC 2024.

MI New York Squad: Kieron Pollard (captain), Nicholas Pooran, Steven Taylor, Monank Patel, Tim David, Dewald Brevis, Shayan Jahangir, Trent Boult, Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Nosthush Kenjige, Ehsan Adil, Ruben Clinton, Heath Richards, Rashid Khan, Rushil Ugarkar, Romario Shepherd, Sunny Patel.

Texas Super Kings Squad: Faf Du Plessis (C), Devon Conway, Dwayne Bravo, Gerald Coetzee, Mitchell Santner, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Cameron Stevenson, Zia Shahzad, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Md Mohsin, Zia Ul Haq, Joshua Tromp, Raj Nannan, Daryl Mitchell, Aaron Hardie, Marcus Stoinis, Aiden Makram, Naveen Ul Haq, Noor Ahmad.

Seattle Orcas Squad: Wayne Parnell (C), Aaron Jones, Hammad Azam, Nauman Anwar, Heinrich Klaasen, Quinto De Kock, Ryan Rickelton, Cameron Gannon, Nandre Burger, Zaman Khan, Harmeet Singh, Imad Wasim, Michael Bracewell, Ayan Desai, Shehan Jayasuriya, Shubham Ranjane, Ali Sheikh.

Los Angeles Knight Riders Squad: Sunil Narine (C), Andre Russell, Jason Roy, David Miller, Shakib Al Hasan, Joshua Little, Spencer Johnson, Unmukt Chand, Ali Khan, Alex Carey, Waqar Salamkheil, Shadley Van Schalkwyk, Nitish Kumar, Saif Badar, Corne Dry, Derone Davis, Matthew Tromp, Adithya Ganesh.

San Francisco Unicorns Squad: Corey Anderson (C), Pat Cummins, Jake Fraser Mcgurk, Josh Inglis, Sherfane Rutherford, Matthew Short, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Matt Henry, Abrar Ahmed, Liam Plunkett, Brody Couch, Carmi Le Roux, Tajinder Singh, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Karima Gore, Jahmar Hamilton, Hassan Khan.

Washington Freedom Squad: Steve Smith (Captain), Akeal Hosein, Akhilesh Bodugum, Amla Aponso, Andrew Tye, Andries Gous, Glenn Maxwell, Ian Holland, Jack Edwards, Justin Dill, Lahiru Milantha, Lockie Ferguson, Marco Jansen, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Peinaar, Rachin Ravindra, Saurabh Netravalkar, Travis Head, Yasir Mohammad.

Major League Cricket 2024 Live Telecast and Broadcast in India and Live Streaming In India

Viacom 18 Group is the official broadcaster of MLC 2024 in India. There will be no live telecast of MLC 2024 games on television in India. However, the live streaming will be available on Jio Cinema.

Indian cricket fans can tune in to the Jio Cinema app and website to enjoy the Major League Cricket live streaming.

The live streaming will be free of cost but fans need to log in to Jio Cinema with their official Indian mobile numbers. They can also enjoy the games on big screens like Android TV, Google TV, tablets, or computers.

title: MLC 2024 [WATCH]: Nicholas Pooran thrashes Cameron Gannon in MI New York’s win over Seattle Orcas
body:
Nicholas Pooran continued his excellent form in the shortest format, and with Trent Boult and Rashid Khan also in similar fiery moods, last year’s champions MI New York won the opening match of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

In Morrisville, New York clashed with the Seattle Orcas in the first fixture of the tournament. New York skipper Kieron Pollard won the toss and opted to field first, putting the Seattle to the test. Despite their best efforts, Seattle struggled to surpass the 100-run mark, ultimately being bowled out for 108 runs in 19.1 overs.

Seattle Orcas’ struggles

Shubham Ranjan top-scored for Seattle with 35 runs, including 2 fours and 2 sixes in his 31-ball innings. Harmeet Singh contributed 20 runs off 14 balls, hitting 2 fours and 1 six, while Aaron Jones managed 12 runs off 16 balls with 2 fours. However, the rest of the lineup faltered, with Quinton de Kock, captain Enrique Klassen, Imad Wasim and Michael Bracewell all failing to make significant contributions. New York’s bowling attack, led by Boult and Rashid, proved too formidable. Boult took 3 wickets for 25 runs in his 4 overs, while Rashid claimed 3 wickets for 22 runs. Pollard chipped in with 2 wickets for 11 runs, and Ehsan Adil and Enrique Norkia took 1 wicket each.

Nicholas Pooran’s match-winning knock for MI New York

In reply, New York chased down the target with ease, scoring 111 runs for 4 wickets in just 14.2 overs, securing a six wicket victory with 34 balls remaining. The highlight of the chase was Pooran’s unbeaten 62 runs off 37 balls, an innings that included 7 fours and 2 sixes. Pooran’s aggressive approach and timely boundaries kept the momentum in MI New York’s favour. Pooran was further named Player of the Match for his explosive yet calculated knock.

Also READ: Star players from IPL 2024 who will feature in the MLC 2024

Pooran’s brutal assault against Cameron Gannon

Pooran’s assault against Cameron Gannon was the defining moment of New York’s victory. With New York were at one time at a challenging 19/2 in the first four overs of the powerplay, Pooran took charge to change the course of the match. The turning point came in the fifth over, where Pooran unleashed his fury on Gannon, scoring 22 runs off the over and shifting the momentum decisively.

On the first ball of the over, Pooran played a dot ball, setting the stage for what was to come. The second delivery was slightly full and off-stump, which Pooran dispatched over wide long-on for a massive six, electrifying the crowd. This shot demonstrated his power and ability to seize scoring opportunities. Gannon’s attempt to adjust on the third ball resulted in another delivery in Pooran’s hitting zone, which he sent soaring over midwicket for another six, showcasing his aggressive intent and capacity to build pressure on the bowler.

The fourth ball saw Pooran smartly taking a double, keeping the scoreboard ticking and retaining the strike. On the fifth ball, Gannon bowled short and wide, and Pooran expertly cut it behind backward point for a four, highlighting his precision and versatility. The final delivery of the over was placed with finesse by Pooran, again behind backward point for another boundary, emphasizing his skill in finding gaps and executing shots with precision.

Here’s the video:
summary:
* The opening match of MLC 2024 was played between MI New York and Seattle Orcas in Morrisville, New York.
* MI New York won the match by 6 wickets, chasing down the target of 109 runs in 14.2 overs.
* Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 108 runs in 19.1 overs, with Shubham Ranjan top-scoring with 35 runs.
* Trent Boult and Rashid Khan took 3 wickets each for MI New York, while Kieron Pollard chipped in with 2 wickets.
* Nicholas Pooran played a match-winning knock of 62 runs off 37 balls, including 7 fours and 2 sixes, to help MI New York win the match.
* Pooran's aggressive innings was the highlight of the chase, and he was named Player of the Match for his performance.
* MI New York's win was largely due to Pooran's brutal assault against Cameron Gannon in the fifth over, where he scored 22 runs and shifted the momentum of the match in his team's favor.

title: WATCH: Derone Davis takes a screamer to dismiss Joshua Tromp in TSK vs LAKR game at MLC 2024
body:
In the second match of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 between the Texas Super Kings (TSK) and the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Derone Davis showcased extraordinary fielding skills, taking a stunning catch that left the crowd in awe.

The moment of magic

The thrilling moment occurred during the 14th over of the Super Kings’ innings, bowled by Ali Khan. On the fifth delivery, Ali bowled a short ball that batter Joshua Tromp smashed towards the third man. The ball seemed destined for a boundary, flying high and fast. Davis, stationed at third man, had to act quickly. With no time to reach the ball conventionally, he threw himself into a dive.

The spectacular catch

As the ball popped out of Davis’ hands during the dive, it seemed the chance might be lost. However, displaying remarkable presence of mind and athleticism, Davis managed to grab the rebound with his right hand. Despite the challenging circumstances, he made the catch look both easy and his ability to keep his eyes on the ball while falling to the ground was nothing short of exceptional.

The crowd erupted in applause, and the video of Davis’ incredible catch quickly went viral, showcasing the high level of skill and excitement that MLC brings to the field.

Here is the video:

Also READ: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Broadcast, live streaming details – When and Where to watch in India, US, UK, Australia & other countries

Unmukt Chand shines with the bat

Electing to bowl first, the Super Kings aimed to restrict the Knight Riders to a manageable total. However, despite early setbacks with Jason Roy and Sunil Narine falling cheaply, Unmukt Chand anchored the innings brilliantly. Unmukt’s splendid knock of 68 off 45 balls, which included 6 fours and 3 sixes, provided a solid foundation for the Knight Riders.

Contributions from Nitish Kumar, who scored 26 off 17, and Corne Dry‘s quickfire 12 off 4 balls, helped LAKR post a competitive total of 162/7. For the Super Kings, Zia-ul-Haq and Aaron Hardie were the standout bowlers, each taking two wickets and conceding 16 and 26 runs respectively.

Ali Khan’s sizzling bowling take the Knight Riders home

Chasing 163, Texas Super Kings’ innings was led by Devon Conway, who scored a solid 53 off 39 balls. Despite Conway’s efforts and a quick 29 off 18 from Calvin Savage, the Super Kings struggled to build partnerships and lost wickets at regular intervals.

The Knight Riders’ bowlers were disciplined, with Ali being the pick of the bowlers, claiming 4 wickets for 33 runs in his 4 overs. Spencer Johnson and Narine also made significant contributions with 2 and 1 wicket respectively. Their efforts restricted Texas Super Kings to 150/8 in their 20 overs, falling short by 12 runs.
summary:
**Match Details:**
The match was played between the Texas Super Kings (TSK) and the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Notable Performances:**

* Derone Davis of TSK took an extraordinary catch at third man, diving to his right and grabbing the rebound with his right hand, leaving the crowd in awe.
* Unmukt Chand of LAKR scored 68 off 45 balls, anchoring the innings and providing a solid foundation for his team.
* Ali Khan of LAKR took 4 wickets for 33 runs in his 4 overs, being the pick of the bowlers and helping his team win the match.

**Match Result:**
Los Angeles Knight Riders won the match by 12 runs, restricting Texas Super Kings to 150/8 in their 20 overs while scoring 162/7 themselves.

title: Star players from IPL 2024 who will feature in the MLC 2024
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to return for its highly anticipated second edition in 2024 after a successful debut season in 2023. The upcoming tournament will commence on Saturday (July 6) and promises to bring even more excitement and top-notch cricket action. MI New York, the champions of the inaugural season, will be looking to defend their title as six teams compete in a round-robin format.

Major League Cricket 2024: Tournament structure and venues

The 2024 season will feature six teams: MI New York, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco and Washington Freedom. The teams will face each other once in the league stage, resulting in a total of 21 matches.

The initial 15 games will be held at Church Street Park and Grand Prairie Stadium, with the remaining group stage fixtures and knockout matches taking place at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. The top four teams will advance to the playoffs, where the victorious teams from the knockout matches will battle it out in the final.

IPL franchise influence and star power

Four of the six teams in MLC are owned by franchises from the Indian Premier League (IPL), bringing with them a wealth of experience and star-studded lineups. However, it’s not just about the ownership; the tournament will also feature numerous stars who have already made a significant impact in the IPL 2024 season with their electrifying performances. These players will be looking to replicate their success in MLC 2024, adding even more excitement to the competition.

Also READ: Major League Cricket announces the complete schedule for MLC 2024

Key players to watch:

Here are some major stars out of the impressive roster of players who will be lighting up the second season of MLC:

1. Rashid Khan

MLC 2024 team: MI New York

IPL 2024 team: Gujarat Titans (GT)

The Afghan leg-spinner, known for his game-changing abilities, will be a key player for MI New York. His spin wizardry and T20 experience make him a formidable opponent.

2. Faf du Plessis

MLC 2024 team: Texas Super Kings

IPL 2024 team: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB)

The former South African captain brings a wealth of experience and leadership to the Texas Super Kings. His aggressive batting at the top of the order will be crucial for his team’s success.

3. Andre Russell

MLC 2024 team: Los Angeles Knight Riders

IPL 2024 team: Kolkata Knight Riders

The explosive West Indian all-rounder is known for his power-hitting and can turn the game around in a matter of overs. Russell’s presence will add immense firepower to the LA Knight Riders.

4. Glenn Maxwell

MLC 2024 team: Washington Freedom

IPL 2024 team: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB)

The Australian all-rounder, famous for his unorthodox shots and off-spin bowling, will be a key player for the Seattle Orcas. Maxwell’s ability to perform under pressure will be an asset to his team.

5. Quinton de Kock

MLC 2024 team: Seattle Orcas

IPL 2024 team: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG)

The South African wicketkeeper-batter is known for his aggressive batting style and will be looking to dominate the opposition bowlers in the tournament for the Seattle Orcas

6. David Miller

MLC 2024 team: Los Angeles Knight Riders

IPL 2024 team: Gujarat Titans (GT)

The South African left-handed batter, known for his clean hitting and ability to accelerate innings, joins will play for Los Angeles Knight Riders. Miller’s experience and batting prowess will be crucial in guiding his team to success.

7. Pat Cummins

MLC 2024 team: San Francisco Unicorns

IPL 2024 team: Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH)

The Australian fast bowler, who captained Sunrisers Hyderabad to the IPL 2024 final this year, brings his leadership and bowling prowess to San Francisco Unicorns. Cummins’ ability to lead and deliver match-winning performances will be a significant boost for his team.

Full list of Cricketers from IPL 2024 who will participate in MLC 2024:

Pat Cummins, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matt Henry, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, David Miller, Rilee Rossouw, Sunil Narine, Lockie Ferguson, Faf du Plessis, Marcus Stoinis, Gerald Coetzee, Naveen-ul-Haq, Noor Ahmad , Mitchell Santner, Rachin Ravindra, Glenn Maxwell, Marco Jansen, Travis Head, Nicholas Pooran, Anrich Nortje, Romario Shepherd, Trent Boult, Tim David, Kagiso Rabada, Rashid Khan, Kieron Pollard, Nandre Burger, Nathan Ellis, Shimron Hetmyer, Heinrich Klaasen, Quinton de Kock

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Schedule, Time In IST, Venues, Format, Squads and Live Streaming Details
body:
Major League Cricket 2024: Schedule, Time In IST, Venues, Format, Squads and Live Streaming Details. Major League Cricket (MLC) hosts a professional T20 cricket league in the United States. American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) manages the league, which holds official sanctioning from both USA Cricket and the International Cricket Council (ICC). The upcoming season marks the second iteration of the league, following its inaugural season in July 2023.

The upcoming Major League Cricket 2024 season will commence on July 5 (July 6 according to IST). The games will take place at two of the most sought-after venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina. It was MI New York, the reigning champions, who snatched the first place in the tournament and outperformed the Seattle Orcas by 7 wickets back in the initial season.

Also Read: IND vs ZIM T20 Series: Schedule, Time In IST, Venues, Squads And Live Streaming Details

The Major League Cricket (MLC) has been growing swiftly in its second season with acquisitions like those of Steve Smith, Travis Head, Pat Cummins, and Glenn Maxwell and the addition of coaches such as Ricky Ponting and Shane Watson. Any evidence of the “M” word, MLC, or to stand on equal footing with the game of baseball is quite amazing. It is remarkable that cricket is ‘nonofficial’ but shows growth in just over one year.

Following the T20 World Cup, where the U.S. national cricket team advanced to the second round, the second season of the competition aims to enhance its visibility. The likes of Lockie Ferguson and David Miller have recently been switching teams but the emergence of local American players has made the fans expect and enjoy the new season.

Also Read: Upcoming ICC Tournaments From 2025 To 2031: Hosts, Date, Year, And Other Details

Major League Cricket 2024 Schedule

Major League Cricket 2024 Format

In the upcoming second edition of MLC, six teams will battle it out in a round-robin format, playing a total of 21 matches. Initially, Church Street Park and Grand Prairie Stadium will host the first 15 matches alternately. For the later stages, including the last six group stage fixtures and all knockout matches, Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas will be the exclusive venue.

During the league stage, each franchise will play against every other team once. The top four teams from this phase will qualify for the playoffs, where they will compete in knockout matches to secure a spot in the championship game. However, the ultimate showdown will determine the winner of the tournament.

Major League Cricket 2024 Squads

Nicholas Pooran, Tim David, Trent Boult, Dewald Brevis, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, Monank Patel, Kieron Pollard (captain), Ehsan Adil, Romario Shepherd, Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Steven Taylor, Rashid Khan, Heath Richards, Shayan Jahangir, Nosthush Kenjige, Ruben Clinton

How to Watch Major League Cricket 2024 on TV and Streaming In India?

Sony Sports Network will broadcast all 25 matches of the second season of Major League Cricket (MLC) in India, scheduled from July 5 to 28. Also, day matches will start at 12:30 or 1 AM IST, and evening matches will start at 6 AM IST. You can also watch all the matches live on the JioCinema app and website.

The MLC 2024 season will start on July 5 (July 6 according to IST) and will be played at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

**Format:**
The tournament will feature six teams playing a round-robin format, with each team playing 21 matches. The top four teams will qualify for the playoffs, and the final match will determine the winner.

title: Sony Sports Network acquires exclusive television rights
body:
Culver Max Entertainment Private Limited, who owns and operates Sony Sports Network, the leading sports broadcaster in India, is delighted to announce the acquisition of exclusive television rights for T20 cricket spectacle Major League Cricket (MLC) for one year in India. The second edition of the league will kickstart with reigning champions MI New York facing Seattle Orcas in the opener at Church Street Park, Morrisville and will be live telecast in India 6th July 2024. The grand finale of the tournament will be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and will be live telecast in India on 29th July 2024.

A major share from the ongoing cricket revolution in the United States can be attributed to MLC, which has attracted eyeballs of India’s evergreen cricket fraternity. The participation from Indian cricket franchises Mumbai Indians, Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings brings a whole new level of excitement for fans of the respective teams. Some of the most popular cricketers including Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran are expected to feature in the upcoming edition of the league.

The MLC’s second season features an all-star lineup of announcers, including the former captain of the Indian national cricket team and great batsman Sunil Gavaskar, Pakistani legendary bowler Wasim Akram, former New Zealand and Auckland cricketer Danny Morrison, alongside Daren Ganga, Pommie Mbangwa, Matthew Hayden, Chris Morris, Natalie Germanos, Scott Styris, and Mike Haysmen.

The inaugural edition of MLC attained critical success with six teams participating i.e. San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings, Seattle Orcas, Los Angeles Knight Riders and MI New York. Team MI New York was crowned champions after they defeated Seattle Orcas in the final played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. Nicholas Pooran, who featured for the champions, registered 388 runs and was adjudged the Player of the Season last year.

With the acquisition of television rights for Major League Cricket, Sony Sports Network has asserted its solid footprint in broadcasting cricket properties. The broadcaster’s cricket portfolio already boasts of rights for New Zealand Cricket, England Cricket Board, Sri Lanka Cricket & the recent addition of India Tour of Zimbabwe T20I series.

Watch Major League Cricket Season 2 from 6th July 2024, 1:00 AM IST onwards, LIVE on Sony Sports Ten 1 SD & HD & Sony Sports Ten 5 SD & HD channels.
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* The second edition of MLC will start on July 6, 2024, with the opening match between MI New York and Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park, Morrisville.
* The grand finale will be played on July 29, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.
* The tournament will be live telecast in India on Sony Sports Ten 1 SD & HD and Sony Sports Ten 5 SD & HD channels.

**Teams and Players**

* The inaugural edition featured six teams: San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings, Seattle Orcas, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and MI New York.
* MI New York won the inaugural edition, with Nicholas Pooran being adjudged the Player of the Season.
* Popular cricketers like Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, and Nicholas Pooran are expected to participate in the upcoming edition.

**Announcers**

* The MLC's second season will feature an all-star lineup of announcers, including Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Danny Morrison, and others.

**Broadcasting Rights**

* Sony Sports Network has acquired the exclusive television rights for MLC in India for one year.

title: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Broadcast, live streaming details – When and Where to watch in India, US, UK, Australia & other countries
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) has returned with a bang for the highly anticipated second season, captivating cricket enthusiasts worldwide with an opening match between MI New York and Seattle Orcas. The match, scheduled to be held at Morrisville’s renowned cricket ground, marks the beginning of what promises to be an exhilarating season of cricketing action.

The MLC Season 2 features six dynamic teams, each eager to showcase their prowess in the sport. The lineup includes the Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom. With the participation of notable Indian Premier League (IPL) franchise owners, the league has garnered significant attention for its blend of international talent and strategic cricketing acumen.

Unlike the inaugural season, which followed a single round-robin format leading into knockout rounds, Season 2 introduces an enhanced structure. Teams will engage in a rigorous schedule of 7 league games before progressing to the knockout phase. The culmination of the season promises to deliver intense competition, with the final showdown set to take place on July 28, spanning venues in both Morrisville and Dallas.

title: Major League Cricket Prediction 2024, MLC 2024 Toss Prediction, Match Winner, Schedule, Match Full Squad, and MLC 2024 Cup Winner
body:
The excitement of cricket lovers will undoubtedly reach its peak with the truth that we are bursting today in this article. And that is, for the 2nd time, Major League Cricket has announced its tournament for 2024.

We can witness six strong teams competing against one another to lift the trophy. The tournament will begin on 6th July 2024 and end on 29 July 2024. To learn more about the teams and schedule, consider reading the article to the end.

Check Out Today’s Major League Cricket Toss Prediction

What is Major League Cricket (MLC)?

Major League Cricket (MLC) is a new cricket tournament designed to follow a similar format as the Indian Premier League. MLC features a playoff system with four matches: Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger, and Final.

During the league stage, the top four teams qualify for the playoffs. In the Eliminator, the fourth-placed team faces the third-placed team, and the winner faces the second-placed team in the Qualifier. In the Challenger match, the winner of the Qualifier plays against the top-placed team.

Challenger winners compete in the Final against Qualifier winners. The format ensures that the best teams reach the final stage, resulting in a showdown between the top two teams.

title: How to Watch Major League Cricket 2024 Live Online
