title: Texas Super Kings vs Los Angeles Knight Riders Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

The first match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas features the hosts, who have the rarity of home advantage in Major League Cricket, the Texas Super Kings, taking on the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

DATE & TIME: Friday 5th July, 2024 - USA ET – 8:30pm / USA PT – 5:30pm / West Indies – 7:30pm & Saturday 6th July, 2024 - UK – 1:30am / South Africa – 2:30am / Pakistan – 5:30am / India – 6:00am / Bangladesh – 6:30am / Australia – 10:30am

VENUE: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, Texas, United States

WEATHER: 30c or 86 F with no rain expected

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – N/A

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports app / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – Amazon Prime Video

TEXAS SUPER KINGS FORM: EXPLOITING HOME ADVANTAGE

In the inaugural season of Major League Cricket in 2023, the Texas Super Kings finished in the top two of a six-team table but they were eventually beaten in the Challenger by MI New York. However, with a very CSK-influenced leadership group of coach Stephen Fleming and captain Faf du Plessis are expected to come back with a bang in 2024.

LAST THREE: LLWLW

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS FORM: THE RECOVERY OF LAKR

The Los Angeles Knight Riders endured a very difficult first ever season of Major League Cricket as they finished rock-bottom. They begun their season with four successive hammerings before a slender two-wicket defeat of eventual finalists and already league winners Seattle Orcas in their final game and there will need to be a real leap from LAKR this season.

LAST THREE: WLLLL

TEXAS SUPER KINGS BETTING ANALYSIS

The Texas Super Kings will have the benefit of playing at probably the better of the two batting tracks in this tournament, at least that was the case in the ICC T20 World Cup, so there will be pressure on their top order. South Africa captain Aiden Markram didn’t have the best of World Cups with the bat but began to find some touch in the semi-final against Afghanistan and backing him to hit the ground running as TSK’s top batter in this match seems a good bet.

With the ball, TSK are set to try and damage teams with either smart change up bowling from Dwayne Bravo and Marcus Stoinis or spin with Noor Ahmad and Mitchell Santner. The best bet for them, though, to take two or more wickets in this match will be via their point of difference bowler, the excellent Naveen-ul-Haq.

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS BETTING ANALYSIS

Captained by Sunil Narine, LAKR perhaps lack a bit of depth and aggression in their batting lineup right at the top of the order but there is middle-order hitting with the likes of Shakib Al Hasan and Andre Russell. Their biggest threat, though, will be David Miller and, on what should and could be a good batting surface, backing a decent Miller score of 30+ runs seems a good bet.

Bowling-wise, LAKR do have the likes of Adam Zampa, Josh Little and Spencer Johnson to count on but good value could well be found in backing their domestic talents with both Ali Khan and Shadley van Schalkwyk involved. Ali Khan had a strong World Cup and backing him to take two or more of TSZ’s wickets may be worth a shot.

TEXAS SUPER KINGS VS LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS EXPERT PREDICTION

With just two venues in use during the 2024 Major League Cricket season, the Texas Super Kings will effectively be playing ‘home’ games at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas and whilst that seems like a nominal advantage in such a peculiar and short franchise tournament, that factor combined with their well rounded squad and LAKR’s lack of real star quality at the top with either bat or ball, as well as their failure last season, backing the Super Kings looks strong here.
summary:
**Match Details**

* The match is between the Texas Super Kings and the Los Angeles Knight Riders on Friday, July 5, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas, United States.
* The weather is expected to be 30°C (86°F) with no rain.

**Team Forms**

* Texas Super Kings finished in the top two in the inaugural season of Major League Cricket in 2023 but lost in the Challenger.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders finished at the bottom of the table in the inaugural season.

**Betting Analysis**

* Texas Super Kings have a well-rounded squad and are expected to perform well at their home ground.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders lack star quality at the top of their batting order.
* Good betting options include Aiden Markram to score well for Texas Super Kings, Naveen-ul-Haq to take two or more wickets, and David Miller to score 30+ runs for Los Angeles Knight Riders.

**Expert Prediction**

* Backing the Texas Super Kings to win the match is a strong prediction due to their home advantage, well-rounded squad, and Los Angeles Knight Riders' lack of star quality and poor performance in the previous season.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Viewing Guide and Match Details
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) has acquired a historic broadcast schedule for its second season, guaranteeing that the competition will be seen by millions of people worldwide.

Throughout the three-week competition, all MLC matches will be aired by Willow by Cricbuzz, the official broadcaster in the USA and Canada, providing unmatched live streaming and on-demand cricket entertainment.

In a calculated attempt to boost accessibility and viewership in the US market, MLC has partnered with several regional sports networks (RSNs) in a new agreement.

Select matches will be aired across these RSNs, starting with YES Network. Each RSN will carry all regular season matches of its home MLC team, bringing cricket to a wider sports market and fostering local support within the teams’ hometowns.

MLC has also confirmed its international broadcast schedule, extending its reach to cricket-loving nations such as Pakistan, Australia, New Zealand, the Middle East, Africa, the United Kingdom, and Ireland.

Teams:

Texas Super Kings

Los Angeles Knight Riders

Seattle Orcas

MI New York

San Francisco Unicorns

Washington Freedom

The opening match on Friday, July 5th, promises to be a thrilling rematch between the 2023 inaugural winners, MI New York, and the Seattle Orcas, taking place in Morrisville, NC. Later that evening, the Texas Super Kings will face off against the LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium, TX, adding to the anticipation and excitement.

MLC has assembled an all-star lineup of announcers, including legendary figures such as Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Danny Morrison, Daren Ganga, Pommie Mbangwa, Matthew Hayden, Chris Morris, Natalie Germanos, Scott Stylis, and Mike Haysmen. Their expertise and insights will elevate the viewing experience for fans worldwide.

In addition to the renowned on-air team, MLC will support the development of cricket talent in the United States by welcoming emerging broadcasters Nikhil Uttamchandani, Aaman Patel, and Andrew Leonard (associate cricket expert). Their involvement will provide valuable opportunities for growth and exposure.

Major League Cricket’s broadcast partners:

USA: Willow by Cricbuzz, YES Network and more RSNs to be announced

Canada: Willow by Cricbuzz

Australia and New Zealand: Prime Video

Middle East and North Africa: Cricbuzz

Pakistan: A Sports

Sub-Saharan Africa: ESPN

UK and Ireland: TNT Sports

India: To be announced

Carribean: To be announced

The MLC’s second season is sure to captivate and leave fans across the world in awe, with top-notch cricket matches, knowledgeable commentary, and a dedication to supporting the development of cricket in the United States. The entire experience is further enhanced by the league’s commitment to delivering entertainment off the field, including pyrotechnics, freebies, player encounters, and a lively atmosphere.
summary:
**Tournament Details:**

* The second season of MLC will take place over three weeks
* The opening match will be played on July 5th between MI New York and Seattle Orcas in Morrisville, NC
* The Texas Super Kings will face off against the LA Knight Riders on the same day at Grand Prairie Stadium, TX

**Broadcast Schedule:**

* Willow by Cricbuzz will be the official broadcaster in the USA and Canada
* MLC has partnered with regional sports networks (RSNs) to air select matches, starting with YES Network
* International broadcast partners include Prime Video (Australia and New Zealand), Cricbuzz (Middle East and North Africa), A Sports (Pakistan), ESPN (Sub-Saharan Africa), TNT Sports (UK and Ireland), and more to be announced (India and Caribbean)

**Teams:**

* There are six teams participating in the tournament: Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom

**Commentary Team:**

* MLC has assembled an all-star lineup of announcers, including legendary figures like Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, and Matthew Hayden, as well as emerging broadcasters Nikhil Uttamchandani, Aaman Patel, and Andrew Leonard

**Tournament Experience:**

* The league promises to deliver entertainment off the field, including pyrotechnics, freebies, player encounters, and a lively atmosphere

title: Willow by Cricbuzz offers free MLC matches
body:
Willow by Cricbuzz, the cricket streaming service, has announced broadcasting plans for the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) season. Cricket fans across North America can look forward to live MLC matches on Willow by Cricbuzz and their regional sports network, in addition to special free-to-view broadcasts on Sunday nights.

In addition to airing all MLC matches on Willow by Cricbuzz, the company has partnered with various regional sports networks to bring regular season matches to local markets.

Partnered Regional Sports Networks Include:

· Monumental Sports Network (DC Freedom)

· YES Network (MI New York)

· ROOT SPORTS (Seattle Orcas)

· Bally Sports Southwest (Texas Super Kings)

· Bally Sports SoCal (LA Knight Riders)

Three Sunday night matches on July 7th, 14th and 21st will be available for free viewing on Willow by Cricbuzz, Sling Freestream, and Fubo TV, providing access for fans nationwide, all at no cost.

Free Sunday Night Matches Schedule:

· July 7: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs. San Francisco Unicorns at 8:30 PM EDT

· July 14: MI New York vs. Texas Super Kings at 8:30 PM EDT

· July 21: MI New York vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders at 8:30 PM EDT

“Riding the momentum from the USA’s unforgettable T20 World Cup run, Major League Cricket is poised for a spectacular future,” said Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz. “Our partnerships with regional sports networks provide fans unprecedented access to watch their favorite World Cup players on local teams, critically weaving the sport into the fabric of local communities. The addition of free Sunday night viewings also broadens access, energizing a vibrant and rising fan community eager to support their hometown heroes. This is the beginning of a new chapter in North American cricket, with boundless growth potential.”
summary:
* Willow by Cricbuzz has announced its broadcasting plans for the 2024 MLC season, which will include live matches on their platform and regional sports networks.
* The company has partnered with several regional sports networks to air regular season matches, including Monumental Sports Network, YES Network, ROOT SPORTS, Bally Sports Southwest, and Bally Sports SoCal.
* Three Sunday night matches on July 7th, 14th, and 21st will be available for free viewing on Willow by Cricbuzz, Sling Freestream, and Fubo TV.
* The free Sunday night matches schedule includes:
	+ July 7: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs. San Francisco Unicorns
	+ July 14: MI New York vs. Texas Super Kings
	+ July 21: MI New York vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders
* The CEO of Willow by Cricbuzz, Todd Myers, is optimistic about the growth of cricket in North America, citing the momentum from the USA's T20 World Cup run and the potential for local communities to support their hometown heroes.

title: Major League Cricket launched its second season in Downtown Dallas with captains and fans
body:
Cognizant Major League Cricket launched its second season today with its captains and fans in downtown Dallas.

Sunil Narine (LA Knight Riders), Keiron Pollard (MI New York), Harmeet Singh (Seattle Orcas), Corey Anderson (San Francisco Unicorns), Faf du Plessis (Texas Super Kings) and Steve Smith (Washington Freedom) welcomed fans to celebrate the second season's launch at the AT&T Discovery District.

MLC’s USA players Nitish Kumar, Shadley van Schalkwyk (LA Knight Riders), Jahmar Hamilton, Sanjay Krishnamurthi (San Francisco Unicorns), Miland Kumar, and Josh Tromp were also part of the excitement.

Opening weekend matches:

MLC’s second season of opening matches promises to deliver sports fans and entertainment seekers the perfect summer weekend activity.

Friday July 5, 2024 (local times)

Seattle Orcas vs. MI New York, Church Street Park, 3.30 pm EDT

Texas Super Kings vs.Los Angeles Knight Riders, Grand Prairie Stadium, 7.30 pm CDT

Saturday July 6, 2024

MI New York vs. Washington Freedom, Church Street Park, 3.00 pm EDT

Sunday July 7, 2024

Los Angeles Knight Riders vs. San Francisco Unicorns, Grand Prairie Stadium, 7.30 pm CDT

For those outside of Texas and North Carolina, the second season of Major League Cricket is on Willow by CricBuzz (USA & Canada), YES Network, and Monumental TV.

TICKETS AND SPECIAL OFFERS

Tickets for all matches, including the four playoffs, are available at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com

With giveaways, entertainment, and player appearances across the tournament, now is the time to secure your tickets and enjoy the world’s best cricket this summer.

MLC FAMILY DAYS - SUNDAY SPECIAL

Make your next family outing one to remember. This summer, watch the world's best cricketers at Grand Prairie or Morrisville and take advantage of the new family special offer.

Receive 30% off when purchasing four or more tickets by selecting the ‘Family’ option at checkout. Available for all Sunday games (excluding Championship match), valid on all GA tickets, and up to 12 tickets per transaction.
summary:
**Tournament Launch**: The second season of the Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament was launched in downtown Dallas, featuring captains and fans.

**Teams and Captains**: The six teams participating in the tournament are LA Knight Riders (captained by Sunil Narine), MI New York (captained by Keiron Pollard), Seattle Orcas (captained by Harmeet Singh), San Francisco Unicorns (captained by Corey Anderson), Texas Super Kings (captained by Faf du Plessis), and Washington Freedom (captained by Steve Smith).

**Opening Weekend Matches**: The opening weekend matches are scheduled for July 5-7, 2024, with three matches each on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.

**Broadcasting and Tickets**: The tournament will be broadcast on Willow by CricBuzz, YES Network, and Monumental TV. Tickets for all matches, including playoffs, are available at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com. A special family offer of 30% off is available for Sunday games when purchasing four or more tickets.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 | Live Streaming Channel, Squads, Fixtures, Date & Time
body:
MI New York won the MLC 2023 [X]

To the delight of cricket fans across the globe, the much-awaited second edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) commences on Saturday night, with defending champions MI New York facing last year's runners-up Seattle Orcas in the tournament opener.

Six top-class teams are set to battle it out in 25 matches, including the knockouts, across two venues, for the coveted trophy.

So, as the stage gets set for the United States' premier T20 league, here we provide you with all details.

Major League Cricket 2024: Squads

The six teams participating in the MLC 2024 are - MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super King, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns. To check the squads, click here.

Major League Cricket 2024: Fixtures, Date & Time

The six teams will face each other once, so twenty-one league-stage matches will be played from July 6 and 24.

The top four teams will qualify for the next round where the third and fourth placed sides will clash in the eliminator, with the top two colliding in the qualifier.

The challenger will be played between the winner of the eliminator and the loser of the qualifier. The winner of this match will meet the winner of the qualifier in the final.

Check MLC 2024 fixtures, date and time here.

Major League Cricket 2024: Live streaming channel

In India, the MLC matches will be streamed live on Jio Cinema and telecast live on Sports18 channel. Meanwhile, Willow TV will air all the matches in the USA and Canada.
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* The second edition of the MLC is set to commence on Saturday night.
* Six teams will participate in the tournament, playing 25 matches including knockouts, across two venues.
* The teams are MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super King, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Washington Freedom, and San Francisco Unicorns.

**Fixtures and Schedule**

* The league stage will feature 21 matches, with each team playing each other once, from July 6 to 24.
* The top four teams will qualify for the next round, with the third and fourth-placed teams playing in the eliminator, and the top two teams playing in the qualifier.

**Live Streaming and Broadcasting**

* In India, MLC matches will be streamed live on Jio Cinema and telecast live on Sports18 channel.
* In the USA and Canada, Willow TV will air all the matches.

title: Major League Cricket 2024
body:
Major League Cricket 2024 - Squads, Fixtures and All you need to know

The second season of the much awaited Major League Cricket is commencing on the 5th of July with MI New York taking on Seattle Orcas in Church Street Park, Morrisville for the Inaugural match.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: 6th July to 29th July 2024
body:
After a successful inaugural season in 2023, Major League Cricket (MLC) is all set to start the second season in 2024 which will commence from July 5 to July 28.

Unlike the first season's 15 league games, this season will have 21 matches in the first round of the tournament followed by four playoff games.

In the opener of the season, on the 5th of July, the defending champions MI New York, led by Kieron Pollard will take on last year's runner-ups, Seattle Orcas, led by Wayne Parnell in Church Street Park, Morrisville at 01.00 hours (IST).

Later on the same day, Faf du Plesiss' Texas Super Kings will face Sunil Narine-led Los Angeles Knight Riders in Grand Prairie, Dallas at 06.00 hours (IST). Dallas' Grand Prairie stadium will host all four playoff games from July 25 to July 29.

In the inaugural season of MLC in 2023, MI New York's Nicholas Pooran top scored in the tournament with 388 runs in 8 innings followed by his IPL teammate Quinton de Kock at 264 in 7 innings. Pooran was also adjudged as the Player of The Tournament.

Trent Boult, MI New York's lead pacer was the highest wicket-taker of the season with 22 wickets in 8 games followed by the Aussie duo of Cameron Gannon and Andrew Tye at joint-second with 11 wickets each.

Balanced San Francisco Unicorns aim for the finish line.

Captain: Corey Anderson

Coach: Shane Watson

How did they fare last season: Group Stage

San Francisco Unicorns wrapped up their chequered campaign after snatching defeat from a winning position in their final group stage game against the Texas Super Kings. Reeling at 92 for 5 in the 14th over, TSK romped home with 5 balls to spare as Milind Kumar and Daniel Sams dashed the Unicorns hopes in a matter of minutes. Unicorns kicked off life at MLC in spectacular fashion against the might of MI New York, beating a much fancied opposition by 22 runs. The game also dragged Corey Anderson from cricketing oblivion after a dazzling knock of 91 off 52 deliveries. Anderson closed out the tournament as the Unicorns' highest run getter with 190 runs in 5 games.

Unicorns drafted in old war horse Liam Plunkett as the primary pick for $70,000 in the draft last year. The 39 year old was worth his weight in gold, overshadowing the younger brigade of Carmi Le Roux and Haris Rauf in terms of wickets and ECON. The tournament also proved to be a nightmare for captain Aaron Finch at the sunset of his career, labouring to 68 runs and striking at a dismal 88. Unicorns stop-start campaign embodied the returns of their international stars including the likes of Marcus Stoinis and Finn Allen who failed to muster a single score of over 40 runs in 5 innings.

International Contingent:

The Unicorns made some sweeping changes to their international rosters. The franchise will pin high hopes on their bumper signing of Pat Cummins. There would have been a temptation to parachute in Cummins as the captain following the leadership vacuum with the retirement of Aaron Finch but the Unicorns management bestowed the captaincy to Anderson keeping in mind his local wherewithals. World cricket's latest sensation Jake Fraser McGurk would hope to carry where he left off from the IPL where he scored 330 runs striking at 234.04 while Kiwi, Finn Allen manages to retain his spot after a pedestrian season with the bat. Josh Inglis and Sherfane Rutherford have been entrusted to add the muscle in the middle order while fast bowlers Haris Rauf and Matt Henry will find themselves at the core of the Unicorns bowling attack.

Domestic Cadre:

The Unicorns went all out to grab former Pakistan U19 captain Hassan Khan at the MLC domestic draft this year. Khan bagged a top drawer $75,000 contract for putting on a splendid all round show in last year's Minor League Cricket tournament, amassing 220 runs in 5 innings at a S/R of 181 to go with his tally of 11 wickets at an ECON of under 5. Khan will form a troika with left arm spinning all rounders Sanjay Krishnamurthy and Karima Gore. Former West Indies wicket-keeper Jahmar Hamilton has finally been rewarded for his stellar show in the Minor League season after season. Liam Plunkett comes back for yet another MLC season in what may finally be his swansong from the sport while Carmi Le Roux has been retained to form the only left hand seaming option for the Unicorns.

Probable XI : Jake Fraser McGurk, Finn Allen, Josh Inglis, Corey Anderson, Sherfane Rutherford, Tajinder Singh, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Pat Cummins, Haris Rauf, Carmi Le Roux

Seattle Orcas: De Kock, Klaasen key for glory.

Captain: Wayne Parnell

Coach: Pravin Amre

How did they fare last season: Runners Up

Seattle Orcas stormed into the finals last year, dropping only a solitary league game in their march to the final. The Orcas were besieged at the final frontier by a whirlwind Nicholas Pooran century that counterpunched Quinton de Kock's swashbuckling 87. Orcas played some phenomenal cricket throughout the tournament on the back of some brilliant individual performances. Heinrich Klaasen's devastating knock of 110* off 44 deliveries sealed a final over thriller against a packed MI New York bowling lineup. His unravelling of Rashid Khan for a 26-run over is seen as a major inflexion point in his career.

Imad Wasim spun a web around the rest of the teams throughout the tournament. Bringing all his experience into play to bowl the tough powerplay overs, coming out unscathed with an economy of 6.33 and a total tally of 10 wickets in 7 games. USA World Cup star Harmeet Singh proved to be a crucial understudy to Imad as the duo fed off each other to wear down the opposition. De Kock kicked on with three half-centuries in the latter half of the tournament to top the batting charts after an indifferent start to the tournament.

International Contingent:

The Orcas opted for a major overhaul to their international roster. With Dasun Shanaka, Dwayne Pretorius and Shimron Hetmyer being seen as surplus to requirements, the franchise looked to fill in obvious gaps in their roster. Pakistan death bowling specialist Zaman Khan and Proteas' new pace sensation are a couple of key signings for the Orcas this year to aid captain Wayne Parnell at the fag end of an innings. Ryan Rickleton joins De Kock and Klaasen in an already South Africa-heavy set-up. Orcas also bring in some Kiwi flavour with off-spinning allrounder Michael Bracewell in their bowling mix in addition to Imad Wasim.

Domestic Cadre:

Orcas find themselves rich in all-round talent with Shubham Ranjane, Harmeet Singh and Hamad Azam in their ranks. Ranjane proved to be a handful with his electric fielding, his array of slower balls and valuable cameos lower down the order in the inaugural season. Nauman Anwar and Shehan Jayasuriya bring in the international pedigree to their batting lineup. Anwar especially was seen to play the perfect foil for De Kock at the top of the order with some understated knocks. Cameron Gannon, an American-born Aussie state cricketer provides further depth to the Orcas pace battery. The Orcas drafted back USA vice-captain Aaron Jones in a supplemental draft in the wake of his monumental 94* in the World Cup opener.

Probable XI: Quinton De Kock, Nauman Anwar, Shehan Jayasuriya, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickleton, Imad Wasim, Harmeet Singh, Shubham Ranjane, Zaman Khan, Wayne Parnell, Cameron Gannon

Texas Super Kings: Star batters to backup unheralded bowlers

Texas

Captain:Faf Du Plesis

Coach: Stephen Fleming

How did they fare last season: Knockouts

The crowd frenzy that surrounded the Texas Super Kings in Dallas invoked a strong feeling of deja vu amongst the Super Kings fans. This unwavering support laid the first bricks to build yet another hollowed fortress 5,000 miles away from their spiritual home in Chennai. TSK kicked off their campaign last year with a thumping home win against a star studded LA Knight Riders. Devon Conway and David Miller chipped in with sparkling half centuries on that day but mostly struggled thereafter to match their opening salvo. To compound their batting woes captain Faf Du Plessis failed to cross 14 runs in any of his 7 innings while Milind Kumar was the lone half centurion among the domestics.

Former Peshawar Zalmi leg spinner Mohammad Mohsin proved to be the domestic find of the season for TSK. Mohsin started off with a bang, bamboozling the LAKR with a spell of 4 for 8 on the opening night. He further made heads turn with back to back strikes at a pivotal point in a low scorer against eventual champions MI New York, including pinning Keiron Pollard dead in front on the first ball. Dwayne Bravo turned the clock back with a ballistic 76 off 39 deliveries in their second game against Washington Freedom at the age of 39 but his body failed to last the tournament which in a way derailed the balance of the team and therefore the hopes of clinching the title for TSK.

International Contingent:

Matheesha Pathirana's unavailability had Stephen Fleming make an SOS call to Bravo. The 40 year old Super Kings loyalist will partner with Afghanistan's Naveen-ul-Haq to shoulder death over responsibilities for TSK. Du Plessis, who will turn 40 half way into the tournament, will take over the reins for yet another season. Aiden Markram, meanwhile, will have little time to shake off the world cup heartbreak as the South African captain is expected to line up for the opening game on July 5. The tournament also provides an excellent opportunity for Devon Conway and Mitchell Santner to find their form after missing out in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Conway would particularly be itching to go after being sidelined from the IPL owing to a fractured thumb. Marcus Stoinis will don the yellow this year after a stint with the San Francisco Unicorns in the inaugural season along with fellow Western Australian, Aaron Hardie.

Domestic Cadre:

Milind Kumar is expected to be the key middle order lynchpin for TSK with his experience. TSK have entrusted 18 year old South African born wicket keeper batsman Joshua Tromp as their first pick in this year's domestic draft. TSK's second draft pick, little known left arm spinner Raj Nannan hailing from Guyana surprised many in the American cricket circles. Nannan will form a spin troika with leggies Mohammad Mohsin and Zia Shehzad. Rusty Theron's retirement leaves the weight of the fast bowling mantle on the USA domestic trio of Cameron Stevenson, Calvin Savage and Zia Ul-Haq.

Probable XI: Faf Du Plessis, Devon Conway, Milind Kumar, Aiden Markram, Marcus Stoinis, Joshua Tromp, Dwayne Bravo, Cameron Stevenson, Naveen Ul Haq, Mohammad Mohsin, Raj Nannan

Brute power, rounded bowling attack provides MI New York impetus to reclaim glory

Captain: Kieron Pollard

Coach: Robin Peterson

How did they fare last season: Champions

MI New York's stop start campaign peaked at the right juncture after failing to sustain winning momentum in the league stage. Kieron Pollard's unfortunate shoulder injury in the final league game paved the way for Nicholas Pooran to steward a rocky MINY ship. After securing the 4th spot by a hair's breadth, MINY gathered steam in the knockouts. Pooran's men came back from behind to stitch a 3 match winning streak with the captain capping off their historic run with an innings for the ages, a cracking of 137* off 55 deliveries in the grand finale.

Pooran's form remained red hot throughout the tournament, striking at 167 for his 388 runs. Tim David matched him stroke for stroke scoring at a similar clip, ending with 209 runs in his limited opportunities lower down the order. Left arm spinner Nosthush Kenjige proved to be the ultimate domestic find of the season for MINY. A nagging left arm spinner and a livewire on the field, Kenjige showed heart to bowl the tough overs in the powerplay with aplomb. Up against some superstars of T20 cricket, little known Kenjige topped the economy charts for the tournament, going at a mere 5.73 RPO in his first taste of top flight cricket.

International Contingent:

MINY have largely called upon their core group of players that have served them elsewhere under the MI banner. MI talisman Kieron Pollard will pull up his socks yet again for a franchise he has served for more than 14 seasons. Tim David and Nicholas Pooran will be back in MI colours looking to emulate their inaugural season heroics. South African youngster Dewald Brewis has been afforded yet another chance to find a breakthrough T20 season. They have also roped in West Indies all-rounder Romario Shepherd to add to their middle order muscle who is also an adequate backup for their jacked up pace attack in Kagiso Rabada, Trent Boult and Anrich Nortje. MINY also have successfully retained Rashid Khan to form one of the most complete bowling attacks going around in the tournament.

Domestic Cadre:

37 year old former Gujarat leg spinning all-rounder Sunny Patel makes a surprise comeback to professional cricket after his move to USA. USA captain Monank Patel is expected to be back at the top of the order after being sidelined by a shoulder injury during the world cup. Steven Taylor finds himself under the injury cloud after choosing to play with a shoulder niggle. Opener Shayan Jahangir will look to further capitalise on some solid starts he had provided in the first edition for the team. MINY would hope former Pakistani pacer Ehsan Adil brings in the required depth in the pace battery to step in the role as a container in the presence of a very strong international pace attack. American born and South African raised left handed opening batsman Ruben Clinton has been rewarded with a contract for his exploits in the minor league.

Probable XI: Monank Patel, Steven Taylor, Shayan Jahangir, Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard, Tim David, Rashid Khan, Kagiso Rabada, Trent Boult, Nosthush Kenjige, Ehsan Adil.
summary:
**Tournament Schedule**: The second season of MLC will take place from July 5 to July 28, 2024, with 21 matches in the first round followed by four playoff games.

**Opening Match**: The defending champions MI New York, led by Kieron Pollard, will face Seattle Orcas, led by Wayne Parnell, in the opening match on July 5 at Church Street Park, Morrisville.

**Team Updates**:

* San Francisco Unicorns: Have made some changes to their international roster, including the addition of Pat Cummins and Jake Fraser McGurk. They will be led by Corey Anderson.
* Seattle Orcas: Have overhauled their international roster, including the additions of Pakistan death bowling specialist Zaman Khan and Proteas' new pace sensation. They will be led by Wayne Parnell.
* Texas Super Kings: Have retained Faf du Plessis as their captain and have added Aiden Markram, Devon Conway, and Mitchell Santner to their international roster.
* MI New York: Have largely retained their core group of players, including Kieron Pollard, Tim David, and Nicholas Pooran.

**Notable Players**:

* Nicholas Pooran (MI New York) was the top scorer in the inaugural season with 388 runs in 8 innings.
* Trent Boult (MI New York) was the highest wicket-taker in the inaugural season with 22 wickets in 8 games.

I hope this summary provides a helpful overview of the article!

title: Steve Smith returns to captain's chair, to lead Washington Freedom in MLC Season 2
body:
Former Australian skipper Steve Smith has succeeded his Sydney Sixers teammate Moises Henriques to lead the Washington Freedom for the second season of the USA's Major League Cricket (MLC). Smith, who was one of the few Australians to sign up with the Washington outfit including the likes of Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head and a new head coach in Ricky Ponting, will be leading a T20 side for the first time since 2017 when he was the captain of Rising Pune Supergiant in IPL 2017.

Smith was excited for the opportunity and was looking forward to the season. "Yeah, it's been good. Just getting to know all the guys. [I have] been here for a couple of days now, played one practice game, got another today. Looking forward to this season, I think we've got a really good squad, good bunch of guys and excited for what this season holds," Smith said in a video posted by Washington Freedom.

This is also the second time that Smith will be working with Ponting as a coach in a T20 setup after IPL 2021 with the Delhi Capitals. With the likes of Andries Gous, Saurabh Netravalkar, experienced locals combined with overseas stars not just the Aussies but with Rachin Ravindra, Marco Jansen, and Lockie Ferguson at the disposal, Ponting and Smith have a variety of options to play with.

The Freedom begin their campaign against the defending champions MI New York on Saturday, July 6 at Church Street Park in Morrisville. Smith will be hoping to lead Freedom to further than eliminator where their campaign came to an end last year.
summary:
* Steve Smith will lead the Washington Freedom team in the second season of the USA's Major League Cricket (MLC), replacing Moises Henriques.
* This will be Smith's first time leading a T20 team since 2017 when he captained Rising Pune Supergiant in IPL 2017.
* Smith expressed his excitement for the season and believes the team has a good squad with a mix of experienced locals and overseas stars, including Australians Glenn Maxwell and Travis Head.
* Smith will be working with coach Ricky Ponting, with whom he previously collaborated in IPL 2021 with the Delhi Capitals.
* The Washington Freedom will begin their campaign against defending champions MI New York on July 6 at Church Street Park in Morrisville, aiming to improve on their eliminator finish last year.

title: MLC 2024 is here, and Defending Champs MI New York are ready! All your FAQs answered
body:
mi

It’s bigger, it’s better, and it’s back. The three-week long cricket festival returns to America after breaking plenty of new ground in 2023. Oh, and it’s been some revolution this! From introducing the game to ordinary Americans to becoming a raging success, Major League Cricket is all set to push the boundaries further in 2024. IT’S ONE DAY AWAY. Okay, you’ve got questions? We hear you? Here’s your cheat sheet to everything you need to know..

Another cricket party? No wait, didn’t the World Cup just get over?

The World Cup was just the start, the MLC will now take it to the crescendo! The second season is here – six iconic cities, two venues, 23 days, and MI New York out there to defend their crown. A host of world class cricketers have assembled in town, and are all set to inspire another whole generation of young American fans.

So who’s playing? What’s the format?

There’s the defending champions, MI New York, the runner’s up, Seattle Orcas, Faf du Plessis-led Texas Super Kings, fresh from winning the IPL, Sunil Narine-led LA Knight Riders, fresh from inducting Pat Cummins, San Francisco Unicorns, and the Washington Freedom.

Each team would play seven league games, and the top four will then proceed to the playoffs. The first leg of the tournament would take place at Church Street Park in Morrisville, before he caravan moved to the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

Could you recap season one please?

So we won. It was a tight road until the final though, with MI New York having to win their last four games to win the title. And they did it in style, with Trent Boult getting four-fer after four-fer, young Dewald Brevis playing some clutch knocks in the middle-order, Tim David finishing games for fun like only he can, and Monank Patel getting us off to fliers. Come the final, against Seattle Orcas, it was the Nicholas Pooran show, with a blazing 137-run-knock to give us our moment of history!

Woah, Defending Champs! What’s new this time then?

Anrich Nortje, with his 150kph thunderbolts, is all set to don the Blue and Gold, and it is going to be a dream to watch him bowl in tandem with Trent Boult and Kagiso Rabada. Also Romario Shepherd, fresh from his assault in the IPL for Mumbai Indians and then in the T20 World Cup for West Indies, is here too. Four other youngsters, Rushil Ugarkar, Heath Richards, Ruben Clinton and Sunny Patel have come into the mix as well. But the core of the team remains the same, with Kieron Pollard, the MI #OneFamily legend, along with Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, Rashid Khan, Tim David and the USA star players like Steven Taylor, Monank Patel and Shayan Jahangir.

And what’s new with the MLC in 2024?

A few extra matches. Last year saw each team play a single round-robin, but this time there are two extra games in the league. It’s just gotten bigger. But should remain the same though is the passion the league generated among the supporters, who thronged to the stadium in large numbers.

Okay, I’m already excited..what’s the schedule?

July 5, 3:30pm EDT (July 6, 1am IST) - MI New York vs Seattle Orcas

July 6, 3pm EDT (July 7, 12:30am IST) - Washington Freedom vs MI New York

July 12, 3pm EDT (July 13, 12:30am IST) - MI New York vs Texas Super Kings

July 14, 7:30pm CDT (July 15, 6am IST) - Texas Super Kings vs MI New York

July 16, 7:30pm CDT (July 17, 6am IST) - MI New York vs Washington Freedom

July 18, 7:30pm CDT (July 19, 6am IST) - MI New York vs San Francisco Unicorns

July 21, 7:30pm CDT (July 22, 6am IST) - LA Knight Riders vs MI New York
summary:
**Overview**: The three-week long MLC tournament is returning to America in 2024, building on its success in 2023. The second season promises to be bigger and better, with six iconic cities, two venues, and 23 days of cricket action.

**Teams and Format**: Six teams will participate in the tournament: MI New York (defending champions), Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, LA Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom. Each team will play seven league games, with the top four proceeding to the playoffs.

**Defending Champions**: MI New York won the inaugural season, defeating Seattle Orcas in the final. Key players from last season include Trent Boult, Dewald Brevis, Tim David, and Monank Patel.

**New Additions**: Anrich Nortje, Romario Shepherd, and four young players (Rushil Ugarkar, Heath Richards, Ruben Clinton, and Sunny Patel) have joined the MI New York team this season.

**Schedule**: The tournament begins on July 5, with MI New York facing Seattle Orcas. The schedule includes seven league games for MI New York, with matches taking place at Church Street Park in Morrisville and Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

title: Steve Smith Gets Captaincy To Lead Washington Freedom In MLC 2024
body:
Steve Smith to Lead Washington Freedom in MLC 2024 [x.com]

Former Australian cricket captain Steve Smith has been named the captain of Washington Freedom for the 2024 season of Major League Cricket (MLC).

This is a big chance for Steve Smith, who has been going through a hard time lately. Despite his wealth of expertise, Smith was left off of Australia's T20 World Cup 2024 squad and was only selected as a commentator.

The MLC 2024, which kicks off on July 6, will see Smith leading Washington Freedom. This American-based T20 league aims to expand the sport's reach in the USA.

Smith's leadership experience, which includes leading Australia to numerous victories across formats and captaining IPL teams like Rising Pune Supergiant and Rajasthan Royals, will be invaluable for Washington Freedom.

In the previous MLC season, Washington Freedom reached the playoffs under the captaincy of Moises Henriques but were eliminated by MI New York, the eventual champions.

The team has bolstered its roster this year with key signings, including Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and new head coach Ricky Ponting.

Given his outstanding record, many are excited to see Smith return to captaincy. Smith scored 2485 runs in 103 matches during his IPL career, including a century and eleven half-centuries. In 67 games, he has amassed 1094 runs and 17 wickets in international Twenty20 cricket.

Washington Freedom will begin their campaign against defending champions MI New York at Church Street Park in Morrisville.

Fans look forward to Smith's strategic acumen and batting skills, hoping he will lead the team to victory and help elevate the league's profile in the USA.

With his appointment, Washington Freedom aims to build on last year's performance and strive for the championship.
summary:
**Main Event:** Steve Smith appointed as captain of Washington Freedom for MLC 2024 season.

**Key Details:**

* MLC 2024 season starts on July 6.
* Washington Freedom will face defending champions MI New York in their first match at Church Street Park in Morrisville.
* Smith brings valuable leadership experience, having led Australia to multiple victories and captained IPL teams.
* Washington Freedom has strengthened its roster with signings like Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, and new head coach Ricky Ponting.
* Smith's batting skills and strategic acumen are highly anticipated in the tournament.

**Previous Performance:**

* Washington Freedom reached the playoffs in the previous MLC season under Moises Henriques' captaincy but were eliminated by MI New York.

title: Top Pakistan players to feature in Major League Cricket 2024
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 is gearing up for an exciting season in the United States, with six teams slated to compete across Texas and North Carolina from July 5th to 28th.

Following the success of its inaugural edition last year, MLC returns with MI New York defending their title after a thrilling victory over Seattle Orcas in the 2023 final.

The season opener on July 5th will witness a rematch of last year's final as MI New York faces Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park in North Carolina. Concurrently, Texas Super Kings will host LA Knight Riders at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas.

The league will feature a total of 21 matches played in a round-robin format. Initially, 15 matches will be split between Church Street Park and Grand Prairie Stadium, with the latter hosting the final group matches and knockout fixtures.

Teams will compete once in the league phase, with the top four advancing to the playoffs. The grand finale of MLC 2024 is scheduled for July 29th at Grand Prairie Stadium.

Four out of the six MLC teams are owned by franchises from the Indian Premier League (IPL), including MI New York (Mumbai Indians), Texas Super Kings (Chennai Super Kings), LA Knight Riders (Kolkata Knight Riders), and Seattle Orcas (Delhi Capitals). The remaining two teams are San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom.

title: MLC 2024 Match 1, NY vs SEA | Playing 11 Prediction, Cricket Tips, Preview & Live Streaming
body:
MI New York will face Seattle in game 1 [X]

The much-awaited second season of the Major League Cricket begins on Saturday night, with previous year's finalists, MI New York and Seattle Orcas facing each other in the tournament opener. The high-octane face-off is scheduled at Church Street Park in Morrisville.

NY vs SEA: Team Previews

MI New York

Led by Kieron Pollard, MI New York have a well-balanced squad heading to the competition. Nicholas Pooran, who played a match-winning knock in previous year's final, will spearhead MI's batting unit alongside the swashbuckling duo of Pollard and Tim David.

Additionally, the eyes will also be on Steven Taylor and Dewald Brevis, who can stun the opposition with scintillating stroke play at the top.

MI New York's fast bowling unit looks ruthless, studded with three hostile pacers- Trent Boult, Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje. Meanwhile, the presence of Rashid Khan as the lead spinner makes their bowling unit lethal irrespective of the conditions.

Seattle Orcas

Seattle Orcas were the runners-up in MLC 2023 [X]

On the other hand, Seattle Orcas have a fantastic South African batting core, comprising Ryan Rickelton, Quinton de Kock and Heinrich Klaasen.

Aaron Jones, who grabbed limelight during the recently held T20 World Cup, will bat in the middle order, with Michael Bracewell and Imad Wasim playing as the specialist all-rounders.

Nandre Burger is expected to emerge as the wrecker-in-chief with the ball for the Orcas, who will also rely on Wayne Parnell, Obed McCoy and Zaman Khan to succeed in the tournament.

NY vs SEA: Match details & Live streaming

NY vs SEA: Church Street Park pitch report

Considering the game will start at 3.30 PM local time, we don't expect appreciable seam movement for the fast bowlers during the first innings.

However, the ball generally moves off the deck in Morrisville under the lights, so the pacers will have their tails up in the latter half.

On the other hand, the spinners will play minimal role in the game, while the batters would like to use the track's pace and bounce for scoring runs.

It's the first game of the season, so expect the toss-winner to bowl first. But considering the seamers get significant assistance in the second half, don't be surprised if the toss-winning side bats first.

NY vs SEA: Probable playing XIs

MI New York: Steven Taylor, Shayan Jahangir, Nicholas Pooran (WK), Dewald Brevis, Monank Patel, Kieron Pollard (C), Rashid Khan, Nosthush Kenjige, Trent Boult, Kagiso Rabada, Ehsan Adil

Seattle Orcas: Quinton de Kock (WK), Ryan Rickelton, Nauman Anwar, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Hammad Azam, Imad Wasim, Harmeet Singh, Wayne Parnell (C), Nandre Burger, Cameron Gannon

Riding on their overall balance and an incredibly potent bowling attack, MI New York might pip Seattle Orcas to earn their first points in MLC 2024.

title: High-class Overseas Recruits But Lack Of Quality US Players - Analysis Of Washington Freedom
body:
Washington Freedom will be looking to make it to the finals and win the trophy in MLC 2024 [X]

The second season of the Major League Cricket (MLC 2024) is just about 24 hours away. The tournament will catch the eyes of avid cricket followers after the brilliant show of the US in the T20 World Cup 2024.

We at OneCricket have already taken a deep dive into the squad of four teams that will participate in this tournament. In this article, we will take a look at Washington Freedom.

Washington Freedom finished third in the points table last year. However, they were defeated in the Eliminator by MI-New York, the eventual champions, and had to bow out of the tournament. With some new recruits onboard and as a much stronger-looking outfit, WAF will look to better their performance and eventually lift their maiden MLC title.

Here is a look at the Washington Freedom squad for the MLC 2024.

Batters: Steven Smith, Akhilesh Reddy, Jack Edwards, Andries Gous, Travis Head, Lahiru Milantha, Mukhtar Ahmed

All-rounders: Justin Dill, Ian Holland, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Rachin Ravindra

Bowlers: Amila Aponso, Lockie Ferguson, Akeal Hosein, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andrew Tye, Yasir Mohammad

Strength of Washington Freedom for MLC 2024

Variety and depth in the overseas recruits

The Washington Freedom have recruited some high-quality overseas players ahead of the MLC 2024 season. These recruits will give them strength ahead of the season alongwith variety and flexibility to field teams based on the strength of the opposition and the playing conditions.

While Steven Smith, Travis Head and Rachin Ravindra will add stability to the top order, Glenn Maxwell, alongside Andries Gous, will give them the firepower in the middle order.

In the bowling department, they will have Akeal Hosein in the spin department, with Lockie Ferguson, Andre Tye and Marco Jansen rounding up in the pace front. An overall look gives us the idea that they have plenty of resources to use as per the playing conditions, and they go with a 'horses for courses' policy.

Weaknesses of Washington Freedom for MLC 2024

Lack of experience in the spin department

Akeal Hosein will be in charge of the team's spin department. Besides leading this aspect of the team, he will have the majority of the task of controlling the opposition in the middle overs and picking up wickets. There is a lack of experienced spinners in the squad, and the skipper will have to turn to Glenn Maxwell and even Rachin Ravindra to get some efficient overs in the middle overs.

Over-dependency on Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell for power hitting

Most of the batters in the Washington Freedom look like grafters. They will take time to settle down before shifting gears. Thus the Freedom will have an over-dependency on Travis Head at the top and Glenn Maxwell in the middle order to increase the team's scoring rate.

Washington Freedom Predicted XI for the first match
summary:
**Team Overview**: Washington Freedom finished third in the points table last year but were defeated in the Eliminator by MI-New York. With new recruits, they aim to better their performance and win their maiden MLC title.

**Squad**: The Washington Freedom squad consists of 15 players, including batters like Steven Smith, Akhilesh Reddy, and Travis Head, all-rounders like Justin Dill, Ian Holland, and Glenn Maxwell, and bowlers like Lockie Ferguson, Akeal Hosein, and Andrew Tye.

**Strengths**: The team has recruited high-quality overseas players, providing variety and depth in their lineup. They have a strong top order, firepower in the middle order, and a balanced pace attack.

**Weaknesses**: The team lacks experienced spinners, relying heavily on Akeal Hosein, and is over-dependent on Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell for power hitting.

**Predicted XI for the first match**: Not specified in the article.

title: Steve Smith named captain of Washington Freedom for MLC 2024
body:
Washington Freedom, a Major League Cricket (MLC) franchise, has announced Steve Smith, the veteran Australian batter, as their captain for the MLC 2024 season. Known for his stellar leadership record with Australia, Smith brings a wealth of experience to the role, having led his national team to numerous victories in Tests, ODIs, and T20Is.

The franchise made the official announcement on social media platform X, where they welcomed Smith with the tagline, “Oh Captain, Our Captain, Smudge is all set to lead the Freedom squad for #MLC2024.”

Smith, renowned for his impactful performances in cricket leagues worldwide, previously captained IPL teams like Pune Warriors, Rising Pune Supergiants, and Rajasthan Royals. His leadership stint with Rising Pune Supergiants saw them reach the IPL 2017 final.

Previously, Moises Henriques, Smith's former teammate from Australia, led Washington Freedom in the MLC 2023 season, where the team reached the playoffs but fell short against inaugural champions MI New York. During that season, only one player, Matt Short, surpassed 150 runs for the franchise.
summary:
* Steve Smith, a veteran Australian batter, has been announced as the captain of the Washington Freedom franchise for the MLC 2024 season.
* Smith brings extensive leadership experience, having led Australia to numerous victories in Tests, ODIs, and T20Is.
* He has previously captained IPL teams, including Pune Warriors, Rising Pune Supergiants, and Rajasthan Royals, and led Rising Pune Supergiants to the IPL 2017 final.
* In the MLC 2023 season, Moises Henriques led Washington Freedom to the playoffs, but they were eliminated by MI New York.
* During the MLC 2023 season, only one Washington Freedom player, Matt Short, scored over 150 runs.

title: Shakib Al Hasan confirms participation in Pakistan Test series
body:
Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has confirmed that he will participate in a two-match Test series against Bangladesh beginning in August.

Right after the two-Test series against Pakistan, Bangladesh will play two Tests and three T20Is against India from September 19 to October 12 and Shakib is not sure whether he will be available for the series against the T20 World Cup winners or not.

Shakib has now commitments in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 starting onJuly 4 and Global T20 League Canada 2024 beginning on July 25, after which he will make a decision on his participation in the India series.

For now, Shakib is only focused on the red-ball series against Pakistan and will make further decisions after that.

“I don't have many plans. There are two T20 tournaments in front of me one is MLC and the other one is the Global T20 League in Canada and let me see where I stand after playing these two tournaments because I need to understand [how I feel],” Shakib was quoted as saying by Cricbuzz.

“There is international cricket and there is a series against Pakistan, and I am planning till that point of time and not planning beyond that. Now I don't have time to plan for three-four years and so planning for three to six months is better and later will think about my next plan and so till now I am planning till the Pakistan series,” he added.

None of Pakistan or Bangladesh have so far announced the squads for the series that will be played in the World Test Championship 2023-25 cycle.

It is worth mentioning that both Pakistan and Bangladesh recently participated in the T20 World Cup 2024. Babar Azam’s side suffered a group-stage exit but the Tigers made it to the Super 8 of the tournament.
summary:
* Shakib Al Hasan has commitments in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, which is scheduled to start on July 4.
* Shakib's participation in the MLC will affect his decision on whether to play in the Test series against India, which is scheduled to take place from September 19 to October 12.
* Shakib will make a decision on his participation in the India series after playing in the MLC and the Global T20 League Canada 2024, which begins on July 25.

Los Angeles Knight Riders: Martin Guptill, Jaskaran Malhotra, Alex Carey, Spencer Johnson, Saif Badar, Ali Sheikh, Andre Russell, David Miller, Unmukt Chand, Bhaskar Yadram, Ali Khan, Rilee Rossouw, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Sunil Narine (captain), Jason Roy, Shakib Al Hasan, Gajanand Singh, Lockie Ferguson, Adam Zampa, Nitish Kumar

Texas Super Kings: Rusty Theron, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Imran Tahir, Calvin Savage, Faf du Plessis (captain), Marcus Stoinis, Gerald Coetzee, Devon Conway, Milind Kumar, Zia Shahzad, Mohammad Mohsin, Matthew Tromp, Naveen-ul-Haq, Dwayne Bravo, Daniel Sams, Cody Chetty, Noor Ahmad, Sami Aslam, Mitchell Santner, Zia ul-Haq, Lahiru Milantha, Cameron Stevenson

Washington Freedom: Rachin Ravindra, Ian Holland, Akeal Hosein, Lockie Ferguson, Justin Dill, Jack Edwards, Lahiru Milantha, Andries Gous, Amila Aponso, Steve Smith (captain), Saurabh Netravalkar, Yasir Mohammed, Obus Pienaar, Glenn Maxwell, Akhilesh Bodugum, Marco Jansen, Mukhtar Ahmed, Andrew Tye, Travis Head

MLC 2024 Match Schedule and Format

The 25-match tournament will run from July 5th to 28th. Fans can expect a single round-robin format for the first 21 matches, followed by a thrilling playoff stage featuring an Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger, and the all-important final.

The first 15 matches will be split between Church Street Park in Morrisville and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. The final six league matches, along with all playoff games, will take place exclusively at Grand Prairie Stadium. The much-anticipated final is scheduled for July 28th (or July 29th at 6:00 AM IST).

Here’s the full schedule of MLC 2024:

When and Where to watch MLC 2024? (In India and Globally)

While broadcast details for India haven’t been officially announced yet, MLC 2023 was televised on Sports18 channels. For live streaming, fans in India can keep an eye on JioCinema, which held the rights in 2023. Cricadium will also be providing up-to-date scores and information throughout the tournament.

Cricket fans worldwide can celebrate, as MLC has secured an impressive international broadcast schedule. Pakistan, Australia, New Zealand, the Middle East, Africa, the United Kingdom, and Ireland will all have access to the matches. In the United States, fans can tune in on Willow by Cricbuzz, the YES Network, and additional RSNs to be announced. Canadian viewers can catch the action on Willow by Cricbuzz, while Prime Video holds the broadcasting rights in Australia and New Zealand. Cricadium will broadcast the matches in the Middle East and North Africa, while A Sports will bring MLC 2024 to Pakistani fans. Finally, TNT Sports has secured the rights for the tournament in the UK and Ireland.

How and Where to Purchase Tickets for MLC 2024?

Don’t miss your chance to witness the excitement of MLC 2024 live! Tickets for both Grand Prairie Stadium and Church Street Park are available for purchase through the MLC Ticket Portal. Starting at just USD 30, tickets offer an affordable way to experience the electrifying atmosphere of professional T20 cricket. Packages are also available for fans who want to attend multiple matches, including both regular season and playoff games. Tickets can be added to digital wallets for easy scanning at the venue, or fans can use the barcode from their confirmation email or print out a physical ticket.

With a star-studded lineup, a thrilling format, and global broadcast options, Major League Cricket 2024 promises to be an unforgettable event for cricket fans everywhere. So mark your calendars, grab your tickets (or tune in!), and get ready for a month of T20 fireworks!
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* The second season of MLC starts on July 5th and will run for a month until July 28th.
* The tournament features six teams with a single round-robin format for the first 21 matches, followed by playoffs.
* The final will take place on July 28th.

**Teams and Squads**

* The six teams participating in the tournament are MI New York, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco Unicorns, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
* The teams boast a star-studded lineup of international players, including Pat Cummins, Anrich Nortje, Glenn Maxwell, and Saurabh Netravalkar.

**Match Schedule and Format**

* The tournament consists of 25 matches, with the first 15 matches split between Church Street Park in Morrisville and Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.
* The final six league matches and all playoff games will take place at Grand Prairie Stadium.

**Broadcast and Streaming**

* The tournament will be broadcast globally in various countries, including India, Pakistan, Australia, New Zealand, the Middle East, Africa, the UK, and Ireland.
* In India, broadcast details are yet to be announced, but fans can expect live streaming on JioCinema and updates on Cricadium.

**Tickets**

* Tickets for the tournament are available for purchase through the MLC Ticket Portal, starting at USD 30.
* Fans can buy tickets for individual matches or packages for multiple matches, including regular season and playoff games.

title: Seattle Orcas onboard Veeam Software as principal sponsor for MLC 2024
body:
The Major League Cricket (MLC) team, Seattle Orcas have announced a sponsorship agreement with Veeam Software, a privately held US-based information technology company.

As part of the deal, the brand has been named the side’s principal sponsor for the upcoming season of MLC.

The development was announced by the Seattle-based team through its social media handles, with the caption, “We are thrilled to welcome @veeam_software as our Principal Sponsor for #MLC2024 ❗ Let’s support the transformation of cricket in the USA as #AmericasFavoriteCricketTeam, with @veeam_software protecting us with their resilience 💚”

Veeam Software is a small information technology firm situated in the United States, owned by Insight Partners. It creates backup, disaster recovery, and contemporary data protection solutions for virtual, cloud-native, SaaS, Kubernetes, and physical workloads. Veeam Software was created by two Russian entrepreneurs, Ratmir Timashev and Andrei Baronov.

While Veeam began by safeguarding data across virtualized workloads, it has now extended to secure data across a wide range of platforms, including AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Microsoft 365, Kubernetes, and more.
summary: The Seattle Orcas, a team in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament, has announced a sponsorship deal with Veeam Software, a US-based information technology company. As part of the agreement, Veeam Software will be the principal sponsor for the Orcas in the upcoming MLC 2024 season.

title: TruCare announce sponsorship deal ahead of MLC 2024
body:
The Major League Cricket (MLC) unit, Washington Freedom have announced a sponsorship agreement with the fast-growing provider of digital health products, Zyter|TruCare.

As part of the deal, the brand has been named Washington Freedom’s team sponsor for the upcoming MLC season, which will be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium near Dallas, TX and Church Street Park in Morrisville, NC, all across July.

The partnership was made by the Washington-based team through its social media handles, with the caption, “A partnership beyond the 22 yards. Thrilled to have Zyter|TruCare as a team sponsor.”

Zyter|TruCare is a rapidly expanding supplier of digital health solutions that boost cooperation, communication, and interoperability to raise the standard of care and cut costs. The business took home more than 50 honours in 2020, including Best Health Care and Medical Innovation and Company Innovation of the Year.
summary:
* The Washington Freedom team has announced a sponsorship deal with Zyter|TruCare, a digital health products provider, for the upcoming Major League Cricket (MLC) season.
* The MLC season will take place in July at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium near Dallas, TX, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, NC.
